However, I do apologize for the problems you encountered.  We always encourage our guests to mention any problems to front desk, I am sure our staff could have had options for you to accommodate you for your inconveniences. I hope this does not stop you from booking with us in the near future and hope we have a chance to redeem ourselves. Thank you.

Summary: Stayed in room with two queen beds. The  sheets on both beds had not been changed. This is disgusting and there was no lotion in the bathroom the soap was really old. Never will stay at this hotel again!!!!! They did not have breakfast ready at 6:00 am the room was locked.
Manager Response: I want to start by saying that we apologize for the inconvenience you had during your stay. We understand that you had issues during you stay at the Travelodge Anaheim Convention Center. As for the issues you had encountered, we do have a front desk open 24 hours for your service, I wished this could have been reported right away. With that being said, the front desk staff could have had given you great alternative options for any inconveniences you had at that time. Breakfast is ready at 6am to 10am. Now, if that breakfast door was not ready and open I apologize for that. I will definitely share this review with our breakfast team and let them be aware of the situation. Once again, we apologize and we hope that this does not stop you from booking with us again. In hopes that you can give us a chance to redeem ourselves and serve you like you deserve. Thank you and once again we apologize.

Summary: This place is a good value.  I imagine that when it was new - probably the 60's - it was one of the better motels in the area.  Now it's a bit run down, but they do try to keep it as nice as possible. I have had three separate rooms here and they have all been good.  No major problems.  I've read a few "horror stories" concerning the rooms and I HAVE NOT SEEN ANY OF THAT.  It's not fancy like places that charge $100+, but if you want to save $30 or more per night for a good, basic room and bath, this is the place.   I just stayed here the past five nights and the only compliant I have is that the free WiFi was VERY slow.  They need to install a better router.  P.S. It WOULD be nice if they could get their Jacuzzi fixed - for those nights after a long day at Disneyland. The
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We take these reviews seriously and we want you to know all these issues you have mentioned will be brought up to management. I want to apologize for the Wi-Fi issue, yes we are upgrading, so like I said, this will be one of the issues that would be brought up. As for the Jacuzzi, its a process and yes, we will be getting that fixed hopefully soon. For the breakfast you had mentioned, it is continental, you would have your basic amenities, coffee, milk, juice, cereal, oatmeal, waffles, etc. I'm sorry if it was not up to your standards. I thank you once again, for your review.

Summary: I definitely don't need all the amenities of fancier hotels, but i dont want to feel grossed out, either. I took off all the sheets on both beds (do this at every hotel I stay) and thank goodness there were no bed bugs. TV was old, that's fine. We never turned it on. The wall under the sink was falling off, my husband had to push the square piece back into the wall. The carpet is old, we kept our socks on. Bathroom walls, tub, toilet all had years worth of stains. Sink area had front piece falling off the wall. The breakfast was as expected. The attendant was very friendly, that's the reason for my 2 stars instead of 1. All in all, it was an OK place to rest our heads in between both days at Disneyland, but I think next time we'll pay a bit more to stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review. We strive to deliver a great guest experience, but it sounds as though we did not perform to our usual standards in this case. We are committed to delivering a clean, comfortable room and apologize for any failure in following through on that commitment during your recent stay. Please know the issues you experienced are an exception to our guest commitment and as such, we apologize. We sincerely apologize for your unpleasant stay due to the inconveniences you describe.  Thank you for your compliment of our breakfast attendant. Thank you once again, and we do apologize.

Summary Heading: Very happy with rooms as we have for most of our lives
Summary: This hotel is something of a dying breed in the Disneyland area.  A motel that has some character and some history.  Everything in the room was as we have expected.  The front desk staff were great as they always have been.  If you plan a  stay here be ready for what it is.  A well cared for older motor lodge.  The televisions are all new.  There are more than enough plug ins for all the chargers for tablets and the phones.  Beds are fine and room is spacious.  Wi-Fi is a problem at night after disneyland fireworks but with an LTE signal through my phone I am fine.   In a land of 200 dollar a night hotels it is nice to know I can get a good nights sleep for much less and still come to an area I have been visiting for 25 years.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your honest review. I am happy to know that you were happy with your stay. Let's us know that we are on a good track on providing excellent service and always serving our guests. I'm sorry to hear about the Wi-Fi signal you had experienced with, will make sure to bring that issue up with management so we can try and provide a better signal for everyone as well. Once again, thank you and we are glad that we had the chance to serve. I hope to see ya again soon!

Summary: Nothing special but for the price I suppose you cant beat it.  Free breakfast was ok but the rooms and beds were clean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time in writing this review. I'm sorry for falling short on your expectations. We hope you can book with us again to redeem ourselves. I'm glad that we can meet up to your cleanliness standards. We are always on new ways to improve and are continuously refreshing our bedrooms and facilities. we hope that this one experience does not discourage you from saying with us again in the future!

Summary: The Spa has been broken for 2 years now, rooms were being renovated and that just stopped. Some rooms do not even have new TV's or even a refrigerator. Maintenance moves the fridges around as some do not work and badly need replaced but never are. Floors are filthy! Walk around the room for a few minutes and your feet will be black. Used to be so nice and new owners do not give a rip anymore or have a lack of money to fix it.

This isn't the nicest or closest motel in the Disneyland resort area, but for the price it is pretty good. The room we stayed in was not fancy but clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was minimal and of poor quality. This motel is close enough to walk to the Toy Story parking lot to catch the Disneyland shuttle to the theme park. My husband and I used UBER to travel back and forth, it was less than $5 each trip. There is also a ART bus stop very close to this motel if you would like to use that instead. We really enjoyed the Carl's Jr restaurant across the street and there is a Mini Mart and liquor store on the same  block too. Overall if you are trying to save some money and are looking for a cheap and clean place to crash at the end of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to write your review. I apologize for the hotel and breakfast if it was not up to your standards. I do want to mention we are going to have renovations pretty soon and I hope with that done, you can give us another chance for you to book with us and be up to your standards this time. However, I am glad that you were able to enjoy your stay. Thank you once again.

Summary: The room was comfortable and was really close to everything in the area. I highly recommend it.
Manager Response: I want to start by saying thank you for such an honest and great review! We are happy that you were satisfied with your stay. Thank you for booking with us and letting us serve you. Once again, thank you for your feedback. We hope you book with us again soon!!

Summary: We stayed here on a recent trip to Disneyland, our room was very spacious and the room was very clean. We had an issue with the tv on the first night but someone quickly came and fixed it. The staff was friendly it is easily accessible to the bus that takes you to and from the park and there was ample parking. We will stay here again.
Manager Response: I want to say thank you for given us a great review. We are so happy that you were satisfied with your stay. I do apologize, though, for the inconvenience about the tv. I am glad that our staff was able to fix that for you. We are happy that you have decided to come back and book with us again! Cant wait to serve you once again, thank you.

Summary: Above average two star around the pleasantness of the Disney crowd.  Internet signal kept dropping on both my new high end Dell and Chromebook.  Front desk guy just blew me off on it; said no one else has complained.  Good coffee machine at breakfast.  Good Wyndham fast rewards value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your time to give us your feedback. I apologize for the inconvenience of the internet signal. We are under renovations, so we will update the Wi-fi as soon as we can. I also apologize for the customer service from the front desk. I will review this feedback with the front desk so we can improve on better service and be up to everyone's standard. Thank you once again, and we hope that this does not stop you from booking with us again! Thank you.

Summary: Place is falling apart. Shower leaked and they could not fix it that night. Air condition button had to be played with to get it to work. Holes in comforters and curtains. Was moved at 10:30 at night to another room. Only to have the hair dryer not work and got locked out of our room the second night when we were staying 3.
Great place for budget conscience families visiting the Disneyland area. Not to far a walk either!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for that great review. We are super excited to hear that you had a happy stay with Travelodge International Inn. We hope that you can book with us again! Thank you

Summary: The floor and walls were dirty and the appliances were very dated. As my wife I were trying to sleep the digital clock had a hissing noise coming from it as if it had a short in it. The rooms on the upper floors had no disability access  ( elevator ).  I was able to use the stairs but I thought that it was not good for someone who had a disability.
Manager Response: First, I want to apologize for the room that you had issues with. I wish you could have told one of our front staff so we could have accommodated you to another room if you needed a room with more access or because of the issues. I  hope that this doesn't stop you from returning to book with us. Once again, I apologize this issues. Thank you

Summary: Tons of cockroaches, dirty mattresses , The wifi kept going off,  I'm never staying here again !

In one night, we found two huge beetles in our room. Also, as we were headed to our room, someone below us screamed cockroach. The rooms are very old. The pool and hot tub don't work. The internet doesn't work. The staff at the front desk is very unpleasant. The only nice thing about this hotel is the sweet waffle lady!
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us a try during your recent trip to the Travelodge International Inn. We are so disappointed to hear you were not completely satisfied during your time with us. Unfortunately, our spa is under renovation, and pool is not heated, it's at its regular temperature. We are also looking to upgrade our Internet service, so we apologize for that. I will review this with out Front Desk Staff so we can improve on our service and meet our goals to give customer satisfaction not every guest that walks in to our lobby. Also, We always encourage our Guests to let us know if they are unhappy with their room. Our Front Desk Staff would have been happy to find an alternative room option for you. We are so saddened to hear your room did not meet the cleanliness standards we expect and we wish we would have had the opportunity to fix these issues to your satisfaction during your stay. We are always working on new ways to improve and are continuously refreshing our bedrooms and facilities. We hope this one experience does not discourage you from staying with us again in the future!

Summary: our toilet was clogged. After 2 phone calls to the front desk and an overnight wait time, a maintenance man came to fix the toilet. once we tried to use to toilet, we found that the clog still wasn't resolved.  we returned to the front desk to resolve the issue, and after a lot of back and forth, we were offered to switch rooms. we had to pack up all of our things, and change into a room which hadn't been cleaned yet. we were almost late to our event and the staff showed little sympathy.
Manager Response: I want to start by saying thank you for your feedback , we appreciate it. Also, I do apologize for the inconvenience of the clogged toilet, we could have had addressed this issue a little quicker, but I will talk to our Front Desk Staff so we can improve on our customer service and be up to our guests' standards. I am glad that after the move, you didn't have any other issue. Thank you for your review and we hope you can give us another chance for us to redeem ourselves and be at your service once again.

Summary: Overall, the room was fine.  It did appear the room wasn't completely ready for guests.  Was disappointed at the lack of fridge or microwave.  Can live without the microwave but a fridge seems basic.  If you need a soft mattress to sleep on, you'll wish you'd brought your own.  The mattresses are VERY firm.  Parking is a bit of a nightmare.  There are areas where parking is doubled up so you might have to wait for someone to be called to let you out.  We've arrived earlier and had no issue but arriving at midnight, parking is at a premium.  This wouldn't be my first choice of hotels but in a pinch its doable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. Would you mind clarifying as to how the room did not appear ready so that we may address this issue with the appropriate personnel. We apologize for the inconvenience you encountered with the fridge and will make sure to take inventory to address supply shortage. Once again we apologize for the inconveniences incurred during your stay and will make sure to address your concerns.

Summary: poor the place was not clean the only one that was helpful was the man who came an changed out the fridge I was told those were first come first serve. front desk staff was buy far the worse in customer service. don't ask for quarters for the laundry they will send you a block away to the gas station. The first room we had was the pit hole of the rooms that could have been offered the curtains were shredded and the carpet was nasty. the ada  bathroom was not safe for someone who actually needed it there was mildew and broken parts to the seat this was a room we paid over $80+ for and wasn't worth $50. the first night I booked direct through their sight and the other days through another sight I got the other 4 nights for $50 the staff did not clean the room. and left we towels
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that you had an unsatisfactory experience. We will make sure to address the issues you outlined to our staff so that we may provide a better experience to all guests. The deposit should be returned to you within a week to two as outlined in the form you signed at check-in. If you could provide further information on the room you stayed in so that we may inspect it we would gladly appreciate it.

Summary: The location was great for the Los Angeles Angeles game. We are big cubs fans and we won so everything was great.
Manager Response: We thank you for your time and feedback. We are glad you were happy about booking with in a close location to the Angels Stadium. Thank you for booking with us and we hope you book with us soon!

Summary: The location was awesome! The continental breakfast was average.  There was NO free shuttle like in was told by the front desk! The room was clean.
Manager Response: We thank you for your review.   As a focused service hotel, our hotel is ideal for families, groups and corporate travelers who appreciate a hotel that is clean, offers convenience and provides comfortable surroundings with service that is tailored to meet every guests needs.  We apologize for the miscommunication from our front desk for not being clear for the information given to you about the shuttles. Thank you once again!

Summary: When I checked in I was given the wrong keys so waited about 20 minutesn for them to figure which ones.  At night when we came back to sleep, there was no parking. Covers on beds were really dirty. Bathtub was dirty. Bed smelled. It was an uncomfortable stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am sorry to hear that you had a very unsatisfied stay with us. First, I want to say that we are going under renovations and so the locks on the rooms are being changed every other day. So I apologize for that and for the miscommunication at the front desk for the keys. Also, the parking in our property is very limited, so again, we are going through renovations to resolve our parking issues as well. As for the issues  you had with the covers, bathtub, and the smell you described, I wished you could have brought this up to out front desk agents so we could have accommodated you and maybe moved you rooms if that could have helped. Once again, I apologized for the experienced  you had. Thank you.

Summary: The hotel is basic, but clean and convenient. The only suggestion is that they need to purchase new towels and throw away the ones they have. They all feel like sand paper and some were weirdly stained.
Manager Response: I want to thank you for your time on writing this review and comments about hotel. We appreciate your suggestions about the towels in the rooms and will discuss these ideas with our team. I do apologize though for the towels not being up to your standard, but once again, I will discuss this with our management team since we are updating all rooms and room items! Great suggestions! Thanks again!

Summary Heading: THEY CHARGE FOR EXTRA CARS AND THEY CANNOT GUARANTEE PARKING!
Summary: The parking is AWFUL! And if you have more then 1 cars then they charge you an extra 15/day - and they can't guarantee parking! Too many cars and not enough spots. Terrible place - avoid at all costs! I woke up one morning, had to go to work, and was blocked in. Just a terrible situation.

Good location - able to walk to Disneyland, about 20 minutes. Price is right. Inn is a bit run down. Had problem with washroom toilet - hardly any water to flush. Water from shower head is minimal - taking longer time than normal to take shower Maintenance guy was very nice and helpful - he fixed the air conditioner and the toilet.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay with us. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and will help us continue to improve. It is our goal to always address Guest’s negative comments and resolve any issues to your satisfaction. We are so sorry we fell short of your expectations. Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay. We are happy that our Maintenance team had helped you our for those issues during your stay. We really hope you give us another try and allow us the opportunity to better serve you and your family in the future.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We had to switch rooms when we arrived because the sheets were dirty.  The room we were moved to was extremely run down, the lock on the door was loose, there was debris still on the floor, and the walls were paper thin.  We could here everything in the next room and the conversations outside.  The amenities in the bathroom were so old, the white on the toilet seat was rubbed off!
Front desk staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms are a little outdated, but comfortable overall.
Manager Response: I'm concerned about the in room issues you experienced at our hotel during your recent visit. I'm writing to thank you for taking the time to bring this matter to my attention.  Consequently, it's disappointing to learn that you're unhappy. I want you to know that the comments and suggestions we receive from our guests are taken seriously. They tell us what we're doing right, what we're doing wrong and how we can improve. Your willingness to share your recent experience is genuinely appreciated. Please be assured that the issues you've raised have been addressed, and the appropriate action has been taken.  Again, I want to thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us. We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: The place is really close to a Disney parking lot with shuttle service and of course the price is attractive but there were a lot of cockroachs all over the room! Definitely not coming again! Please get fumigation

Ok the room was ok food was ok can't bear the price but did have one problem had roaches said I'd we want to move but it was one bed so no. Should have gjvem a discount  but overall  I was happy. Only a 5 m I n drive to the disney parking shuttle  will take u back and forth

It was cheap....paid $45/night...close to the convention center...free waffles in the morning...free yucky coffee and watered down orange flavored sugar water...had to move rooms because my old tube TV didn't work...new room had a good TV, fridge and microwave...brought my own bedding and towels...saw 2 cockroaches...but I would stay again for $45/night...I got what I paid for...

Terrible place! Disgusting smell as soon as you open the door,witch gave me a asthma attack after the 1st day. When you go to the bathroom you can not turn the light on other wise will make a huge noise. The light on top of the sink was broken,the Internet didn't work,2 o'clock in the morning  there were people talking so loud outside of their rooms on hallway and there was no security to say nothing to them and they couldn't find the key for the safe. So my overall experience there was TERRIBLE TERRIBLE ! After my 1st night there,i asked to move to another room and they said they had no more rooms available. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!

We enjoyed our stay! The room was a good value for the decent price I received through my work discount. I would recommend staying there as it was cheap, clean and the rooms were always cleaned by the time we returned we night.

This hotel is a 20+ minute walk to Disneyland. What many don't know is that it is just a 5+ minute walk to the free shuttles in the Toy Story parking lot just a little bit North. There are also several fast food places and convenience stores nearby. Target is around a 15 minutes walk away.  In terms of the hotel, it's pretty much just a place to sleep. For our purposes, it did it's job well. They have continental breakfast and the staff is friendly.

Summary Heading: Works for someplace decent to stay
Summary: When looking for someplace affordable to stay,  that is somewhere close to the Anaheim Convention Center,  the Travelodge fits the bill . There are no bells and whistles. The room is spacious and clean.  it has a  coffee maker,  a small refrigerator and microwave. Parking is limited but is free.  there is a continental breakfast,  that is basically coffee, juice,  cereal,  miniature muffins and Belgian waffles. Furnishings are kind of outdated the room is nothing spectacular but it works and it is within walking distance to both Disneyland and the convention center . there is a Denny's right next door , a chicken and waffles place and some nicer restaurants . we were there for a cheerleading championship and everyone else paid a lot more money for their rooms than we did .

Seeing the entrance and lobby I expected the room to follow through.  The room smelled old and there was a plastic bag holding on to the smoke detector.  Took me 15 minutes to get a parking spot, very small space.

I chose this particular hotel because of the amenities, specifically pool,  hot tub, gym,  free WiFi,  and free breakfast.  At check in I found out that the hot tub is broken (and had been for quite some time according to security) and there was no gym!  The WiFi was pointless! We had to continually login every 2 minutes,  making work very difficult.  It was easier to use my phones data!  When it came time for breakfast,  I hope all you want is white toast or waffles.  There were no bagels, nor a single piece of fruit. The mattresses were the worst hotel beds I'd ever slept on!  I do not recommend this place.

Great location and large rooms. We had 2 rooms in which 1 was renovated and 1 was not. I was told upon making reservations that all rooms were renovated. I was a bit unhappy because of that but otherwise happy with my stay.

Air conditioner was VERY noisy.  Toilet ran ALL the time.  Phone didn't work.  Internet connection would come and go.  Water smelled like sulphur.  One afternoon the water was shut off and we were not notified,  we found out when our toilet wouldn't flush.  Not enough parking when the hotel was completely full.  Breakfast was pretty meager.  On the positive,  beds were comfortable,  room was clean,  staff was pleasant,  and value was good. Maybe if they did some repairs we'd stay there again.

The hotel was close to the convention center and Disneyland.  This was very convenient, however, the towels were rough and the sink stink like sewer.  It was nice for the price that we payed, but also the water broke and we were not able to shower for a while.
Cockroach, dirty shower and wells, and gross build up/film and water spots throughout room.  Set us up for Disney but was definitely not magical.

Room was duty and service was aweful. I felt like I was an intruder when I first checked-in. I tried asking questions about the Disney shuttle and was given one word answers. One of the beds had a used condom under the sheet. It was disgusting and we ended up sleeping in the car. The breakfast was alright except the lady in charge was very rude and bossy.

the room seems a bit beat up walls needed patching, no hot water for the sink, they had to replace the refrigerator, and the door didn't close properly, it looked like it didn't fit right, cause there was light coming through. During the morning when breakfast was served from 6am till 10am, it was extremely noisy because are room was right next door. You also couldn't bring breakfast back to your room, you had to eat it there. just a few hitches, probably stay there again but not in same room.

I had not stayed at this hotel for several years, due to a lost reservation problem back then. The hotel is very close to the convention center and for the price is an excellent value. We booked 8 rooms and everyone seemed happy. One issue with water pressure, but they moved to another room without issue. Rooms were clean and quite. Breakfast is pretty lame (all carbs), but there is a Denny's next door and plenty of alternative options. I enjoyed this stay for the most part. Only had one issue with a charge for two of the room for just one night. I had forgotten my Wyndham credit card and had to have it over-nighted, since they can't use the card from the reservation (which I kind of get). Had two nights that were charged to another card, but was told by one manager that those

stayed 3 nights for the trade show at the convention center.  great walking distance location.  clean, comfortable rooms.  no noise problems.  good front desk.  easy parking.  would definitely stay again next year

I appreciated the help I received from the people in the office.  They were very courteous and people oriented, making my stay comfortable and relaxing.  Thank you!  PS - The only problem that occurred was the internet connection, which was not very strong.  I would recommend making it better and easier to connect to.  The office made an attempt to reset the internet, but it was not successful - in that it was still a weak signal.  I appreciated their effort.

Where do I start? Parking was limited, and difficult. The bathroom, although very large, did not have the advertised bathtub, only a shower. The light on the phone was blinking, but the phone did not have a dial tone. The bed and/or bedding smelled of cigarette smoke. In the bathroom, it could use a hand towel rack by the sink, and a larger soap dish or a shelf in the shower. The internet connection dropped every 15 minutes or so. I am very upset that I did not get the rate that I confirmed. I have two charges on my credit card, for the exact total, and for another total about $8.00 less. It may be a hold, but if it was, it would have dropped off by now. I considered going back on my next trip to Orange County, but I will reconsider after this.

This hotel was not what it was written to be. The pool hot tub was broken, the review said "2 blocks" from disney (it was really a couple miles). The refrigerator wouldn't work if the microwave was on. Most of the outlets were to lose to keep anything plugged in and charging or working for that matter. Toilet over flowed, sink was very dirty as soon as we walked into it at check in and the tub took over an hour to drain after 1 shower. Pillows are extremely lumpy bottom of our feet were black after walking only a little while in bear feet on the carpet.

Summary Heading: Okay for the price we paid
Summary: My in laws got us a stay here for our Disneyland trip. They booked on Hotwire and paid right under $50/night per room, which is a bargain for the area. The room was serviceable but nothing fancy. My in laws were in room 101, which had not been upgraded and we were in 102, which had been. Our room had a flat panel tv, there's had a tube tv, but furniture was essentially the same in both rooms. Beds were comfortable, pillows good.   I did not have any bug problems, but the carpets were dirty enough to make our socks and feet black if we weren't wearing shoes.   The distance to the park wasn't too bad. Most days we took the toy story shuttle, but we did walk for the magic morning and it was very do-able for two adults pushing two heavy strollers.   Overall, it was fine, but I
Great location to the Disneyland parks. Staff was friendly.  The walls were a little thin so it was loud at night.

Booked this hotel last minute through the Wyndham site. Chose this for its location, real close to the convention center where I had an event I was attending. Again, location wise, it's great ! Close to eating places, Disneyland, and the Anaheim Convention Center.  The room is basic, old and had a musky smell. Had to leave the door open the afternoon I checked in to let the smell out. A/C didn't really work, was blowing air, but not cold air. The bathroom. Well, when I opened the shower door there were tiny bugs crawling all over the wall and ceiling. I had to turn the hot water on real high and blast the critters off the wall before I got in to use it. After I got out of the shower, the tiny bugs appeared again. I did notify the front desk about it when I checked out.  I don't

This hotel is far from 5 stars.  The room was clean, but you could plainly see the patch jobs in the sheet rock.  The beds were new, and the shower worked.  With it being a 5 minute walk to the shuttles for Disneyland, the only time we were in the room was to sleep.  It worked great for that.  It was just as nice as some other hotels in the area that you would pay double the price for.  Hotel staff was nice, and the breakfast was ok.  Would stay here again.

Decent hotel that could use some upgrades. Continental breakfast was limited to waffles, toast, and small muffins. Coffee and juice served as well. The pool is small and the hot tub was not functioning during our stay. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

As the GM at a Wyndham property myself, I expected more from this motel/hotel.  With the exception of  the Breakfast Attendant, all staff members that I dealt with were very professional and courteous.  However, the property is quite run down and needs attention from the business owners.  The list of things not up to standards with the guest room was as long as my arm....Huge hole in the wall, stains on the ceiling and walls, bathroom fan worked at it's convenience etc.  Just in great need of some updating.   My family stayed at this Travelodge a few years ago and it was very nice so we were expecting the same this time.  It appears that it's not been maintained over the years and there is even a security guard in the parking lot now.  Many of the guests we saw appeared to be

We got a great deal on this room, but we all know that we get what we pay for. For the price we paid, the room was acceptable. By no means a luxury accommodation, it had clean sheets and a shower, which was all we needed.  Location to Disneyland is great, and we were able to find a parking spot each evening, so overall, a good value.
My stay at the Travelodge was very  pleasant as always. staff is very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel when visiting Anaheim :)
Staff was not very friendly I informed a female employee of toilet backups (2) and a broken shower curtain rod and she couldn't have cared less

Summary Heading: Good choice if on a budget
Summary: The hotel covers most of the important bases, it was clean, comfortable and quiet.  I liked it because the parking is interior to the hotel and not easily seen from the street.  They also have a guard there and I felt safe.  For me, the bed was a bit soft but I still slept well.  A typical breakfast with waffles and such and the internet worked but was very slow at times.   The hotel is very close to Disneyland (a short drive).
Manager Response: We want to take the time to apologize for your stay and to let you know that we are in the process of renovation. I will let my team know about your concerns and guarantee that all of these issues are addressed. We wished you would of let us know of these problems while you were here to upgrade you and take care of the problem right there in there since we do have a third party company that deals with any sort of pest found.

Summary: It wasn't the nicest hotel, but enjoyed being able to go to Disneyland without it being too expensive.  It's a nice place to stay, especially since we only slept in the room.  Would stay here again. My only complaint is that the room got stuffy at night.  Wish the air would keep running instead of turning off all of the time.

Sticky carpet, dirt and dust on top of coving in Bath, little bit of mold in bathroom and the very pungent order of cleaning supplies overpowering the musty smell that showed up second day made the room creepy to stay in.  I was disappointed to say the most.

We were part of a large group and whilst my room was fine, many others in the group had problems with hot water, one had their front door almost off its hinges. Several people were given different rooms. Not what I would expect from a reputable chain. Otherwise it is very handy for Disneyland.

Dirty rooms, clogged toilet with no maintenance personnel on site, one bathroom fan sounded like there was jack hammering going on in our room and there were cockroaches on the wall. We had to switch rooms 3 times within 2 hours and ultimately ended up switching hotels. The last room we were in was even in the "renovated" part of the hotel. The room itself looked nicer than any of the other rooms we had been in at this hotel, but it was also the room that we saw two cockroaches on the wall and where the fan in the bathroom sounded like very loud jack hammering. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anybody! Dirty and disgusting!

I've traveled around the world and back, this is the worst hotel I've ever seen. There was food left on the counter when we checked into the room, toiletries left in the bathroom. The second night black hairs on our pillows. The hot tub was ice cold. This place seriously sucks.

Summary Heading: Location is good. Very close to Disneyland. Room was clean...
Summary: Location is good. Very close to Disneyland. Room was clean, but refrigerator didn't work. Hotel maid went thru my girlfriend's large purse that she left on the table inside our room and stole $100 from it. Unfortunately, my GF didn't know about it until one day after we checked out. I called and reported to the hotel staff about the incidence, but only received a response from the staff that she would check with House keeper to see if they can retrieve the money, of course not, I never receive a return call from hotel staff.

We stayed for seven nights and enjoyed the stay.  This is our second time staying here and was even better this time.  The room 137 was spacious and comfortable.  The TV was a new flat screen also.  I wish I had brought my chrome cast to stream movies.  The price was perfect also.

We stayed here for my family trip to Disneyland. We stay all day and night at the parks so we generally use our room for just sleep. It served its purpose. When I arrived I asked if I could have a room on the 1st floor since my mother who was traveling with us is disabled and I was told that all the 1st floor rooms were equipped with king size beds only which (was a lie because I've stayed on the first floor with 2 queen beds plenty of times) but after a little while she said "oh I do have something" and gave us a 1st floor room. We also had an issue with our toilet over flowing but that got taken care of right away.

I do not expect a hotel with this star rating to be anything but basic.  However, cleanliness is a basic requirement and we saw three cockroaches in our room.  COCKROACHES!  Absolutely unacceptable.  I notified the front desk staff and they allowed me to inspect a new room and we agreed to move.  I just couldn't get over it though.  I barely slept because I was so worried another cockroach would crawl across my hand.

We stayed here early February of 2016. We walked in to get a room for the one night. Got a room, included free breakfast and free Wifi.  The Wifi did not work at all during our stay. The door to our room did not close. Not only did the door not stay shut, it also did not lock. We had to use our suitcases to keep it closed.  We had people screaming up and down the hallway, slamming their doors to the rooms all night.  I will not be going back. The hotel staff did nothing to accommodate any of the issues we had.
Manager Response: I'm concerned about the in room issues you experienced at our hotel during your recent visit. I'm writing to thank you for taking the time to bring this matter to my attention. I would also like to apologize on behalf of the hotels staff for being unable to accommodate you accordingly. Consequently, it's disappointing to learn that you're unhappy. I want you to know that the comments and suggestions we receive from our guests are taken seriously. They tell us what we're doing right, what we're doing wrong and how we can improve. Your willingness to share your recent experience is genuinely appreciated. Please be assured that the issues you've raised have been addressed, and the appropriate action has been taken. In response to the rooms conditions I would like to inform you that our new management has made it a priority to renovate the hotel immediately. Again, I want to thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us. We look forward to serving your future lodging needs.

Summary: The room was very comfortable,Disneyland was just a short walk away ,the staff were very obliging and the free breakfast was great Can't ask for more than that  Would stay here again and are planning to  The staff were very friendly nothing was to much trouble  Water power in bathroom could of been a bit better but nothing to complain about
Manager Response: Dear Linda L. On behalf of our hotel staff, I am writing to let you know how delighted we were  to receive your kind words of praise. It's truly rewarding when a guest recognizes our staff’s efforts, and takes the time to say thank you. The principal goal of our hotel is to provide dependable service to all of our guests at reasonable prices. Let me thank you for your kind words.  We're committed to total guest satisfaction, and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: You get for what you pay for...
Summary: The WiFi as mentioned in previous comments does not work. The place was there just to sleep and that's it. The shower tub did not drain so the water settled and it was nasty. The only good thing was the TV upgrade. The place looks like the paint was peeling and old but it's just a place to crash and that's it for the price I got it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We understand the WiFi is very limited, in response to this issue we are in the progress of upgrading our WiFi and our equipment to better improve our guests connection. In regards to the room conditions we are currently in progress for room renovations as well.

Summary Heading: SANDRA MAKES THE TRAVELODGE IN ANAHEIM GO FROM GOOD TO EXCEPTIONAL
Summary: The room is very comfortable, quiet, safe and great parking.  Sandra is what really makes this place happen.n She is extremely professional, helpful and super nice.  You will not be disappointed for the price.
Manager Response: Dear Damon B. It's truly rewarding when a guest recognizes our staff’s efforts, and takes the time to say thank you. On behalf of our hotel staff, I am writing to let you know how delighted we were to receive your kind words of praise. It's truly rewarding when a guest recognizes our staff’s efforts, and takes the time to say thank you. The principal goal of our hotel is to provide dependable service to all of our guests at reasonable prices. Let me thank you for your kind words. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Outdated, broken, people behind desk are pleasant but ineffective
Summary: The room was expensive for what you get (they jacked up the rates because it was during a large convention center event). My room had an air conditioner that was unplugged; I plugged it in, and it was inoperative. I tried to call the desk, and got no answer. I went down and asked for maintenance (or a new room) and was told that someone would be up to fix it in an hour. I went to dinner, came back 2 hours later. Nothing. I went back down, was told they would have someone there shortly. A guy came, spoke no/little English (but enough to get by). Opened the unit, fussed with it, and got it to come on. However, none of the knobs would do anything, so the A/C ran full-blast the entire time I stayed there (3 days.) I didn't dare touch it, as not to make it turn off - but really?
Manager Response: We would like to apologize for the inconvenience you encountered during your stay. We will ensure our maintenance staff responds in a timely manner when addressing room concerns. If you would be able to provide us with further room information, by contacting us at 2060travelodge@gmail.com at your earliest convenience, so that we may proceed with working on the issues you encountered. We appreciate your input.

Summary Heading: what the heck was I thinking
Summary: I could literally kick myself for agreeing to terms on hotwire. This roper came up as my "blind choice" and I immediately tried to get out of it.  The people at the front desk were nice, but that is the only positive thing I can say about this hotel. Non smoking room smelled like a cigarette disposal dump. Went to turn on the ac unit and it blew even more disgusting smoke. Was told they were booked up so I couldn't be moved. Beds were so old, they sunk down about 8 inches. I thought it was a waterbed. Internet was free, but alas was non exsisting. I was stuck with having to endure this god awful room for the night. Windows and walls are all paper thin. I felt like I was sleeping in the parking lot, I could hear a much. I just prayed I could get at least 6 hours of sleep I blame
Manager Response: We are saddened to hear about your experience with our hotel. It is concerning to us that you were provided with a room that smelled of smoke when we are known to be a non-smoking property. We will ensure to work with our housekeeping and maintenance staff to further prevent such an issue. Should there be any other feedback that we can learn from we would greatly appreciate hearing from you. Feel free to contact us at 2060travelodge@gmail.com . On behalf of Travelodge, we apologize for the inconvenience you encountered.

Summary: Location=Great. but thats it. first night, no internet, so i call the front desk and they tell me they will reboot the modem, still no internet, next morning, no internet, go to front desk and they tell me they will reboot the modem, I told them that didn't work before so i dont think that is the problem, no internet, come back from meetings, really need to send reports, no internet. go to front desk, they tell me.....you guessed it. reboot the modem. I gave up and made my phone a hot spot for the rest of the week.  Room wise, holes in the curtains, bedsheets, carpet from the 90's, i prepaid from expedia so there was no chance of leaving and getting a refund. Would NOT stay there again! Anaheim is full of motels, pick another one.....
Manager Response: Dear Dale P.  I'm concerned about the internet issues you experienced at our hotel during your recent visit. I'm writing to thank you for taking the time to bring this matter to my attention. Consequently, it's disappointing to learn that you're unhappy. I want you to know that the comments and suggestions we receive from our guests are taken seriously. They tell us what we're doing right, what we're doing wrong and how we can improve.  Your willingness to share your recent experience is genuinely appreciated. Please be assured that the issues you've raised have been addressed, and the appropriate action has been taken. Again, I want to thank you for taking the time to share your concerns with us.

Summary Heading: you can only do so much
Summary: stayed there for Star Wars Half Marathon weekend at Disneyland Positives: -ART to park easy to use -Waffles at free breakfast were very good -low price  Opportunities:  -Asked about the free race transportations, told incorrectly, so spend $12 a person on tickets that should have been free.  Also told to go to the hotel across the street to purchase tickets for ART -room was dirty.  Feet were black the first day when I was barefoot -had large stains on the sheets of one of the beds.  Was corrected after I ask the sheets to be changed at the front desk -the door had insulation coming out of the top and all over the floor.  I had asked 4 different times for this to be taken care of.  FOUR. and it never was.  I brought pictures to the front desk and showed them exactly the problem.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback you have provided. We would like to take the time to apologize for what was not done during your stay. I will make sure my team is better informed of upcoming events to provide accurate information to our guest. As for the ART there are certain places that sell the tickets and unfortunately we are not one of them, that is why they probably recommended you to go across the street to the disney welocme center.

Summary: when i first arrived i noticed there was a stain on one pillow which i was willing to forgive as i had six pillows on two beds to choose from but things just got worse from there ! One of the drapes had a large slash down it, then when i returned from my trip to disney that night i tried to plug in my apple chargers to charge my devices only one outlet in the room would hold the charger in the outlet, then i tried to log into the WiFi but if i was further from the door there was no connection at all ! I mean come on we are in the year 2016 people will want to be on WiFi !  the next morning i awoke already feeling that this hotel was a mistake so wanting to get started on my day i went to take a shower the controls for the shower were so shoddy and weak i feared if i wasnt very
Manager Response: We are very sorry to hear that your stay was not up to our standards, We want to let you know that we have begun remodeling since the hotel is now under new management. We would like to extend this invitation for you to give us the opportunity in serving you once again.

Summary: I stay here three or four times a year when I visit Disneyland and the LA area. I have never had a bad stay. The beds are comfy and the rooms clean. The breakfast room is about average but with a highlight of hot waffles being cooked(not toasted) for you.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and feedback. We love to know what is working for us and what is not. Happy to know you are happy with our services and cant wait for you to come back. As for our breakfast we rather take the time in doing fresh waffles to offer nothing but the best for our guest and we are currently working on our breakfast options to have more variety.

Summary: This is a no frills accommodation. The rooms are dark, the carpet is questionable, and safety is concerning. Our door (room 330) didn't lock on the inside very well (we had to physically lift the door by the handle to be able to turn the bolt lock), and there was a permanent gap between the door and the door frame. The water pressure to the shower was decent and the hot/cold worked well! The toilets were another issue -- it never seemed like you could flush the whole thing. It clogged up multiple times and there was no plunger in the room!  If you are going to be out and about most of your visit, this hotel is sufficient, and AFFORDABLE, but severely outdated. Wyndham should really consider doing a major upgrade!
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about the issues you had in the room, i will make sure that my maintenance team gets on it asap. As to our rooms we have started doing some remodeling so most of your concerns will be looked at. We would like to extend an invitation to you to come back and give us the opportunity of showing you our improvements.

Summary: I don't write review often but I want to warn anyone who is thinking of staying here. I read some other reviews on here before booking that mentioned roaches and thought that I would take the chance to save the money. I regret that decision. This hotel is disgusting. I saw plenty of roaches over my three day stay. There were roaches in the microwave. There were roaches near our bed. There were roaches in the bathroom. The room looked dirty and there were holes in the wall. The carpet was also dirty. The toilet clogged each time we used it. It was the worst experience that I have ever had with a hotel.
Manager Response: We want to take the time to apologize for your stay and to let you know that we are in the process of renovation. I will let my team know about your concerns and guarantee that all of these issues are addressed. We wished you would of let us know of these problems while you were here to upgrade you and take care of the problem right there in there since we do have a third party company that deals with any sort of pest found.

Summary: The price was right.  But the roaches were there.  Seems like they would spray the room every day with the usual bug spray and you can smell that!  Now, would I stay there again?  Time will tell.  Again, price to what you get is my concern.
Manager Response: We want to apologize that your stay wasn't up to our standards and want to guarantee that we will be on the problem asap. We need feedback like this in order to fix things that are being brought up to our attention. Currently we are remodeling and working on the hotel since it is working with new management. We hope you will come back and give us a the opportunity to a great stay.

Summary: Location, location, location...  It is a toss up for some people as to wether this is close to Disneyland or not. It is literally the last property on the southern end of the Resort Corridor; the cut off is Orangewood Ave. So is it close? I think so.  --It is a 1.1 mile walk to the maingate of Disneyland, one-way. --Just over a quarter mile to the Toy Story satellite parking lot hub, one-way. --Just steps away from the ART bus stop at the front of the motel. --There is a shuttle to and from the parks, but we've never used this service as we find it too intermittently slow for our liking.  At this location, you have transportation choices and that is a small plus for my party and myself. You have to ask yourself and your party if walking the distance once or twice per day is
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the feed back you have provided and by highlighting the good / bad for our hotel. You are correct we are a very short distance to Disney and have different transportation services that can make your vacation easier. As for parking we guarantee one parking space per room as there is no extra charge for parking. So our parking is FREE!! and we have just added more parking to our lot since we know it can get a little tough here and in our surroundings. Also we do have  security now that helps with the parking situation. You mention about the rooms we are currently in the process of remodeling them since we are under new management. We extend an invitation for you and your family to come back !!

Summary: Has limited parking. Carpet,bedding,tv, everything outdated. Turned on the faucet and a bug/roach ran on the counter. Next morning i saw another on the bed. Room 329.
Manager Response: We want to extend our apologize for the experience you recently had with us and would like to let you know the hotel is now under new management and is working hard to remodel and update our rooms. As for parking we have added extra spots in our lot to help with the parking situation. We hope you would consider us for your future stays and give us the opportunity to show you the upgrades we have been working on.

Summary: Booked this hotel because the hotel we usually stay at raised their prices overnight by $50.  Like I said in the title it is nothing special and for $70 it was fine for us.  Just need a bed to sleep on.  The breakfast was nothing special just wish it had more options.  Would stay here again for the price but it is $90 or more I would look for another hotel.  It not worth that price.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for your review, this is what helps us improve by getting feedback from our guest. Breakfast is free and is continental breakfast currently we are offering fresh made waffles, toast, pastries, cereal, oatmeal, juices, coffee and milk. Our prices are always very affordable and the rooms come with various amenities that our guest might find helpful. Such as free parking, Wifi, free local calls, free breakfast and walking distance to Disney and the convention center.

Summary Heading: Glad the hotel wasnt as bad as some said
Summary: We had a pleasant stay for the two nights we were there. The room was not smelly , rather smelled like laundry drying. No bugs in sight. I was real concerned about the bed bug that was mentioned on a few of the bad reviews. only complaint that i would bring up would be the lack of communicate between staffs and their customer service wasnt all that great. She charged my card the full amount and left my account on a -25.00. I was suppose to pay half card/ money. I was already told by the check in lady that we were going to do that. Im assuming it wasnt in their system. I would def come back. Next hotel with the shuttles to disneyland just 5 mins away.
Manager Response: We are happy to hear that you had a good stay here with us and we would love to have you again. Some of the review mentioned from pest are very old and we want to let you know that we do have a third party company that is available just in case there is any issues or complaints for any pest. We are under new management and are starting to remodel the rooms as well. I want to personally apologize for the misunderstanding you had with my front desk staff regarding the type of payment you had chosen to use. Just for future reference all payments must be made at check in time and if any special request are to be made such as split payments they need to be taken care of at check in. I will assure you that i will let me staff know about this immediately so we can prevent this from happening again. Hope to see you back soon.

Summary Heading: Don't care how cheap it was, it should have never been this bad!
Summary: The hotel constantly has their hot tub out of order. I stayed at this hotel about 4 months ago and it was an ok stay but the hot tub was out. 4 months later the hot tub was still out of order. I asked them why and they told me they do not want to buy the expensive part to make the hot tub work. Honestly that is just a slum lord move. The room we stayed in 4 months ago was acceptable but the room they gave us for this last trip was disgusting. There was blood stains on my sheets for crying out loud. The towels had black stains on them. The carpet made my feet black. the bathroom was hideously painted with white and blue splatters. Fingerprints and smudges on the mirror. ( I mean come on - how hard is it to take a wipe to the mirror?) Breakfast was pretty much non existent.
Manager Response: We want to thank you for your feedback as we are currently working on our rooms. We are under new management and want to know what are the things that need improvement. We also want to take the time to apologize for the previous experience you have had with us. As stated above we are remodeling and updating our hotel with our new management.

Summary: There was not enough parking to accommodate all of the people staying at the hotel.  We had to park in the Handicap Parking the night we stayed there.  Also, the bathroom shower curtain rod was not positioned properly to keep the shower curtain in place, so there was a puddle of water on the floor when the shower was used.  Otherwise, the hotel was average for the price.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your review and your feedback. Parking is a very big issue here in the surrounding area, but we are working on that as we only allow one vehicle per person and we have recently added more parking spots to our lot. Not only have we added more but we now have a security guard at night that helps situate with the whole parking situation. As for the curtain in the shower i will notify my maintenance staff so they can get on it asap. We would of loved for you to let us know while here so we could of fixed everything for you on the spot. Thank you for the opportunity and we would love to see you soon.

Summary: My sister and I booked a room at the Travelodge for Disneyland, since it was within walking distance to the park.  No bugs, as per other reviews.  However, the toilet had a broken handle and didn't flush.  I called the main desk to switch rooms, but they just sent the maintenance guy to the room instead.  Also, when showering, the vent goes on and off.  Interesting stay....
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, and i am glad to hear that my maintenance team was able to fix the toilet problem for you. As for the vent that is how they are programmed, when showering steam is created and that is when the vent goes off to prevent mold from occurring. Our park is conveniently located one mile from the park and Disney offers the ART shuttle that stops right out side from our hotel. Hope to see you back soon!

Summary: Everything in the Room Was so old some things were even rusty the shower was broken hair under the bedspread , bedspread and pillows were old room was smelly the breakfast attendant lady was so rude! Horrible experience literally I just paid so I wouldn't have to sleep out n the street!!
Manager Response: We are very sorry about your experience here with us. At this time we want to update you that the hotel is now under new management and we would love for you to give us the opportunity to better your experience with us.

Summary Heading: Sleeping in your car would be better
Summary: Roaches, overflowing toilets, heating and a/c units broken, burning smell due to  heaters broken, doors not able to lock properly, vending machines destroyed, yellow stains on sheets.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that you had such a bad experience with us, and would like to thank you for the feedback so we can get on it and fix all of these problems. We would of loved for you to let us know about all of this while your stay so we could of fixed everything and accommodated your needs. We would like to take this opportunity to let you know our hotel is under new management and things are being updated. We hope you would try is out again so we can make up for the past visit.

Summary: 5 minute walk to the Disneyland parking lot where you take a shuttle into the park. Comfortable and clean beds, free parking, free continental breakfast. Not as fancy as other hotels, but for the price it is worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review, people like you is what helps us improve and also know what is working for us and our guest! Our location is a short  minute walk to the convention center and Disney theme park. We offer free parking, breakfast and wifi. There is a shuttle conveniently located outside of the hotel that is only $5.00 a day for as many rides back and forth you desire. Once again thank you for your business and we cant wait for you to come back!

Summary Heading: Good value if you are not planning on hanging out at the hotel
Summary: Pros: Only a block away from the Toy Story parking lot, which provides a free shuttle to the park.  Free continental breakfast Walking distance to restaurants  Cons: Ants in the bathroom Checking in took way too long Noise level outside if the room woke my family up numerous times during the night Waited outside in the rain for 20 minutes ringing the bell in order to check out
The price was right but the property is really run down and needs maintenance. It was raining the last day of our stay and there was a water leak from the ceiling in the bathroom.

Summary Heading: I've Had Worse. It's a Decent Place.
Summary: I'd say most of the reviews here are likely accurate - except maybe for the one and five star outliers.) This is not a deluxe motel by any means.  It probably was in 1965 - and could be so again with some work (it looks nice on the outside.) But what it is is adequate.  It's not a bad place for the money - and the money I paid was $30 less per night than I paid at the nearby Motel 6 three months ago.  The price was about 1/3 of the average price of motels in the area.  It's in a good, safe area, is on the numbers 1 and 2 bus lines that go straight to Disneyland's maingate every 20 minutes or so, and is right next to a Denny's for breakfast if one wants more than waffles.  My room was nice enough, large with two queen beds.  The one I used was very comfortable.  There was a TV
This hotel needs to be updated!! Window pains missing!! Super loud!! And the coffee is disgusting!! We will never stay here again!! You get what you pay for in this situation!! Never again!!

Hotel had great location within walking distance to Disney and right next to a Denny's.Easy to find,however the room I checked into smelled strong of cigarette/marijuana smoke although it was advertised as a no-smoking room.I checked in and as soon as I walked into the room smelt the putrid smell and notified the front desk which did nothing even tho I had told them I had my two children ages 6 and 2 with me.It comes down to you get what you pay for

Our hotel room was a clean basic room with two queen beds we had a microwave and  fridge. The  fridge froze everything in it. Breakfast in the morning was decent. I never went over to get breakfast. However my kids came back to the room with  orange juice, apple juice and waffles. Parking was an inconvenience. The parking lot was so full some guests double parked. I went to the front desk and asked,   where could I park? They gave me a pass to put on my dash and said to park next door in the  Denny's parking lot. I was tired from walk all day in Disneyland, it was late and it was 48° outside.  I had a nice parking before I came back from Disneyland but we got hungry and went to go get a bite to eat. When I came back no parking.

Summary Heading: For the price it wasn't bad
Summary: The rooms could use some work. But it was clean and a place to lay our heads.  Breakfast was good.

Serious parking problems. People at the desk were nice, even if not terribly knowledgeable. Given keys to a room that already had people in it.  The folks at the front desk made the switch.  Room was merely so-so.  TV had the strangest assortment of non-English TV channels.  WiFi cut out so often it was as though there wasn't any.  Breakfast.  Go to Carls Jr. across the street

Nice especially for the price. They did have some sort of sewer issue. The bath tub would gurgle and soap would come up when they ran laundry. On the last night sewage backed up into the tub that stunk so bad we didnt use the restroom. I told the clerk when I checked out and she just said ok and would let maintance know.  Ratings are nit including the sewage back up. The rest of the stay was nice and staff friendly. Good breakfast.

Toilet was plugged when we arrived. Carpet was so dirty that when you walked barefooted and the took a shower the water turned black. Light bulbs were burned out and the lighting over the bathroom sink was so dim you could not put your makeup on. Also when we turned back the sheets to go to bed the sheets were wet, we hope from not being dried when washed.
We spent 8 days at the hotel and the staff were great, the room was very comfortable.  The hotel is very convenient for disneyland.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: After reading the reviews I was very scared about our stay(family of 4). We drove out from Oregon and stayed for 3 nights. I had a great rate so I really wasnt expecting something oustanding. The room was in need of some work that's for sure. We didnt have roaches. The room was not the cleanest and the fridge was not working but in all the room served its purpose and that was to sleep in. Close to Disney parks. Staff was friendly and helpful when needed.

The good: clean comfortable bed, plenty of hot water, lots of TV channels to choose from.  The not so good: floors hadn't been vacuumed prior to our arrival, the door did not seal well, the hot and cold water for the shower were reversed, the grout in the shower tile was in poor condition, the vinyl flooring in the bathroom was curling and had signs of water damage, the toilet would keeps running now and then, very slow and weak wifi, and the parking can be difficult when the hotel is full. Also a few homeless people on the sidewalk and at the bus stop out front.

Summary Heading: The staff were pleasant and friendly and of course helpful...
Summary: The staff were pleasant and friendly and of course helpful. The location is perfect to catch the shuttle to Disneyland and other restaurants in the area. Parking is the only concern but they do give the option of parking nearby. Overall, the stay was pleasant. Would go back.

Summary Heading: Decent place to sleep, but not much else
Summary: Check in staff was very friendly and helpful. Facility looked nice, however there is not enough room for parking and was blocked in by another guest's car on my check-out day. Room AC was barely discernible. Beds were moderately comfortable. Not enough outlets for the fridge, microwave, and coffee maker, so you had to reach behind the fridge to change what you wanted to power on. Room floor looked and felt disgusting. Sink and tub wouldn't drain. Shower would back up and take over an hour for water to go down. Continental breakfast was decent, but some protein options would be great... or maybe even some fruit. I noticed as I was leaving that it was very, VERY obvious someone had tried to kick in the door at some point. As we would walk through on the 3rd floor to get to the

Summary Heading: I checked in to my hotel asked that the other two family's...
Summary: I checked in to my hotel asked that the other two family's that we traveled with rooms where by each other .. Got in to my room with in the first couple hours we found to cockroaches and are toilet didn't flush handle was broke.. Went to the office and was told the manager was not there and I could write a complaint and would be contacted by the manager a week later still no call they put us in a different room it was cleaner although the bath drain was broke that got fixed the next day. Not enough parking we had to park at the Denny's parking lot next door not to happy about that.

We found cockroaches several times during our two day stay and it was very disgusting. Talked to management, they said all rooms were booked so nothing they could do. The room also smelled very damp and musty, which probably attracts the cockroaches in the first place.

We walked to Disneyland. It is about a 19min walk. If you prefer there is a free shuttle down one block at the disney parking lot toy story. The room was clean. TV was old style. The bathroom fan was way too loud. Bed was comfy. Room smelled okay so over all not to shabby of a place to stay for a disney trip.

Decided to take a quick budget trip to Disney so got this hotel on hotwire. Super cheap so wasnt expecting much, room ran down but worked ok, pool was decent since it was during heatwave! Breakfast is your average continental fare. Its a fairly long walk to the park I wouldn't recommend it with small children, we opted to drive day two. Walked to toy story parking lot shuttle late on last evening of trip after going to sandiego for day, to do some downtown Disney shopping . motel is far enough away that you kinda feel like your out of the Disney safety zone. Its ok but probably wont stay here again.
We enjoyed the staying at the Disneyland Travelogde, it is near to the parks and they were really helpfull.
Manager Response: First off, thank you so much for taking the time to give us such a great review! Our entire staff is greatly appreciative of the kind words. Our entire staff strive to provide the very best in customer service.  Thank you for staying with us here at travelodge. Thanks again, and have a great day!

Summary Heading: Chose this location for its proximity to Disneyland and we...
Summary: Chose this location for its proximity to Disneyland and we got there late about 10 pm, and was going to run the 1/2 marathon. The parking lot was full but told to park into a spot and I checked with the front desk to make sure it was ok and they did. Only to be called at midnight by Alex in security to move my vehicle and to be awaken, after discussing with him he relented and said to leave it there and again be called at 2 am!  INCREDIBLE, I would think long and hard if I ever stayed there again!

Summary Heading: Great price and within walking distance to Toy Story...
Summary: Great price and within walking distance to Toy Story parking lot shuttle. Overall the room was clean and good. Bring your own pillow though if you can! The ladies at the front desk and in the breakfast room are very nice.
Manager Response: First of all thank you so much for your kind words about our office and breakfast staff. They are a very hard working crew and their daily priority is to make sure all our guest are happy in stay and vacations. We hope to see you back soon !

Summary: The breakfast waffles were surpassingly really good, light and fluffy and out did in tasted and quality compared to Rosco's waffles next door - best thing it was included in the room fee.  Specious room and lots of parking but surprisingly, they were out of parking on our 11PM return from a conference one night, but they did have arrangements with the next door Denny's Restuarant and made us a parking pass to park there fro the night (must move car from Denny's lot by 8AM).  Walking distance to Disneyland and with the free parking on hotel property, its a no brainer to stay here if you plan to go to DL park.  The hotel has free simple breakfast, free wifi, free parking and good price at $52 + $8 in taxes per night for a two bed non-smoking room (I stayed 2 nights on Nov 11 - 13,
Manager Response: Thank you for posting your review of our review page. We take pride in providing the best service possible to match our wonderful hotel features and  amenities. And we always appreciate it when guest recognize our team members like you have. Please know that we are committed and will continue to work hard to provide excellent . Thank you for the encouragement and we hope to see you back soon!

Summary Heading: Is for what you pay for!
Summary: Overall the room was ok.  The property really needs to be updated.  The room  while clean, needs a basic remodel.  The price point per night was great and is close to Disneyland.  Looks the same  10 years later when I last stayed there.  Also, the front desk help could be more welcoming and friendly. Doesn't cost a lot to expect your staff to be pleasant even for a lower cost hotel. Could have a real gem here if there was a little more emphasis paint, new bedspreads, cleaning carpets and soundproofing the walls.

I was at the end of a 3 week stay in the US and looking forward to my last leg and visiting Disneyland. As such, I was looking for two main things when I chose this hotel....location and budget......plus with safety and cleanliness.  Travelodge Anaheim International Inn pleasingly met all of those. Location - it was a comfortable 30 minute walk ( 20 mins if you really wanted to burn the calories!), it was cheaper than many of the surrounding hotels and although the breakfast was minimal it was free, I felt extremely safe and the room was clean and serviced daily. Yes it is in need of an upgrade. The door to my room did not close properly, the sheer curtains were ripped and the lamps did not stand properly. However a flat screen TV was present, hair dryer, air conditioner worked

Summary Heading: Free breakfast, WIFI, and parking too!
Summary: Free continental breakfast w/ delicious waffles made for you, free WIFI, and free parking-w/ overflow at the next door Denny's. Convenient ART stop right in front; tickets can be purchased across the street at the Disneyland Welcome Center in the Doubletree. Pool. Do-it-yourself washers and dryers. Walking distance to restaurants, or jump on the ART to Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your kind feedback! As you know, we strive to ensure our guest have an enjoyable and comfortable experience. We are so glad you've experienced this!   Have a great day !

Summary: The property is quite run down. Everything is in disrepair - which wouldn't be so bad, except it is also dirty. The carpets were gross and the sheets and towels were almost all stained. The bathroom was relatively clean, there wasn't a layer of dust, and there were no bedbug indicators. The hot tub was broken, which they did not notify us of at any point prior to our check in, even when I called to confirm the reservation a few days before. The internet never worked properly the whole time we were there (five nights). The continental breakfast was OK, but almost all breads and cereals. No fruit, and definitely no protein options. The staff were very nice, the location is very close to the convention center, and there is a Denny's right next door. If you need to save money, it's

The building is a little older, room was clean but furniture was a little beat up. Regular sized HD TV but allowed additional HDMI hookups so if you have a computer or game system, you can hook it up no problem.   Bed was clean, but not a lot of light in the room. If you are looking to stay on a budget, this should do the trick, but if you need newer bells and whistles, you may wish to stay elsewhere.

I enjoyed my stay, I had a great time!  The room was nice and clean, the grounds where clean, it was a short walk to the buses that took me to Disney Land and it was nice and quiet.  I would stay there again without hesitation.  There is a Denny's right next door and a few other restaurants within walking distance and if your really ambitious you can walk to Disney land.  Thanks for a pleasant stay.
Problems in bathroom: the tub drain-stopper didn't close properly, the shower switch button did not work--so no shower; the blow dryer did not work

Recently stayed at the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room/hotel was clean however did show its age.  Although you can't buy transit tickets at the hotel you can get them next door at the Denny's. Disney transit stop right out front of the hotel.

We stayed in a different room two nights prior and had a decent experience.  We were invited to stay again this night at a discounted rate through Priceline.  We checked in, got to our room to find just one bed, no fridge, microwave not working, and the room stunk SO BAD.  There was a huge wet stain in the middle of the room.  The bed was tipping up towards the headboard.   We went back to the desk and were informed they didn't have any other two bed rooms (lies, because the parking lot was empty and it was a Sunday night!!!).  So they charged us $5 for a cot for my son and nephew to sleep on.   Get back to the room to be greeted by our neighbors, some obvious druggies.  We tried to lay down to take a nap and couldnt do anything of the sort because our tweeker neighbors were
Manager Response: I would like to start off by apologizing for the experience you had being less than satisfying. Our goal is to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible.   Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us. Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis. In addition, please know booking directly with the hotel helps guarantee the bedding issue. It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary: First i notice that the front door wouldn't  close smoothly, looked like the door latch was falling off or it was loose. Told the maintenance guy and he said its the sticker thats binding but I clearly see the latch was messed up, then the shower knob was crack so we had a hard time putting it to warm water and also a hard time closing the water cause it would still drip if it close.
Manager Response: Greetings Darryl, I'd like to start off by thank you for booking with us; however I would also like to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced throughout your stay. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us so we may improve our service and quality. Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you through your next visit.

Summary: The bathroom wasn't clean so my wife had to clean the bathroom. The sink didn't really drain, but was useable. The carpet was wrinkled so you had to watch your step from tripping.
