The refrigerator operating noise was loud and drowned out by my snoring, so maybe that was a positive. I killed one cockroach, but no more were seen over 4 days. The beds and sheets felt and smelled clean and the lights and tv worked. I sleep great, but plan a long shower as the shower had an ultra low flow that I had to fill up a cup to rinse. I now know what a 3 star hotel rating means. We had two rooms and the other room was about the same, except her tv didn't work.
Manager Response: Greetings Rolland, I would like start off by apologizing on behalf of the Travelodge Staff for the inconvenience you went through from the dirtiness in your bathroom. I will speak with housekeeping and find out where they went wrong. It is great news that your sleep was great. Please note that all reviews, comments & concerns our guest bring up to us are taken very seriously. Once again I apologize for the inconvenience.  Hope to see you around through your next visit!

Summary: The rooms are large and comfortable. It was a nice room at a reasonable price. I was pleased overall at the stay at this hotel. I would have given an excellent rating if the hotel had its own shuttle to the Disneyland parks. There is a city bus that stops outside of the hotel but it is fairly expensive for just a one mile ride to the parks.  The Wi-Fi was very slow.  But, again it was an enjoyable stay. And there is Roscoe's Chicken and Waffles just a block south of the hotel. Excellent food.
Manager Response: Hello Richard, I would like to thank you for taking time to review our hotel. We appreciate your feedback.

Summary: The price is right, the room is not. Dead bugs every day. Terrible parking, had to park next door at Dennys, but move my car by 8 am.

While the hotel is friendly and helpful the room was terrible. I've stayed at this hotel in the past and this time the room was awful. The carpet was stained and looked so bad that I didn't want to walk barefoot. The door frame looked as though it had been tried to be busted. I had to unplug the alarm clock because it kept making a low hissing and alarm tone noise that no matter how hard I tied to turn it off, it would not go away without being unplugged.
Manager Response: Greetings, I would like to start off by thanking you for reviewing our hotel; however I apologize for the inconvenience of the poor quality you had in your room. I would like to gladly inform you that we are in the process of renovating all of our rooms for a pleasant and comfortable stay to all of our guests. Once again I do apologize for the inconvenience of your stay. Hope towards seeing you throughout your next visit.

Summary Heading: Great Stay! Would be great for families!
Summary: I had a great stay at the Travelodge! My room was big and clean with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom, tv, fridge, coffee facilities, wifi, and air conditioning.  Free breakfast which I found great- coffee, waffles, oatmeal, cereal, toast.  The location is good, a little further away from Disneyland than what is ideal, but I didn't mind walking a little further to save money! I am a fast walker and it was a good 15- 20 minute walk. The latest I walked back from Disneyland was about 10:30pm and as a single female traveler I felt very safe. There was lots of traffic and foot traffic, and the street was well lit.  All in all a good and comfortable stay- would recommend!
Manager Response: Dear Megan,  On behalf of our hotel staff, I'm writing to let you know how delighted we were  to receive kind words of praise. Thank your for taking time from your behalf to review our hotel. We accommodate many guests every night, and we strive to make their stay a satisfying one. The principal goal of our hotel is to provide dependable service to all guests at reasonable prices.  It's only through their eyes that we can accurately assess the quality of our accommodations and services. Once again thank you for your feedback and hope to see you around through your next visit.

Summary: Our room was fairly clean except for carpet we we walked around then got in shower and all dirt washed off, disgusting, no bugs like other reviews have said.  Looks like it was fairly recently renovated.   Hair dryer did not work

Motel is in awful shape, the only decent thing about our stay was we had a somewhat newer tv in our room and the waffles at the continental breakfast. Room was very very dirty, run down, door had at least a one inch gap where you could see outside under the door, room felt damp and ac unit had green and black mold everywhere. This room was disgusting. The staff was friendly upon checking in though!

Never again.....not enough parking and roaches in the fridge and inside the dresser. Was terrified to leave any of our things on the floor because of bugs. And our room was right next to where they serve "breakfast", so that worries me about the state of their food service area. I usually have no problems with Travelodges but this one is a big nope from us! I give it One Star because of its close proximity to the Toy Story Parking Lots.

Summary Heading: Will never visit this location again
Summary: The women in the office was rude. The room was extremely hot and would not cool off. Room service would throw everything on the bed including shoes. They only made of of the 2 beds every day. Was almost nothing for breakfast but caprisuns. The internet hardly worked.
We stayed in room 102 & were bitten by bedbugs.  Also, there were not enough parking spaces & we had to park our car at the Denny's.

Keys demagnetized 3 times. Water in shower not stable. Almost scalded 13-month old. Fluctuated between scalding and freezing. Not enough parking for all rooms. Fire lanes were blocked. Overflow in Denny's. Large possum in Denny's lot.  Water leak in bathroom but not sure from where.  Bathroom fan randomly went on and off.

First of all,  if someone is speaking to you at the front counter you don't ignore them, when they are trying to tell you they had a problem with their stay. I never thought I would have to take my recyclables with me when I left my room for the day. I just learned my lesson with this hotel stay.   My children saved their cans/bottles on their own to pay for their Disney tickets and spending money. They made sure to bring back each can/bottle used during our stay.  Then to find out it had been it taken by housekeeping  They were not laying around the room or anywhere near the trash can.  It looked like they came in pulled the sheets and blankets across the bed, dumped the trash, and took our cans.  Housekeeping didn't even take all the trash.   I had 3 cups that should have been
Great location, close to Disney. The price is always great. The rooms are nothing fancy or updated. Jump on the bus right outside the hotel to get to Disney. Hot Waffles with the breakfast.

I have stayed there often, for the price it is good. I just need a hotel close to Disney parking, clean sheets.  there is not enough parking and if I request a ground floor room I usually do not get it.

When I made the reservation through Priceline's Express Deals, I freaked out and wanted to see if there was any way to change the reservation.  Most of the reviews I had read on travel sites really dumped on this hotel/motel and said it was the "worst hotel they had ever stayed at ... wouldn't stay again" - that sort of thing.  However, when we checked in (rather late at night), we were pleasantly surprised.  The room was very clean (the décor IS a bit dated) and we had plenty of towels in the bathroom, a working TV, mini-fridge, etc.  Pretty much all the amenities you would need.  The pool was very clean and the hot tub was actually working (although not really that hot).  The best thing about this hotel is the location - only a 5 minute drive from Disneyland ... a 15-20 minute

Outside front off Motel was ok. Cockroaches on wall and bed. Hot tub not working Breakfast - Coffee was very bad . Orange juice was mostly water. Bath room fan was noisey  When first arrive TV would not work , Had to call Maintenance . Got it fixed Kleenex  holder came off wall Checking out the printer was not working  One room had a eviction notice on the door .

I was cancelled from a local hospital when i arrived for work. I was stuck because I couldn't  just go home due to i had another hospital job at 3am when i was done with this one at 2am. You found this Travel Lodge available last minute and booked it. The bed was comfortable, bathroom was clean and it didn't appear to be noisy. My only complaint was the entire parking lot was full and I had nowhere to park.

The breakfast was minimal but did include waffles so I liked that. The room was decent but found a couple of bugs around the room. Locations included the refrigerator, bathroom and sink. The booking was nonrefundable but when I got there they said I never paid. I thought they took the money out previously but didn't, so we had to pay cash which reduces our trip money dramatically. Would have had a good time had they took the money out sooner and not had bugs. Also, there was never any parking at night, had to park at a Dennys next door.

Stayed here for one week. This was one of the worse hotels I have stayed at here while visiting the Disney area. Here are my reasons why: 1) I did get grossed out by their carpet I do advise you to wear flip flops NOT socks unless you don't mind them turning black.  2) The shower never drained properly so I can only imagine this is due to how dirty and filthy the drain is... Actually on the other hand I'd rather not!!! 3) The worst thing about this stay was seeing roaches!!!! I HATE them and due to this I would never book here again. They weren't the big ones they were medium-small sized but that's enough to deter me from here. 4) I don't think they have sufficient parking here for their guests we never ran into this problem but they do give you a fair warning and tell you to

After reading the majority of reviews for this hotel, upon opening the door to the room my expectations were not high. However, I was so pleasantly surprised by what I found. Everything was in working order and the location/price cannot be beaten. I would have been happy with a roof and a bed for this price at a location so close to Disneyland, and frankly the nitpicking of some reviews is ridiculous. I cannot fault our stay here, and would come again.

Where to start.... at least the room was clean.   A/C unit was broken, worked sporadically. Door was loose and there was a gap big enough to see in. Bathtub drain backed up multiple times a day creating a nasty sewer stench. Bathtub drain and sink drains didn't drain properly, water took forever to go down. Pillows were way too small and uncomfortable - very lumpy too. Not a very pleasant stay. Neighbors above us and to the left side facing out the front door were very noisy in their rooms. Parking is terrible. You are expected to park along the red-painted curb if the spots are full. WIFI didn't work.

There was no parking when we arrived.  Hotel staff told us to park in a red area, since no parking available.  My Son in law even showed them where we parked and they said it was fine.  2 staff employees said it was fine to park in red, and there were witnesses who heard them say this.  Anyway, next morning went to move our car and it had been TOWED!!!  Amazing!!  And we had to get car out of impound and cost $250.00.  Well, supposedly manager was out every time we went into office.  Never staying there again and telling everyone we know not to stay there.  Found out later that this same thing has happened to others!!!!!  Wasn't impressed with the slimy feeling sheets on beds either.

I don't give reviews. Actually this is my first one ever I believe but I feel inclined to do so. People were for the most part pleasant. However the room and facilities were below what I feel is acceptable. Toilets plugged up(#1) not #2. The tub/shower had issues draining. The mini fridge never kept or food cold so it spoiled. The was a large hole under the sink into the wall. Beds and bedding were very uncomfortable.  The continental breakfast was comprised of cereal, oatmeal and waffles made by one lady for all the guest in a room that could only fit about 12-15 comfortably. The internet never worked fast enough to get anything loaded at an acceptable time. The handle that activates the showerhead wasn't working correctly so the water from the showerhead trickled out while at
The rooms are spacious and comfortable- but needs better attention to detail. Customer Service was not good. But all in all a good value for the money. Breakfast was awful

Summary Heading: Great Price, Good Hotel, Not Enough Parking
Summary: The prices at the Travelodge can't be beat. It was the cheapest room we found when booking our trip. We decided to take a chance and are glad we did.  This isn't a 5 star hotel, obviously. It's an older hotel that you can tell has been through MANY renovations. Our room had recently been remodeled and was very nice. Lots of plugs for charging devices, plenty of space for all of our "stuff". A nice sized fridge and a coffee maker. Free Wifi that was slow but worked.  The room was clean and adequate. The bed was super firm so if you're like me and prefer a softer bed, I had a hard time being comfortable.   The bathroom was clean, if a little run down.  The ART bus stops right outside the hotel, so made for easy transport to and from Disneyland.  There isn't enough parking though,
Paid $55 for one night stay, a/c in our room barely work, saw a couple baby roaches in the bathroom when I woke up early in the morning. Other than that room was okay.

Room smelled very bad ,feet & socks were black when walking on carpet . Complained at front desk they used a pine smelling cleaner to make it smell better. They offered another room but was afraid it would be the same.

The location was great to get to Disney Land. That's where the greatness stopped. There was rust on the shower fixtures and rips on the vinyl floors. Front desk staff was not very friendly. Free breakfast consisted of watered down orange juice and awful coffee.
My Stay was great it was close to my Meeting and nice Hotel .. Just it was hard for door to open..
The rooms are large and great location for Disneyland. There are homeless people in front of the hotel all of the time in the grass and on the bus benches.

Room was a great price however a couple issues. When I checked into the room, the toilet was running, the flapper hadn't closed from either previous guest or housekeeping, who knows how many gallons were wasted!    The refrigerator wasn't working (and I made sure it was plugged in and on), I went to the front desk and told them they said they would send someone over, never did.  Luckily the weather was temperate but the A/C never worked, didn't realize that till late into the 2nd night of 2 night stay.  Informed on checkout.  But a hotel is a place to sleep and shower, not stay for long term in, was visiting Disney and that is what I was there for.  Hopefully next guest in this room is happier than Me.

I've stayed at this property back in December last year and I was very satisfied that's why I chose this place again for my most recent stay, however I now know I've made a mistake.  Upon check-in, there were two ladies working at the front desk (wasn't able to remember their names). The lady that checked me in looked a tad bit confused and asked her co-worker next to her if the room that they were supposed to give me was clean. That concerned me a bit since I've traveled enough and I know how the hotel business works, but the other person that confirmed the room being ready was confident so I trusted her word. We got into the room and I was very disappointed. The carpet seemed like it hasn't even been vacuumed for days, the exhaust fan in the bathroom does not work, the shower

simple hotel room, pretty clean, nothing fancy, nice to have refridgerator, microwave, and coffee maker, continental breakfast wasn't very good, not a huge selection, very small pool, convenience to alot of other restaurants, gas, and walking distance to Disneyland and the transportation

My wife and I checked in to this hotel just around 3:00pm and was in our room in no time. After about 10 minutes or so we heard the sound of kids running back and forth coming from the room above us. Being senior citizens and are lite sleepers we knew we would not have had a very restful night so my wife called the front desk and told them about the noise coming from up above. The young lady did not hesitate to move our room to the  top floor .

I will Never. Ever. Stay here again! We originally requested a handicap room on the first floor. The room we were given was infested with roaches; I have video proof! Then they gave us another room that was not handicap accessable on the 3rd floor. We checked it for bugs and didn't find any but, that's probably because they used bug spray on that floor; the over whelming stench of bug spray slapped you across the face as soon as the elevator doors opened! There was a plastic bag with a rubber band around the smoke detector. The carpet was so filthy, I kept my shoes on the entire time. There were so many stains on the ceiling. The shower curtain wouldn't stay in place which in turn made it impossible NOT to soak the tile. It was so dangerous to get out of the shower. I had to be

This was a good place to stay for the price I paid.very nice Continental breakfast with attendant who made us fresh waffles. My only complaints are the small lumpy pillow, very uncomfortable, ice and soda machine were broken, only one elevator for the while place.

Summary Heading: The one and only ice machine didn't work, only one...
Summary: The one and only ice machine didn't work, only one elevator, very slow and Internet didn't work and bathroom needed to be cleaned better

This review has nothing to do with staff; they provided the best service under these conditions.   The room was so out dated from the paint was old and smelly, the pillows were old and flat, the mattress was worn, the tv was old, the shower had mildew, the bathroom wall paper was peeling, the shower door caulking was peeling and mildewed, and the furniture was old and peeling. The room smelled old with a heavy mildew odor. There was no weather stripping around the room door.  Everything about this hotel is substandard to the Wyndham name. We were in room 118 out of 342 rooms with only one ice machine that was broken. The room was so horrible that we left as soon as we could get dress and stayed away as long as possible. We had concerns about leaving our purchases in the room

Summary Heading: Price is right, location is great!
Summary: First trip to Disneyland was almost 10 years ago. We have been back every year, at least once per year. Have stayed at the Travelodge every time but once. We are happy with our stay every time. Thanks Travelodge!

Summary Heading: I would not stay here again
Summary: Bathroom fan was extremely screechy and loud, the toilet wouldn't flush properly, they were very stingy and rude about giving us extra towels and pillows, the hot tub was not working (even when we booked it 5 months in advance), breakfast had nothing healthy, all just sweets, beds were extremely uncomfortable, and internet connection was horrible and so slow that we could not even use it, the toilet paper holder was hanging off the wall. We stayed here so we could go to Disneyland and the guy at the front desk knew nothing about the shuttle or times. When we went into out motel room there was a paper explaining it to us. He works there and he has not idea? It must have been his first day.Only thing good about this motel was the location.

I stayed at the travelodge from 9/06-9/08 and you get what you pay for. Super cheap stay to a run down hotel. I'm not at all complaining although during my stay there was leaking coming from the bathroom toilet as well as 2 cockroaches that we saw in the bathroom. The beds are pretty comfy and it was very roomy. Super old bedsheets and blinds but wasnt needed due to the heat. The air-con worked great so it was fine. We basically didnt stay in the hotel because we were in Disney majority of the day. I probably wouldnt book here again. The front desk was nice no problem at all and the maids came in to clean which was great.

We stayed at this hotel over Labor Day weekend 2015. It is in close proximity to Disneyland resort, but if you prefer to shuttle there is a stop right outside to save the 3/4 mile walk in and out of the park. The staff is friendly and the continental breakfast is typical. The rooms could use an upgrade but for the cost and the convenience I'd say it's worth it if you're trying to save a few dollars. Don't expect the best, but be aware that you're not going to get the worst either. One nice thing, they let us check in early as we had arrived in Anaheim earlier than expected so that was nice!

Summary Heading: Great surprise for a Disney vacation
Summary: Stayed here for a week while we were visiting Disneyland. This is a great budget friendly hotel. Our room was basic and clean. Stayed on 3rd floor elevator was on the other side so just used the stairs. Parking can be interesting but once we got our spot didn't have any troubles. Later at night seems to be when the lot fills up. Disneyland is a hike from this location but you can catch the bus right outside. Overall this was a good place to stay on a budget. If your looking for 5 star this is not it. Beds were comfy and rooms clean. Will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice place to relax after a trip to Disneyland
Summary: We stay at this hotel every time we come to Disneyland. Which is at least once a year! We are a family of 6 soon to be 7 and the suite we reserve has plenty of room for us. Two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a living area that has 2 sofa sleepers. So you could easily sleep 8. One of the sofa sleepers however had a very uncomfortable mattress, so we had to use the couch cushions to make it more comfortable....The room is pretty clean. We haven't stayed in any other room but that family suite. They have breakfast in the mornings. (cereal, waffles, oj, coffee, bagels and toast) Pool is a decent size. The walk to Disneyland isn't bad, there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. The only downside would be the location of our suite, which is right next to that bus stop. But that is just

Summary Heading: Good value but if you're out late, forget about finding parking
Summary: We've stayed here many times. For the price, it's a cheap place to stay while visiting Disney. Right next to the Toy Story lot, you can catch a bus there. However, after this last visit, we will probably not stay again, especially if we know we will be coming in late. Was very upset when after a long day at the park, we came in close to midnight and found NO parking. None, Zero. Nada. We were told we could park next door in the Denny's lot, but we HAD to move our car by 8 am. Ok. We get in past midnight, and have to get up less than 8 hrs later to move the car?!?! When we did move the car, there was still no parking-had to wait for someone to leave to grab their space. Not acceptable. I don't know how they get away with it. Won't stay there again unless we know for sure we will
Better than we expected based on other reviews. It was clean, location was great, lots of channels, and bed was awesome!

We stayed there for 5 nights and 4 out of 5 nights room service was coming in to check all our belongings. One of my daughters notice that her lotion was being used and by the time we left, it was 3/4 full. Of course we didn't notice while we were there because we would leave very early to Disneyland and come back at midnight. (We were always in a hurry). Not only that but by the time everyone starts packing we're not checking everything and by the time we got home (Texas), we noticed some souvenirs missing, when I realized that same night that I arrived home, I called the hotel and they did nothing for me.
They really need to not allow more than 1 car per room. This is the second time I have stayed here and have had issues with parking my car. Many cars parked in red zone or doubled park

Summary Heading: Nice, clean inn near Disney and restaurants
Summary: The room was clean and served our purpose well. It was quiet at night also. It was within walking distance of Disneyland, but there is also a Disney shuttle bus that stops outside the hotel if you prefer to ride. The staff are friendly and helpful also. Although the pool is on the small side, it is large enough for the swim in and my sons enjoyed themselves. It's located near the Old Town of Orange which is also worth a visit.

Bugs. Run down and in need of serious repair and upkeep. Parking was rediculous.  At least Dennys next door let hotel guests park overnight.  The office employee on night shift was extremely nice. There is a $25.00 early check in fee if you try to check in before 12pm. I won't be back.

Summary Heading: There were cockroaches, both dead and alive, in the rooms...
Summary: There were cockroaches, both dead and alive, in the rooms we stayed at. The rooms were over all nice and my children did love the fact that there was a pool.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here from August 20th through August 23rd 2015,  during summer travels at Disneyland which is within walking distance to the hotel, especially with the FREE Disneyland Toy Story Shuttle near by so we didn't pay for Disneyland Car parking or the Art Shuttle (Anaheim Resort Transportation! :)   Being able to use the FREE Toy Story Shuttle was great because it also saved us money on using the ART shuttle, which would have been $5 a day for a day pass.   This was a very decent place to stay, but like every hotel in the area, it needs updating.   Ice machine was broken: Oh well luckily i used freezer packs and kept the water I brought with me frozen in our cooler in the hotel room Hotel Fridge and that worked well. Hotel freezer worked nicely too..I didn't use the coffee

Our room was large and comfortable.  Beds were good sleeping. Parking was difficult if you came in extremely late, but the hotel had a back-up parking plan agreement with Dennys next door.  Internet was disappointingly slow.

Summary Heading: Stay away from this property. Never again!!! Filthy and disgusting!!!
Summary: Where do I start... I did not book directly through this hotel but through a third party company. They do not give you the name of the property until you pay I have booked through that site and had good luck in the past but my luck changed this time. I was only looking for a fairly inexpensive nothing fancy, hotel near Disneyland where my family and I could enjoy an amazing two days stress free. I arrived at this place fairly early and asked if I could check in but they said no to come back at 3:00 pm, That was no problem though as that is the original check in time. I did ask the fairly rude guy in the lobby if I could leave my car parked here at the hotel while we go to Disneyland for the day he didn't mind and gave us a slip to put on the dash, that was pretty nice. So we

Good location however it would be beneficial for housekeeping staff to wear hair nets as we noticed long black hairs on our pillows and bed sheets (which were not our hair colour). On the last 2 days of our stay we opted to not have the bed made and so we put the do not disturb sign on our door. Overall location good and breakfast good.

Based upon the negative reviews I had read about this hotel, I was more than a little anxious about staying here. But due to a shift in our vacation schedule, we needed to find lodging for 2 days prior to checking into our regular hotel which we'd already reserved.   We checked into Room 129 on the first floor. The room was very clean, bed linens were fresh and obviously well-laundered. No bugs anywhere in the room, for which I thoroughly checked before unpacking.   After settling in we were up for a swim after the long drive- the pool area was clean and attractive. We were able to enjoy the pool as well as the sauna - it appears to have been repaired, because the recent reviews had stated it was not in running order. It was bubbly and hot, which was nice. Restroom facilities

Summary Heading: Good clean room for the price. Décor a bit dated, but...
Summary: Good clean room for the price. Décor a bit dated, but otherwise comfortable. Close to Disneyland and shuttles. Parking was the area that was really lacking. At night cars were parked behind others blocking some in; potential safety issue. Only 1 ice machine which ran out of ice.

Summary Heading: Check in was disorganized. Did not get what we were told...
Summary: Check in was disorganized. Did not get what we were told was in room. Bathroom fan kept shorting out and was so loud that turning light on at night woke everyone in the room. Other light didn't work. Phone in room didn't work. Other guests were extremely loud in middle of night. After 3 complaints to front desk and employee's response that he couldn't do anything so we should call the police. He stated the other guests didn't speak English. Had to call police and was still kept awake the next night after 1:00 am. Very disappointed in hotel. Internet connection did not work in the room.

The rooms are clean.  But the parking is a joke.  The fire marshel would not approve of cars double and tripple parked and parking in the 'red' zones.   On any given morning you would find anywhere between 10 and 15 cars not parked in a legal parking space.

I stayed at the Travelodge for my trip to Vidcon and I loved it. The only small problem I had was with the quilts. They smelled a bit like old people, but then again it's my fault for not letting the service know about it. The other problem was that the internet was really slow, but I didn't mind because I had my own 4g. Overall I consider Travelodge to be a great place to stay because it's a walking distance from the Anaheim convention center, Disneyland, the Garden Walk, Target, and many other food places. Oh and it also has a pool.

On check in, the staff member serving me barely spoke a word to me, despite my efforts to be friendly. Staff ignored us our entire stay. Hot tub was out of commission & the bath tap in our room was leaky. 2nd or 3rd night water started bubbling up through the bath plughole. Thought it might just be air in the pipes from flushing the toilet, but it kept going & the bath filled up more & more. There was of black gunk floating in the water & when the bath finally emptied hours later, the black gunk was left in the tub. I knocked on other doors to ask if anyone had the same problem. Only 1 room answered & said they didn't have the plug problem but their roof was leaking. Went to the lobby but it was 11pm, there was no maintenance. The receptionist told me they'd be back in the

Summary Heading: Yo need to chance the tvs, because the ones that the yo...
Summary: Yo need to chance the tvs, because the ones that the yo hace are obsolets, algo yo can offer a shutter, it is need it to be moved

Would never ever recommend this place or ever ever stay here. Nothing went right the day we showed up. A/C didn't work in both rooms. TV didn't work. Had to buy fans to keep cool. More cars than parking spaces. Staff is not knowledgeable of tourist attractions. I would remove from this site. Horrible hotel. Only thing good is the location.

Room was clean, great hospitality from the front desk, to housekeeping. Pool area was clean. Breakfast was delicious and filling. Walking distance to Toy Story Parking lot for Disneyland. Close to many restaurants and stores. Will DEFINETLY stay here again!

We were worried about this property and even tried to cancel. We showed up at the property and found it to be well kept. The rooms are in desperate need of upgrades and TLC. But nothing to keep me from never coming back. Actually I would not only return but would recommend it to others. You get a room cheap and isn't that what's it's about

My husband and I were on vacation in Southern CA and our travel agent booked a few days stay at this hotel.  It is on the main drag, a few blocks from Disneyland and with all the "real nice" and expensive hotels on this street, one would expect that Travelodge would realize the importance of staying "updated".  The grounds were ok, however, one look at our room and you could see that they hadn't put any money into the rooms in years.  Upon opening the door we noticed a "musty" odor in the room.  The room was extremely out dated and had been neglected.  The faucet in the tub was dripping and apparently had been for a long time since the area underneath it was stained.  The toilet paper holder was broken and barely hanging onto the wall.  The cheap counter top in the bathroom area

So I will start this review by saying that I stayed at this hotel because my party had a 3 day event at the Anaheim Convention Center and the only thing this hotel has going for it is it's location. The location does not outweigh the horrible experience I had with this hotel though, so I would recommend staying at a different hotel in the area.  When we arrived the staff at check-in was very rude. After signing the papers I had to stand there for 5 minutes while the employee finished texting. Then he walked off without saying anything and I had to remind him to give me my room keys and then I had to ask what room number I was because he forgot to tell us.  After finding our room I opened the door and was shocked to find the room completely torn apart. The mattresses were against

Summary Heading: great affordable option for attending the anaheim convention center
Summary: we stayed here while we were attending a convention.  the room was modest but affordable and very clean.  I paid $90/nt for 2 queen beds.  the front desk staff was amazing and very helpful.  we were able to get into our rooms at 1pm instead of after 3pm. I recommend this place if attending the convention center, but not necessarily Disneyland.  we relied on the ART(Anaheim resort transit) buses to get us around, but the wait for these buses can be 30 minutes!  you can easily walk to the convention center.

Summary Heading: Door did not close tight. The bath tub drain age was...
Summary: Door did not close tight. The bath tub drain age was terribly slow. No parking available. Wasn't notified by the front desk that we could get a parking pass to Denny's.
Quiet rooms close to Disneyland with comfortable beds, continental breakfast, and free Wi-Fi.  Walking distance to park shuttle, so no need for a vehicle.

The price was right. The kids enjoyed the pool and continental breakfast. The carpet in the room was extremely dirty. Our feet and socks were black from walking back and forth.  Having the fridge was great. We couldn't get the internet to connect to our phones.

We stayed there 4 times last summer and was always clean the wifi is very slow but I would stay there again it is close to Disneyland and the price is great if you have a big family it took about 15 minutes to walk to Disneyland and there is lots of food close by

Location is great, rooms are clean and spacious, great continental breakfast the best one I have had in while, refrigerator and microwave were available in the room  but the employees at the front desk not very customer friendly and be prepare to park on the next building since there is not enough space where to do it at the hotel, shower fan was broken and water was stuck at the bath tube, Wi Fi do not work, I think it was great for the amount of money I paid.

Summary Heading: HAd to shuffle to 4 rooms had Safety and AC issues
Summary: PCI Violation Personal  Credit Card Information copying to paper Concern,  I booked my room online and when I arrived the front desk clerk made carbon imprint of my Credit card and had me put Driver License and my other address personal name and info on same area of paper, this paper would be in the office and maybe  files for many years with who knows having all my Credit Card and personal info could very easy be identity credit fraud issues ,  my CreditCard was swiped and in the Computer reservation, it Should Not be copied to another piece of paper.  Keeping paper copies is a PCI volation and I'm very concerned if I find out this is continuing and ALL and any other previous paper copies made of other people's personal info and CreditCard details is Not immediately shredded
Cable didn't work. Dirty, Fridge took forever to get cold. The worst, are the infestation of ROACHES. Just horrible,  won't stay again if you paid me

Based on "average" reviews by others on Trip Advisor, we booked 4 nights here at the end of May for a Disney trip. After a few nights at other, nicer properties, we drove to the Travelodge for what we expected would be an OK place, albeit, completely sold out but quite affordable. When we arrived I was pleased by the good  customer service at the front desk - we even had a choice of 3 different rooms. I selected one that I hoped would be a little quieter since it was on the 3rd (top) floor and situated near the end of the building.   On entering the room, we noticed the door didn't work right; it didn't close properly & took some pushing to engage the deadbolt lock. The door clearly had serious water damage as the exterior side was uneven, likely having been damaged from the top
For the price & location, this property is a good choice. We have stayed here before and the staff is always great. Parking is always packed, but glad there is not a parking fee.

My Fiance and I stayed at this hotel in March for our disneyland trip, Disneyland is not within walking distance. You are going to be on your feet all day so walking back to your hotel from Disneyland is not fun. Go across the street at the double tree hotel i believe it is and get bus passes they`re very worth it. The rooms are old and honestly gross. It was fine for us because we weren`t really in our room most of the trip. But the carpet was old and ugly. Beds were okay. We brought our own sheets. Bathrooms were gross and definitely had bugs. Don`t think you`ll be lucky and not have bugs in your room. I thought that and sure enough we did! Breakfast was served at a different hotel down the street opposite of Disneyland so the was inconvenient. I paid a VERY low price for this

Carpet was nasty, felt like my son was walking outside. Black dirt bottom of his feet after walking around the room with out his shoes on after showering,. Second, fan is not working at all in the bathroom, third,. Beans marks or stains on the ceilings, holes in the walls next to the sink, it would be nice if front office would notify us about the breakfast upon checking in

I got a "deal" on this place through a travel website not knowing the name of the hotel.  Probably the worst hotel experience I've ever had.  The room was dirty, smelled bad and was home to a nice family of bugs.  I had booked and paid for 3 nights here and checked out after the first night.  This was definitely the low point of our California / Disneyland trip.  Read the rest of the reviews on this place before booking.  I'll never stay here again.  The pool was very cold and heater for the hot tub was broken.  Hot water was working in the room at the time of our visit.
Clean everyday, good breakfast, nothing was stolen from my room, and beautiful area, and I felt safe in the area, and all for a very reasonable price.
Out dated room smelled bad refrigerator not working spoiled my food that I just purchased towels old and raggedy sheets also
I just didn't liked the fact of " one parking space per room " Beside that everything was more than excellent !

The rooms were dirty. Each night we came back from Disney with tired children I had to have my room key programmed again. Continental breakfast was much to be desired. I will never stay at this hotel again. Will stay in my car if I have to.

About an hour in the room, my daughter's shirt collar was crawling with a bed bug. We were immediately brought to another room which seemed okay.  We've stayed at numerous hotels/motels all over the world and have never encountered bed bugs.  The staff was very courteous and accommodating. If I'm every in the area again and need an inexpensive room I'll come back. Also, Travelodge needs to clean the carpets regularly, this is the 2nd Travelodge I've been at and each time my bare feet are black from the dingy carpet.

We chose this hotel because of its affordability and proximity to Disneyland.  As it turns out, those were the only good things about it!   The rooms are run down -dirty/sticky carpet, drafty doors and windows, etc.   The shower water temperature and pressure are affected by neighboring rooms.  One minute you're freezing, the next you're being nearly scalded!   The pool was not heated and neither was the hot tub (it was about the temperature you'd expect the pool to be)!! The "breakfast" that's offered leaves a lot to be desired.  Although their waffles are delicious, there is no fruit, yogurt, or protein of any kind to go with them. If you need to save some money and want to be close to Disney, this hotel can work... Just don't expect much else!

Summary Heading: They allow smoking on property in hallway next to non-smoking rooms
Summary: We have stayed here in the past. Thought I would give it another shot. Nope! Can't and won't do it again. Non-Smoking rooms where management allows people to smoke right outside the door(s). We all know the a/c units in walls allow for smoke to enter into the walls. Of course, it is my own fault as I know better and I should have stayed at 100% smoke free, but, also a class of people who are so brain dead that they think the smoke won't seep through the cracks. Not happy!

we come to SoCal a few times a year. We are annual pass holders at Disneyland, and we usually stay at Travelodge because of their convenient location. This will however, most likely be the last time we stay there.  I made the reservations months ago and requested a specific room. When we checked in they said the room was unavailable and gave us room 106. The drain in the shower did not work, nor did the TV. It took over an hour to get someone to fix the TV, and another hour for them to actually fix it. We requested to be moved the next day to the room we had asked for when we made the reservation.  Which thankfully they did.  Though we soon discovered that when the sink faucet was turned on it smelled like sewage. We were also unhappy with the guests staying above us who decided

Booked this room for four nights while visiting Disneyland.  Day 1, Room old and dirty, very dated, marks on the wall and it looked like the wallpaper in the bathroom was holding up the repair job.   Day 2, COCKROACH on the nightstand, Front desk apologized and moved us to another room.. Day 3, different room, yet, anther COCKROACH!   At this point we would have just left, but the Mgr moved us again to another room, but this time, she personally inspected it and had two housekeepers touch it up before we unpacked.   After 3 days in Disneyland, a welcome visit to the Hot tub was in order...no one near the pool or tub, so nice, had it all to ourselves.  Flipped on hot tub, NOT HOT, decided to just soak for a while.  Room mate went to office to find out why not hot, "Oh, no one is

Summary Heading: Great value property with friendly staff
Summary: Motel was great value.  Good price, plus clean and presentable property.  The property was basic, but functional.  Little bit of a long walk to Disneyland for some people, but for fit person who likes walking it was fine. The staff were friendly and helpful.  Hot freshly made waffles by lovely breakfast staff are included in the continental breakfast.

The Travelodge looks better on the outside than on the inside. I was staying there for the Disneyland 24hr celebration and I thought it couldn't be that bad, but it was. My room was converted to an accessible room which means all the hardware in the bathroom was moved, so there were holes in the wall and areas that needed to be repainted. The floor up above was squeaky and I was awakened many times because of the noise of the floor. The staff were nice, but the other guests were less than desirable. I guess you get what you pay for, so spend a little more to get a good nights sleep.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, and even less
Summary: We booked this hotel through a Priceline instant deal, and got a pretty good rate.  We were in town to donate our time at a health fair for underinsured folks, and there on our own dime.  The room was adequate, but very dated, dingy, and everything just worn out.  There was a VHS player in the room. Why?  Who even owns VHS tapes much anymore?  Our TV was an ancient monster although we saw other rooms with newer flat panel TV's.  Parking is a nightmare if you arrive after about 9 pm.  One day I had a makeup explosion on a guest towel.  My husband, being a nice person, took it to the desk and offered to pay for it.  They gladly took him up on that offer and charged us $8.00 for a worn out hand towel!  I could have replaced it at the Target down the street with a brand new one for
The room was a nice size, we had 2 Queen beds. The only thing that was a hassle was parking but that could have been prevented. Very good for the price I paid!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Roaches everywhere. We changed rooms 3 times because of hair in the bed, roaches, and finally on night of peace. I gave it a 3 because they were so easy going with changing our rooms, free parking, free breakfast, and only a 1 mile walk to disneyland.

I would not recommend this place to stay if you don't like cockroaches. We complained and was given a new room and did not see any in that room but the thought of them made it hard to sleep at night!!!

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, horrible  other guests
Summary: This is a well kept and reasonably priced property considering it's proximity to Disneyland.  Our stay would have been exceptional except for the other guests.    There were some teenage boys staying in a room adjacent to ours and they would come out of the room and stand outside near our door and make noises   On the first night,  I went to the  office and reported this and  while in the office another guest confirmed and complained about this as well.  The management indicated  they'd look into it.    Perhaps they did as the second night the issue escalated. On the second night, the boys would come by our room and knock on the window, scaring my daughter and wife.  When they did the second time, I called the office again.  They asked if I'd talked to the boys' parents and said
The hotel was clean comfortable, and close to the convention center and a handful of places to eat. Breakfast was a bit limited, but hey, free is free.

Summary Heading: Very good for the price!  Budget trip to Disneyland!
Summary: We got this hotel as an Express Deall on Pricline so we didn't know what we were going to get until we paid.  After we saw some of the reviews for this hotel we were very apprehensive to say the least.  We had decided that if it was too bad we would bite the bullet and change when we got there.  Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised.  This hotel is not fancy and not top of the line but very good for what we paid for it.  It's not the nicest place we have ever stayed but it was far from the worst! The room was VERY clean,  it was a good size and semi updated.  We had no issues with cold showers and even though we got a room facing Harbor Blvd we were able to drown out the street noise at night with  the white noise apps on our devices. The breakfast was basic but good.  It's

I wanted to stay 4 nights, but left the hotel after my first night. Carpet is ridiculously dirty, it all looks very old and they dont clean beds or anything for that matter. I think you should remodel the hotel and then reopen for bussines, it is a shame to see a travelodge in this awful condition

When I first checked in to this hotel I asked if the wifi was high speed. I was told it was and proceeded to my assigned room. He room was very old and dirty with a drippy faucet. The Internet was barely dial up seed. I told the front desk and was told I could use their computer which has no place to sit and no privacy. I switched rooms and the second was no cleaner and holes in the curtains. The room is large bathroom small with a noisy fan. There was breakfast and it consisted of waffles, oatmeal, dry cereal, coffee and muffins. I wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Paper thin walls. Unsupervised children running up and down stairs and along the terraces until after midnight. The knob on the microwave broke and wouldn't work. Phone buttons were stuck and wouldn't work. We moved to another room, but no dial tone on the phone, and the morning we checked out, there was no hot water. Pathetic. I wouldn't recommend this Travelodge to my worst enemy. In fact, I won't be recommending ANY Wyndham hotels period.

Quiet room in the back with no traffic noise. Friendly, helpful staff. Walls seemed thin because it was easy to hear nearby noise from them. Drawback was that breakfast was all carbs.  Some fruit and/or hard boiled eggs would have been nice to have. However, they do have staff making some of the best waffles I've had at a continental breakfast!  Overall, for the price, I'd stay there again.

Stayed here for 4 nights recently, about a 20 min walk to the front gates of Disney if you don't go to the carpark nearby and catch the free shuttle bus. Room was clean and confortable, nothing fancy but I didn't pay for anything fancy. Was quiet, could easily get a carparking spot. Beds were comfortable, had a small fridge and microwave in room which was very handy. Internet did not work no matter where I went in the room or the motel grounds so I went and used the free wifi next door at ihop when eating there. Staff were friendly, not overly talkative but polite and helpful when asked questions etc. Overall would recommend if you are looking for somewhere cheap and comfortable to stay and don't mind the walk to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great location, you get what you pay for.
Summary: Pros: Close to Disneyland, restaurants, shops and the freeway. Beds were comfortable. Great price.  Cons: Because of heavy use and age, it's a bit worn around the edges. The occasional roach, probably due in large part to families taking food to the rooms. Some black mold in the shower. Pool and hot tub were cold.  They do seem to be doing some remodeling which would almost have to be continual because of the heavy usage.  If you are doing Disney on a budget, this place is for you. If your budget is a little higher, there may be better options.
I normally stay at  Travelodge International  because of the ease of access to the ART bus lines and a Dennys Restaurant next door.  The staff here is friendly and the accommodations acceptable.
ok place to stay. not bad, but breakfast kinda sucked and the beds are a little hard. very nice staff and very helpful . i would stay again, if needed.
Everything was very good other than the sink being clogged for two days and the water pressure was low

great stay----yes it is an old hotel ---but they all are in that area----the service was wonderful----recmd to park and walk to everything there is limited parking ---wi fi worked great comfy bed etc.... would definitely stay here again----

We picked the Travelodge based on price and location. The amenities and service was not at the level of higher end properties, as can be expected. But it was fine. The hot tub was cold. The wifi was fine sometimes, but most times was useless. Could not get on wifi with mobile phones. Sometimes the front desk did not answer. Don't think housekeeping ever cleaned the rooms. But a great value. Beware buying the ART bus passes-they don't come very often, 9/10 times we walked to the Woody lot and hopped on the Disney shuttle.

Summary Heading: By far, the best value out there near Disneyland! Clean rooms and comfy beds, plus extras!
Summary: This is my go to motel whenever I go to Disneyland or come to California. It is, by far, the best value in terms of price and accommodation. There is a $50 deposit but you get free wi-fi that works pretty well consistently, free continental breakfast with a waffle making attendant and of course, free parking (there is limited parking, so you have to secure a spot early or you are sent to Denny's next door to park for the night. Small inconvenience, no biggie.) You get your small fridge, coffeemaker, blowdryer, iron and ironing board, etc. The staff isn't the friendliest but are affable and I've stayed dozens of times with no problems. For what you pay, I don't expect Hilton-like service but I do expect a smooth, pleasant stay and that is what I've always gotten from this

The room was so so, the bathroom had ants all over.  The breakfast was minimal to say the best.  I don't believe we will be staying there again.  The internet was so slow could not get on from any of our devices.

Summary Heading: The Travelodge was a great place to rest after two busy...
Summary: The Travelodge was a great place to rest after two busy days in the theme parks. The room was clean and we had the amenities that we required. This is my second time staying in the property and I know we will be returning next year.

Had two rooms for two nights.  Cheap and close to Disneyland but that's all the good I can say.  Advertises wifi but couldn't ever get connected throughout the day or wee hours of night and stay connected for three or four minutes even.  The breakfast was minimal, small seating area.
Not a high end place by any stretch of the imagination, but for the cost and the proximity to the convention center it was great.

This hotel is very dated - albeit it's cheap and right across from the convention centre and Disneyland is just a couple blocks away.  Still, I wouldn't stay here again. There were ants in the bathroom and the place just felt and looked very rundown.  There are lots of options in Anaheim - use a different option.

Nothing to write home about.  Outside looks great.  Rooms are somewhat dirty, stained, in need of a facelift. White socks are black from walking on the rugs (EWW!).  Needs new linoleum on bathroom floor.  Otherwise clean.  They did not service our room 1 day though we were gone until 2:30 p.m. and supposedly they only service until 3 p.m.  Since we wanted to take a nap for a couple hours and left again at 4:30, they said they were unable to service it.  They did get me clean towels right away at 10 p.m. when we got back from Disneyland, though. The jacuzzi wasn't working while we were there, but they said they would have it fixed by Monday (I will see since I have a reservation for this place and another place and am still deciding which I should do).  I wouldn't pay top dollar

Came here for a conference at the Anaheim convention center. Great location 10 min walking to the convention center.   Room was comfortable enough for a good night sleep- didn't smell and was clean. No bugs were seen. Very basic accommodations so don't expect nice. Maintenence of the room could be improved but everything worked including the hot water.   Breakfast was continental only- waffles, muffins, toast, juice, milk and coffee so don't expect anything more.   Parking is difficult- 1 car per room only. Better during day.   Not so sure about the cleanliness of the spa- weird smell. Pool was not heated so too cold.   Front desk had only 1 person checking people in at check in time...need at least 2. I would stay again for a place to sleep but nothing nice or romantic so not

Summary Heading: I will never stay at a Travelodge again
Summary: I was stayed at this hotel for 3 nights while attending a conference at the convention center.  When I checked in, I was surprised by how nice the room looked.  I was greeted very well by the man behind the desk.  The property was only about 10 minutes away (walking) from the Convention center, and located next to a Denny's that was open 24 hours.  After arriving, I came to learn that the breakfast would be located down the street at the Ramada because of plumbing issues, which I suppose was fine.  I had to be at the convention center before 8 AM, so I opted to skip breakfast.  During the first night, I could hear people above me walking around at night.  I woke up very early to prepare for the day.  I went to take a shower and the no water would come out of the shower and there

Best value within walking distance to Disneyland. The room was clean and spacious with fresh paint and clean beds. There is a shuttle that can be caught right out in front of the hotel, and costs $7 to ride all day. The breakfast is lousy with few options, but the pool and hot tub are great. This place exceeded our expectations for the cost. We were very happy and comfortable while here and the staff were very accommodating. The Denny's is right next door and  is very convenient for those on foot and without a rental car. Wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Arrived at night so didn't realize just how dirty this place was. By morning light , it's a OMG, moment. Ask for non smoking room but people stand outside your door and smoke.  Made coffee in the in room pot and there was stuff floating in it. No extra TP, and NO wash cloths, our feet got black on bottoms from the dirty carpet in the room. We were afraid to sleep on their linen so we put our blankets over theirs and slept on top. Ad says walking distance to Disneyland, Yes if your up for a walk that is over a mile.  Also, The door to our room had to be lifted in order to catch or it wasn't locked. just not a good place to stay. From now on I'll pay the extra money for Clean and secure. Also the front desk people made me feel like I was bothering them, even when checking in.

Summary Heading: This trip was a bumping one to say the least no hot water...
Summary: This trip was a bumping one to say the least no hot water clogged toilet. Closed breakfast room. Breakfast offered at a nearby hotel

It was fair at best. The biggest issues were ants in the room (not coming from the door or window) and lack of hot water. Also, breakfast was moved 3 blocks away due to renovations, which wasn't a problem except the waffles were either not completely cooked or burned.

I stayed here purely because it was the cheapest near Disneyland. Booked about 2 weeks in advance, had no issues using the online reservation system. We checked in very late at night, just after 1am and it was quick and easy. The room was much bigger than I had anticipated (2 Double Beds), but it was incredibly warm and smelled sort of strange. Not bad, persay, but strange. The shower, as many had noted, was absolutely freezing. We only stayed 2 nights, but the water was never warm and to be honest that's definitely a problem. I probably won't stay again because I am a big baby and can't take cold showers and from what I gather, this is an ongoing problem for them.

room was nice and had fridge and micro wave. staff were very helpful and pleasant. air conditioning was noisy and didnt work all that well. one morning there was no hot water and the breakfast room was out of commission. they made arrangements for showers and breakfast at a nearby ramada which was nice but still an inconvenience. for the price we paid we were happy

Summary Heading: The location was great. I didn't like the fact that there...
Summary: The location was great. I didn't like the fact that there were 5 spiders in one of our rooms. We expected all of our rooms to be next to each other abd they weren't.

Summary Heading: Everything was fine except no one cleaned our room. We...
Summary: Everything was fine except no one cleaned our room. We asked the front desk to have it cleaned and all they did was put towels on the bed.

The hotel is clean and nice. I've stayed here many times before and love it. However, this time the woman who checked me in was rude, didn't acknowledge that I was standing there waiting for over 5 minutes, and then proceed to have an attitude.  She may of just been having a bad day.
It's close to the convention center and Disneyland. Also there is many restaurants close by. Breakfast is provided at the hotel which I always enjoy.

For the price, the room was reasonable.   The bathroom had baby spiders coming out of the vents and the floors were so dirty that if you walked barefoot or in white socks, the bottoms would blacken.  The wireless internet was slow, bogged down, or not working.  And finally... parking is NOT guaranteed. What this means is that for about 120 rooms there are less than 60 parking spaces. AND being in the Disneyland/Convention area there is little to no other places to park. So, they say you can park at Denny's... and walk.

Summary Heading: fridge, T.V. and toilet not working properly.
Summary: We have stayed here at the same hotel for four Disneyland trips in the last two years, as well as a couple other small hotels in the same price range. It is very hit and miss on whether the amenities of the room...fridge, T.V., etc. will work as they should or not. However, our last trip, we had trouble with EVERYTHING. Because we were here only two nights this time, we didn't bother to ask to have them looked at. My husband fiddled with the T.V. and we took the lid off the toilet everytime we needed to flush it. Other trips have been better,, though, and this is still at the top of our list. Management just needs to get everything up and working...because your service cannot be beat! I love this hotel's staff, location, and price!!!! Also very clean!
Booked this Hotel for a convention at the Anaheim Convention Center.  Clean Hotel, Great Location Accommodating Staff!

I won't stay here again.  I picked the Travel Lodge because it was within walking distance to the Convention Center.  The sheets were stained and we had to request new sheets.  Of course when we pulled off the sheets the mattresses were even worse!  Have they never heard of mattress protectors?  The floor had water damage and was rotting.  The door to the room was also falling apart and was hard to close.  On the bright side, the wall had been painted and it looked like fairly new carpet.  Lipstick on a pig! Oh...almost forgot to mention that the phone did not work and they fussed at us for not answering our phone. umm...??

Summary Heading: Great for the money? More like great all around!
Summary: It's hit and miss with properties near Disneyland. Some are great, some are bad, and some are downright sketchy. And price isn't always the defining factor.  This Travelodge was very inexpensive, close to Disney, directly adjacent to the ART shuttle for the park, and staffed by friendly, courteous people. The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Water pressure wasn't amazing, but it wasn't bad.  We appreciated the service, the location, the amenities, and definitely the complementary waffle breakfast each morning. The wireless wasn't super fast but it was good enough to get online and do what I needed to do for work before getting back into vacation mode.   Thanks, Travelodge. We'll be back.

We were thinking this was old but it was not to bad. Then cockroaches on the night stands and throughout the room. Yea grossed out big time. Where moved to another room for our last night. Did not sleep.

Being Disneyland Annual Passholders, it can get a little expensive. We usually stay at place located directly across from the park but we decided to stay some where a bit cheaper. We've stayed here before. But it had been while.   We checked in, everything was ok. We got there about 10 minutes early for check in at 3. So we finally get to check into our room. The rooms are eh. We just needed a place to sleep and take showers. We decided to head out to the park. We were gone about two hours or so. When we came back into the room. We noticed that it had looked like someone had taken a shower in our shower. It was wet. Well when we stepped in. The floor was wet. Including the carpet going into the bedroom!!!!!!!!!! We looked at the pipes of the sink to see if it was leaking. Nope.

We stayed here last year without incident. Room was clean and had appropriate amenities for the reasonable price we paid. Location to Disneyland also convenient.  Two-night stay this time--our carpet had numerous iron burns, linoleum in bathroom was old, dirty, and stained. Almost everything in the room was unplugged when we got there. Very OLD model television did not respond to remote; had to call maintenance to come and reprogram it, but first had to find the phone plug and plug it in! We did not have any incidence with bugs. However, next morning, found shower malfunctioning-- hot water was not working. Maintenance called again--he said he was going to have to take the whole shower apart that day to fix it. On heading to Disneyland that morning, requested another room. It
Impulsive trip to Anaheim from Sacramento. We checked in -  the room itself was huge. It was clean, quiet, very comfortable.

This was actually our second stay I  this location. For the price it's a decent deal if you don't mind walking a mile to Disneyland then book it. Only thing is the boiler went out. There was no warm water. We checked out the morning it happened so I'm not sure how fast they fixed it. But overall I know I'll book again.

Location of hotel is great within walking distance to Disney parking lot where you can catch a bus to the park.  The interior of the rooms needs some work with new paint, furniture, and carpet cleaning.  The beds were comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful.  The breakfast was OK with the standard waffles, toast, pastries, cereal, milk, juice and coffee.  The parking can be a problem as the lot will fill up fast on certain days.  They will let you park next door at Denny's, but you have to leave the lot by 8am. All in all, not a bad stay for the very low price.
Good stay as usual but no hot water to take a shower on the first morning. They offered to let me use a room at a sister hotel to take a shower. Problem was fixed the next morning.

Summary Heading: We will always stay here despite the obvious...
Summary: On our most recent trip to DL, we decided to get annual passes. Coming to DL monthly is expensive as is, so we needed to find a cheaper hotel. This is it. Is it super clean? No. Is it amazing with all its amenities? No. Is the breakfast spectacular? No. Do I honestly care greatly about any of those things? Just a little.   Fist off, what I spend for 3 nights was less than the price of 1 for anything literally across the street. Check in was a breeze. We were on the 2nd floor and there is only 1elevator in the rear of the property on the left side. We parked under our room, proceeded up, and when we opened the room, I was suprised. It was clean, it smelled pleasant and was spacious. We had 2 queen beds. As a mom, I proceeded to get everyone's things in order. (Me, husband, and 8

Though the location is nice (being a short bus ride to Disneyland). the property is poorly maintained and needs a big makeover. We had cockroaches in our drawers and bathroom, someone else's medication left under the bed, and a general lack of pride in how the place looked. Office staff were young and bored.

My wife, 3year old daughter, and I checked in on Monday February 16th and checked out on the 19th. The room was non-smoking with 2 Queen beds. The room was clean. There was a small fridge and microwave. The continental free breakfast was simple and satisfying. Overall all great place to stay on a budget. Also there is a Denny's next door.

I guess for the rate it was good but the room had old paint, holes in walls, old TV, smelled stuffy. A fresh coat of paint would be a much needed improvement with insultated windows to cut down on the Hardor Blvd traffic noise.

Our room was not the cleanest - certain parts were kept very clean and many others were obviously quite dirty.  The fridge did not work at all, the safe was missing its key, the bathroom floor was sticky, and etc.  The staff were courteous to us and quick abut tidying up the room each day.  The breakfast options were scanty and unhealthy but they were tasty.  The breakfast room is nice and tasteful.  The inn is a 15 minute wak from Disneyland and has a bus stop right out front.  We probably won't stay there again, but considering the price we can't complain too much.  We got a very good deal on this room.

Room was nasty and humid. Phone didn't work, bathroom vent didn't work, safe didn't work. Table in the room was sticky and not cleaned once during my stay. Tried asking for another room but there was no vacancy! Wont stay there again. Also parking fills up and you have to park at Denny's next door and be out of that parking lot by 8 am. Also, wall under sink was cut out and never fixed piece is just pushed back in. Im pretty sure I also saw a cockroach but cant verify that since it ran. Carpet was disgusting and had 2 iron burn marks on it id like to know when it was last cleaned.

Since i arrived at this Hotel I felt so bad. I arrived at the hostel at 2pm trying to check inn before 3pm and the front desk was so rude and typing on his smart phone without even paying attention to me. He said he could not check me in before 3pm and I would need to return later. The front desk was probably chatting with someone on his phone and he looked very bored with his job. At 3pm I decided to return to the room and again he was so rude and just asked me for my credit card for deposit, gave me the key and didnt give me any further information about the hotel like wifi, location of the room or the time of the breakfast.  When I came inside the room, it was smelling kinda bad and there was used soap and shampoo on the bed. The wifi password I just found out when i saw they

This hotel does the job by providing a simple place to sleep. But, we did find a cockroach on the end table between the beds in the middle of the night. Could have been the time of year. Other than that, it was just fine.
After checking in they assigned our room to another party and they walked in on my sleeping husband and teen daughter

We were going to stay here but as soon as we entered the room, the roaches scattered.  There was a large roach crawling on the mirror and baby roaches inside the drawers.  We only spent 2 minutes in the room before we decided we couldn't stay. The front desk was kind enough to give us a refund.

Summary Heading: Good for the price, but it is very cheap. 2/5 not based on price.
Summary: OK, so I got this hotel by surprise booking on Hotwire. I payed so little for it (plus I had a $20 hotwire promo code) that I almost felt guilty. I looked up the hotel on TripAdvisor and was a little scared due to the mixed reviews, website photos etc.  I've made a few points below  Check in - Friendly and no problem  Room - Old and beat up, but clean.  beds were comfy enough.  Never saw a bug, but the fridge didn't work very well. The maids did a great job cleaning up every day.   Breakfast- VERY GOOD.  Yes its only waffles, toast cereal etc, but they have a modern breakfast room and its run very well by the staff. (not sure why management does not update photos on website???)  Scary characters - A few "cheap motel weirdos" around, but we felt safe as it was mostly Disney

Summary Heading: First room had roaches in it.  We were moved to another...
Summary: First room had roaches in it.  We were moved to another room. Beds were comfortable.  Sidewalks uneven & dangerous.  Good price for the location.

Ideally close the Anaheim Convention Center, great rates, courteous staff. I have already rebooked a room for next years' Namm Show. Walking distance to restaurants, ample parking. Like Arnie "I'll be back"

Horrible stay. Room was musty. Carpet felt greasy and sticky and turned our feet black.  Mold in corners of the shower and on curtain covering window.  Foul sewer smell coming from drain in sink. Bathtub plug didn't work. Chip crumbs on the floor and under the beds. Dirty shoe print and hair on bed sheets.  Batteries for remote were held in by tape - choking hazard for  3 year old.  House keeping didn't knock or announce who they were before trying to enter the room.

Summary Heading: reasonable rate, helpful personnel   rooms were  clean and...
Summary: reasonable rate, helpful personnel   rooms were  clean and comfortable close  to   Disneyland    would  definitely stay again  the outdoor pool was too cold for swimming but the  hot tub was wonderful.......
The water faucets were reversed - hot on the right and cold on the left.  The carpet was wet in front of the sink in the vanity counter.  A cockroach was awakened in the bed covers.

I was there this weekend and the lady helping out with the breakfast was so rude and disrespectful. Not only to me but to other quest that were just trying to get their morning started. I went to make a waffle for my daughter and didn't realize we had to read the signs before eating. I was in the processes of making our waffles and this lady poke my arm and pointed at a sign and said "read the sign" very rude and Embarrassing to me specially because there were more people there. The next morning my daughter and I just skipped the breakfast. We went to a nearby Starbucks.

This place isn't perfect, the nitpicky amongst us will be kept busy, but this is the place I stay every time I go to Anaheim. On Harbor towards the tail end of the acceptable area of the Anaheim resort area, this travelodge gives me a clean comfortable place to sleep while I'm at the Big A, Knotts, Honda center, Convention center, and of course, Disneyland. Beds are not all the same mattress in every room but are on the medium to soft side. Most rooms have flat screens and the cable package is as good as home. You might need help with the remotes, mine wouldn't turn the tv on last time, but would switch channels, and adjust volume. Bathrooms are clean but will have little things wrong you wouldn't see in higher end places, like mismatched tiles, leaky tub faucets etc.. The

Good location, close to Hwys and Disney Land. Room carpet was clean so it means they are doing good job cleaning, however, old TV set with half broken remote, slow Wi-Fi speed and broken bathroom handle - need some upgrade. Otherwise it's good value for money.

Summary Heading: Nice price, but needs a lot of work
Summary: Love the price, but shocked at how run down and rough this property is.  Would rate it as a 1 star hotel without hesitation.  Clean enough, but in desperate need of a full renovation.

Summary Heading: We had to move rooms three times. First there was a big...
Summary: We had to move rooms three times. First there was a big water leak in the bathroom and second was because the phone did not work.

We've stayed at this hotel on 3 other occasions and always had a good experience until the last time we stayed here.   Our car was covered in cigarette butts every morning where people were throwing them off the balconies above. The rooms were always a little worn and tired but this time they had definitely passed their used by date.   The breakfast was the most basic breakfast but with stale donuts and pastries. Again we had always enjoyed this in previous visits.    The from desk were not friendly at all. I once Recommend this place to fellows travellers but not anymore.

I stay here because it is close to Disneyland and the Resort transit stops right at the hotel. The price is reasonable for that area and the hotel is older but clean and the staff is very nice and helpful.

After reading some of the reviews I thought it was not going to be so great but it definitely did all I needed it to do.  Was there for 3 days going to Disneyland was gone early morning back late at night.  Bed was comfy, sheets clean.  Bathroom was good, good price.  And nice and close to Disneyland.  So worked for me! :)

No hot water after 9 am. Took cold showers. Breakfast staff was incredibly rude. The internet never worked, not at all. My sister who stayed next door got it working once but it was too slow to even check email. The carpets were filthy and stained. The outlets were wobbly and plugs fell out of them easily. The room smelled bad.
disgusting rooms no hot water.  stains on the walls, dirty carpets, no real lock on the door.

We stayed here 3 nights while going to disneyland. 1 mile walking distance from the park. After walking all day in the park it was very relaxing to rest in the hot tub and sleep in a very comfortable bed refreshed for another day at the park.

Internet connection went down several times and I had to call to have the router reset.  Breakfast is small and all carbs - waffles, cereal, hard muffins.  Place looks old, water temp is difficult to predict - scalding and icy at same setting, too many other great places around to bother with this one.  Very cheap place to stay and very close to convention center, 5 min walk?

Hosts were cordial and accommodating. The room, 129, is in extreme need of rehab. Wallpaper peeling, dirty corners, entrance door threshold has a one inch gap, electric outlets worn out, bath (ugh), dirty carpet, ceiling stains, beds were u shaped from over use,Wi-Fi was dial up speed and this is just the start.  One good thing, the tv was excellent with many choices of channels. Upon check out I noticed a large stack of complaints on the counter.

Summary Heading: If you're looking for a place to sleep...
Summary: This Travelodge is just what it's name says, that is, an inn. It's certainly not a resort by any means, but if you're not planning to stay in a place that captures the Disney ambiance, and just need a place to crash, it will do the job. It's certainly quite dated, and not as scrubbed clean as you would hope. Just make sure to bring slippers for walking on the carpet, and keep in mind that your car cannot be in the lot past check out time at 11. It is in walking distance of the park, but with the parking policy, you'll need to move your car anyway unless you plan on staying more than one night. Stopped by the breakfast, and didn't see any protein. Could be good for a light snack though.

Summary Heading: Great value for price, good location.
Summary: I stay at this hotel every year when I visit Disneyland. The location is great, within walking distance of the park and a short walk to the shuttle stop. My only complaint, if you could call it one, is that the rooms could use a bit of a facelift. Things are just a bit out of date. But the rooms have always been clean and tidy, the breakfast is great, they make awesome waffles and I've always been happy with the service. It's also nice that all the rooms face a courtyard so it's quiet at night.  It's not a four star hotel but I'll keep coming back.

I was actually surprised at this place. I stay in these kinds of hotels all over the place, and this was great for the price. The lady was making everyone waffles in the morning, Great location and decent room for the price. I'd stay here again.

Affordable, but needs a good cleaning. My feet were black on the bottom from the dirty carpets, the bathtub needed some TLC. Decor didn't bother me, not for the great price. But the cleanliness was not great and don't even bother trying to use the free internet, it never works.
