Beds were clean, drapes were falling off the hooks and were very dirty. Only one TV channel, I think the cable remote was dead. When I checked to see if the cable was plugged in well, I moved a metal trash can that was propped up against the plug and the TV went off. Electrical hazard. The metal trash can had to hold the plug in place. The wall mounted outlet had an inch give into the wall. Smoke poured into our bathroom when someone above our room was smoking. Convenient location. Mildew smell strong from old filters in AC unit. You can see the dirt piled up on them.

Room was neat and clean , except the comforter had an old blood stain in it, which was GROSS, very unhygienic. Overall It was a neat and good hotel for the price I got and walking distance to Disney. I was with 2 kids and stroller and 2 adults. It was a good 15 min walk, but didn't mind the walk rather than taking the bus.  Breakfast was better than I expected with fruits, pancakes and coffee and tea of course.

Although when looking at the hotel online it looked very appealing but, once we arrived it was apparent that it was just a basic room with the usual amenities in the room.  The telephone in the room was not working and even though I reported it 5 times nothing was done about and I feel if there was an emergency it could of been a bit of a shambles especially since my son who I was with had EPILEPSY and if i needed medical help I could phone for help and needed to leave my son on his own if he was fitting.  Luckily he never had a fit but, I feel this needs to looking into and the reporting maybe needs sorted out. Another thing was there was at times language problems as a lot of the workforce where of Hispanic origin and spoke little or no basic English at all.  To be honest

Summary Heading: The staff member handling the breakfast room was very clean...
Summary: The staff member handling the breakfast room was very clean and efficient. I loved the fact they had a housekeeper helping with the breakfast room instead of a bunch of kids grubbing up everything.  Negative was that there was missing paint and chunks out of the bathroom wall where the shower rod and been replaced but nothing had been repaired.

When asked for extra towels it took a long time. I called twice. I asked if I could go to front and pick them up but they told me I need to wait. Other than this our room was fine. This was our second time staying at this location and we will definately stay again.

Summary Heading: Nothing spectacular, but good value place to stay
Summary: Got this on hotwire and honestly, were a little worried given some of the reviews here. But really, we didn't find it nearly as bad as a long of people thing. Room was clean. Everything a little dated, but clean and beds were comfortable. Parking didn't turn out to be an issue for us, got a little busier on the weekend we were there but even coming back after midnight on Friday night we were able to find a few spots left. And if you can't park there, you're allowed to park at the Denny's right next door. Breakfast was good for continental. Really anything above muffins and donuts at a two star hotel is bonus, this place had cereal, waffles made to order, oatmeal, fruit, juice, etc. Coffee wasn't good but everything else was pretty good we found. Staff wasn't out of their way

We encountered so many issues that we don't have the desire to stay here again. The only positive I can give is that the room had been cleaned. We are not people who need a nicely updated room, flat screen tv`s etc, but we do have standards. Upon check in, there is a sign that says you have to have your vehicle moved by check out. Yet they advertise being in walking distance of the Toy Story parking lot. I have never stayed in a hotel in the Disneyland area that has this policy!! I feel this is wrongly advertised. I asked to speak to a manager...several times...and wished I hadn't. She was rude & made me realize she did not care about managing the hotel. Upon entering the room, the first thing you notice is the holes in the paint on the walls, in the bathroom and the only

The two rooms we rented for us and out- of- town family were nice enough but shabby.  Our room had just been painted, the smoke alarm was missing, there wasn't a plug in the sink and there were pieces missing from the bathroom counter.  The painters has left a cigarette in the bathroom and we could tell they had been smoking in the room.  I never saw the other room we rented, so I don't know how embarrassed I should be for it's condition.  The night desk clerk was grumpy!

This place used to be perfect for just sleeping and showering after a long fun day at disneyland.  I booked my room about 2 weeks in advanced, good a pretty good deal but come to find out my room was never booked according to the hotel. then some how ended up getting charged for two rooms. horrible customer service and dirty smelling room. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! oh and the "free" breakfast is a joke!

Summary Heading: Walk to Toy Story Parking Lot
Summary: We make several trips to Disneyland every year.  We are always trying to find nice hotels/motels at a reasonable price.  This last trip in October we tried the Travelodge on South Harbor.  We found it very satisfactory.  Check in was easy and the room was clean.  We were on the second floor of three, so there was some noise sometimes from above.  It is an easy walk to the Toy Story Parking lot where you can catch a bus for FREE to Disneyland.  The free breakfast was okay, but nothing to write home about.  Overall, a good experience at an affordable price.

Although this hotel has room for improvement, I was satisfied with my stay, based on the modest price of the room and no problems that could not be dealt with. We did have a small problem with the plumbing, but we received immediate help. The only other problem we had was noise at 3 am, but that happens in many other places near Disneyland, and I cannot fault the management for it. We wanted to save money and we did, with a comfortable sleep and professional treatment by all the staff. One thing we learned was that the Denny's next door is much better than some reviews we read, and so we had breakfast there instead of the continental breakfast at the hotel. Also we were within a short walking distance to the Toy Story parking lot, where we were able to ride to the Disneyland

Great price for the Disneyland location. knowledgeable, helpful and Friendly staff. Good simple breakfast to start off your day. Rooms by the street are a little noisy. Overall had a great stay will stay here again!

Summary Heading: review of week stay at travelodge on harbor blvd in anaheim
Summary: we were very happy with our room. it was clean, roomy, and great. we really enjoyed the breakfast each morning, especially the waffles. Could've used some more fruit though. Maybe oranges. hot cocoa would be nice too. the staff were very helpful and I appreciated the on site laundry room. it was so nice that we have already book three rooms for december when we bring back some of out kids and grandkids. thanks for a great weekend

The beds were comfortable and the breakfast had a couple of things to choose from. The breakfast area was well kept. However, the room was not very clean. Carpets were black and the bathroom really could have used a good scrubbing. I didn't have trouble with the parking, but vans from a tour company load in the lot mid morning. They were very accommodating and moved when asked. It is walking to the Toy Story parking lot, and that was nice. Cleanliness was the biggest issue.

Summary Heading: if you want to stay healthy dont stay here
Summary: stayed here for a few days to go to Disneyland. mold in the bathroom and huge water stains on the ceiling. I think the place had black mold. 3 out of 4 of us got really sick. when I told the front desk I would be checking out early due to this I was told there was no refunds. I had to check out early anyway because none of us could stand it anymore. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! RUDE FRONT DESK PEOPLE AND UNHEATHY PLACE!!!!

Ok so I'm going to keep this review short and sweet. Although you may find this hotel to be very cheap, there is a reason for that.   We stayed 5 nights, found cockroaches IN OUR BED three of the nights. the third night we called the front desk and he gave us a new room but not without the attitude that a 13 year old gives when you ask him to take out the trash.   They have these star line tour buses that come in the morning right when EVERYONE wants to go to the park and they block the entire entrance and DO NOT move for you. I went to the front desk and asked if she could tell them to move so we could get out and the lady said "you can ask the lady in the pink, she can help you" how rude is that? I'm the guest, i shouldn't have to do any of that, that is THEIR JOB!   After
Got a $55 rate for 3 nights. Bad desk service. Puddle in bathroom. Wet rug. Hair on sheets. Never again.
Hotel was old and dirty. Shower curtain rod had rust. Carpets are very dirty. Baseboards were filthy.

We've stayed here at least ten times before. I've always enjoyed my stay here until most recently. This has always been a place where you get a good nights sleep, hot shower and a descent breakfast for the price. This trip sucked and this is why: it's a smoke free hotel, however, they allow for smoking right outside the rooms. As we pulled up and were unloading car a guy was smoking on stairwell. I asked him politely if he minded moving to another location. He declined by saying that this was the only place he could smoke. He happened to be our neighbor so I asked the office to relocate. She was great about it Let me move rooms. However, the next two nights had the same issue. People freely smoking outside their rooms. I called the office and they said that they allow smoking
Pro- Walking distance to the convention center.  Friendly staff  Cons -  No protein at breakfast (scrambled eggs would be nice),  Weak WiFi,  Limited Parking (get back early or you won't find a spot)

Starline tours blocked exit/entrance and were rude when asked to move. Hair in shower. Rude desk personal when checking out. Breakfast choices not comparable to other travelodges. Parking is a problem. Smoking area right by our non-smoking room.

The hotel was clean and staff was friendly!  Nice and quiet at night,  short on parking during the evening hours but you can park next door v at Dennys. About a mile from Disneyland but they have a shuttle pick up right out front of the hotel.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: We booked this as a hotwire hot deal for a quick overnight stay. We got a great rate, but the room was in poor condition.   Luckily the AC worked and the bed was comfortable.  Room had stained prints on the wall, bathroom light fixtures dangling from the ceiling and a tube TV.  If you need a cheap room and don't care about looks or frills, this place might be for you.   However, if you expect a decent room and a good price- look elsewhere.

The room was okay- could benefit from a fresh coat of paint as there were a lot of marks and stains on the walls.  The bathroom was clean, but the toilet had a strange stain on it, a new toilet seat would go a long way as it was pretty gross to think about.  Breakfast was the typical continental style- toast, juice, coffee, muffins, and make-your-own waffles.  I love hotel waffles, so that was good for me!  Decor inside the room was dated, but didn't detract from the stay.

We stayed here for three nights from the 10th Sept 2014 - overall we found the hotel staff to be friendly and the rooms were perfectly adequate for our requirements.  The only issue we had requested a roll-away bed through hotels.com but the hotel staff did not appear to know anything about it.  We therefore requested one upon arrival which unfortunately we did not receive, but the hotel staff were quick to resolve the issue the next day (and only charged us for one night’s use of the additional bed).  The hotel is in a great location for Disney, especially given the price of some of the neighbouring hotels - which seem to charge a premium for being so close.  On our first day at Disney we drove there (which is literally just a 20-30 minute walk away door to door) but found that

Summary Heading: All that was missing was the rats
Summary: HORRIBLE!!  carpets stained, burnt and lumps that looked like something was trying to burrow upwards. Cigarette burns on vanity and bathroom floor. Woke up in the middle of the night to the burning smell of an electrical fire only to realize it was coming from the air conditioner! Strong sewage smell coming from vanity drain and bathroom tub drain, had to plug both up at night. NOISY and DIRTY! Red Lion is up the street, MUCH nicer for 10 bucks more.

Summary Heading: The room was in obvious need of an update. Old tube tv...
Summary: The room was in obvious need of an update. Old tube tv, peeling furniture, pillows that are so uncomfortable my arm was easier to sleep on. The a/c was a beast of noise everytime it kicked in it woke me up. The upstairs room sounded like the person walking around would fall through the floor. I suppose you get what you pay for.

This was a good cost savings place to stay. The waffle breakfast every day was good.  The place showed signs of deferred maintenance but was a relatively clean comfortable stay.  If all you are looking for is a cheap place to sleep while you go to Disneyland than this isn't a bad option for you.

For just a little above 50$/day we got a HUGE ROOM with a BIG BATHROOM, BIG TV, heated jaccuzzi, huge swimming pool, microwave and refrigerator in the room, FREE WIFI and walking distance from Disneyland- with the Toy STory parking lot next doors... What more can you want!!!  The breakfast was pretty ok with fruit juices, cereals, bread, cakes and muffins and the best waffles made by a kind lady.  Yes this is a Travelodge and some of the things can be a little worn out- but I don't expect more than what I got... The room service was top class... Infact much better than some of the Marriots, Hiltons and Hyatts I have stayed. Since I was in disneyland for 12 hours a day-atleast.. this was a good enough place for me.

Travelodge delivers  once again. Second visit to disneyland in five months; first visit stayed at Travelodge located north of disney without any complaints except for the location from the tram parking-quite a hike. This location had all the amenities I was looking for. Because I booked more than 3 nights I got a "smokin' deal" as well. The toy story lot is a half a block north of the hotel with no waiting; you walk in via sidewalk past the pay booths. If I had any complaints it would be the lack of fruit with breakfast and the internet didn't work well with my iPad but I was able to use it in the breakfast area. Also carpet cleaning was done before we checked in so it smelled damp and musty instead of clean. It was dry and much better by the second day. Overall I was very

Summary Heading: Not as good as the last time
Summary: This was a change since the last time I stayed here 2 years ago.  This time we stayed in Room #311.  The room was rundown and the very loud air conditioner barely worked.  The hot and cold water were reversed.  There were holes in the wall from where the hair dryer used to be mounted and mold in the bathroom.  The best thing in the room was the refrigerator, That worked really well.  Also the room is a very good size.

We spent 7 nights at the hotel at the end of August with the intent of visiting Disneyland.  We wanted a room that was close to the resort, but not too expensive.  This hotel fit the bill.  We walked to the Toy Story parking lot to catch the shuttle directly to the park and we had a room to come back to.  However, the room we had (101) was very dirty.  Mold on the walls, dirty around the base of the toilet, the carpet as you enter the room was black (the carpet has a square pattern that could be seen in the corners), the headboards were sticky, the towels and wash clothes were very thin, the blackout curtains had holes in them and when we had neighbors in room 102 anytime they entered their room it was very loud.  Sounded like someone scratching at our door.  It was very odd and
very close to disneyland! also can hop on the shuttle at the toy story lot and ride right into the park.

Summary Heading: Would stay again in a hot minute
Summary: Considering what I paid for rooms at this hotel, I was initially concerned, but very surprised upon arrival.  While we didn't spend much time at the facility, spending all day at the Disney resorts, the rooms were clean, had frig, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, TV, mine didn't work but that was ok, as I didn't have time to watch it, radio and a breakfast that was very decent with waffles, pastries, cereal, juices, coffee and toast.  A/C worked wonderfully as it was very hot, I know better than to be in S. Calif. in August, but Disneyland was calling me.  This was not by any means one of the nicer facilities I've stayed at previously, but again, considering the price and just around the corner from the parking facility and surrounded by good restaurants and noise at a

This hotel was an enjoyable stay. The price was really cheap, but the hotel did not feel cheap. It is not far from Disneyland, though it was too far to walk.   The hotel itself was comfortable and felt safe. The rooms were clean and the beds were plenty comfortable.  Overall it was a great value for what we paid. Would like to have been walking distance to the park, but if you don't mind a shuttle, I would recommend this hotel.
This property has nice personnel and pool area is fine. the rooms however needed a lt The staff is friendly, would of liked a little better variety for the continental breakfast.

This was the third of four that my wife and I stayed at on our trip to Disneyland.  It is half of a mile away from the park, so perfectly doable if you don't want to pay for the bus.  And, it was a massive improvement over the Travelodge at the north end of the Las Vegas strip, for two reasons.  1. It has a fridge.  2. The carpets are clean.  I believe my Wife and I may return to this hotel in the future.

The room was ok .  I took my grandson to a baseball game  for his birthday. When we got back to the hotel there was no parking    I had to go park at a parking lot next door at the rear of Denny's   I hAve a handicap placer on my car  which for me was not an  easy thing

Great location and room.  Only thing I had a problem with was the parking at the hotel and the drainage.  Toilet clogged up one night and took a while to drain.  The sink in the room did not drain well when using it.  Other than that, it was a great week.

We had stayed here 12 years ago and I do not think it has been updated since. The room was outdated and dirty. I had slippers on at all times and threw them away after my 3 night stay as they are black from the dirty carpet. The breakfast was too small for the amount of people that were there. We were on the ground floor and were kept up all night by the people upstairs. I won't stay here again. I'll pay a bit more to have a comfortable, clean place to stay.

Summary Heading: This is hotel is conveniently located near the Toy Story...
Summary: This is hotel is conveniently located near the Toy Story parking lot for Disneyland shuttles. The rooms are decent. Nothing to complain about except the bathroom needs some renovations. But overall if you are just sleeping there, this hotel is perfect for a Disneyland vacation.

You get what you pay for.  I kept saying this to myself like the others on this site.  Worn out hotel that needs some serious updating.  I have attached pictures.  Just average but CLOSE to Disney! Check in staff BAD NEWS.......Hey, you don't like your job, don't WORK!  Go sweep floors for heavens sake.  Don't bring your bad attitude to the customers!  (Just some advice check in people......Life is not that bad!).  Checked in and first room still had cups, t-shirts and other "personal" items on the beds (yes, beds were made).  My wife said sorry, not staying in this room.  Went back down to check-in lobby and had to wait behind 4 other families checking in before I could get the front desk persons attention to switch rooms (yes, she saw me waiting there and said NADA!).  So, new

Summary Heading: Good location but that is all
Summary: Pros: Great location if you are going to disneyland.  Quiet Coin operate laundry Clean  Cons: Old and tired Had issues with the bathroom. Had to complain 4 times before they offered us a new room Very basic breakfast (go to dennys)  Would pay extra to stay somewhere else next time

This hotel's best feature is undoubtedly its geographic situation, only a 20' walk away from the Disneyland parks. The room was big, clean, very comfortable and rather quiet. Parking is easy and suitable, usually right in front of your room. The personnel was friendly and happily answered all my questions about the local attractions. The breakfast was decent, although there weren't any fresh, healthy products like fruit or yoghurt, but that is the case in every single Travelodge I visited. This one had been recommended by a friend, and I would definitely recommend it myself.

Summary Heading: Roaches are complimentary with your stay!
Summary: We checked into the horrid place last Friday night. We spent the night on Friday and when we woke up Saturday morning, we turned on the lights to find the room covered and I mean covered in cockroaches! They were scattering and were on the walls and on our belongings.  This was at 6am Saturday. We were booked for Saturday night as well but instead we immediately left the room, had to shake all of our stuff to make sure we weren't taking any roaches with us and we went to the office. The office was closed but they have this window on the side that you can walk up to and speak to someone before the office opens at 8. So we walk up to the window and tell the guy what just happened. He looks at us with a idiotic blank stare and tells us he will just cancel our Saturday night stay

We checked into the horrid place last Friday night. We spent the night on Friday and when we woke up Saturday morning, we turned on the lights to find the room covered and I mean covered in cockroaches! They were scattering and were on the walls and on our belongings.  This was at 6am Saturday. We were booked for Saturday night as well but instead we immediately left the room, had to shake all of our stuff to make sure we weren't taking any roaches with us and we went to the office. The office was closed but they have this window on the side that you can walk up to and speak to someone before the office opens at 8. So we walk up to the window and tell the guy what just happened. He looks at us with a idiotic blank stare and tells us he will just cancel our Saturday night stay

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for....horrible!
Summary: Stayed (currently in room as I write this) at this hotel and by far the worst ever! I had stayed here in 2008 and felt the same but gave it another chance because of price. Still the same!  1) our room smelled like cigarettes  2) room had cigarettes on floor of non smoking room.  3) smoke alarm chirped the whole first night because it needed a battery, told front desk the next morning and was told maintenance would fix it. Came back to room at 9pm and still chirping! On way to parkcat 10pm told front desk it was still chirping they said it would be fixed. We got back to room a little after midnight and surprise surprise still chirping! Called front desk and they said maintenance just left it would have to wait til morning.....he said all he could do was take it down. Its a
We had 3 rooms for 3 nights everything went well, front desk was really nice and helpful. Waffle lady was sweet and friendly.

I booked through a third party, AMOMA. I paid AMOMA the full nickel for the room. They sent me a voucher to give to the Travelodge. I was told by Travelodge staff no worries, the room was paid for already. I was double charged by Travelodge for my stay. They nailed me for the whole week I stayed. I am pretty livid. The room itself was plain. The fridge sat on an old phone book at an odd angle and froze everything inside. The bathroom was ok, but the shower was pretty ucky looking. The curtain rod had been messed with and not sitting well, so the maintenance man used a nail to try to secure the rod. Didnt work, just didnt care at that point. For $55 a night, we got a room that was woth $38 a night at best.

This was the WORST hotel stay that I have ever had! The carpet in the room was so dirty that our socks were black!! One morning we woke up to a roach on our wall. The mini fridge froze our stuff and ruined some of our food. When we called to let the front desk know and they replaced it with one that froze our stuff again!! We asked for towels 3 times! Twice we were told that they were out and that some would be delivered. Finally, the next morning, we went to the front desk to get them ourselves. The pool was WAY over chlorinated and cloudy. One day the toilet needed repair. Someone from maintenance came pretty quickly, but left a mess when he was finished. The young man at the front desk was so rude when we checked out! I told him about all of the situations and asked for an

We choose the travelodge based on it's price.   Less than 100.00 a day was fantastic.  So we checked into our room and went to the park.  When we returned for the night, we found popcorn in our sheets.  Food stains on one of the pillow cases.  Hair on the floor of the bathroom, and around the sink.   so not cleaned very well.  Oh, and our AC unit wasn't working properly.  It turned on for 3 minutes then turned off for about 15.  So it took a while for our room to cool.  We called the front desk.  Because it was night, they didn't have any maintenance staff on call.  They promised maintenance to be at our room, when they arrived, first thing in the morning.  But maintenance never came.  We did have them change the sheets in the morning.  Anyway they did take 15.00 off for our

This hotel was horrible. The customer service was terrible and the rooms were disgusting. We went out and bought our own blankets, towels and disinfecting wipes to wipe down the counter because it was so dirty. We had someone bang on our door at 2a.m. on a Friday night and the room smelled of old smoke. We did not feel safe or clean. I will never ever stay in a Travelodge again.

Dust/dirt build up is a good indicator of minimal cleaning performed daily, and perhaps the weekly, monthly, bi-annual and annual cleaning schedule have gone out the window. However, little hard shell bugs in the room are not cool. You might as well rent tents and sleeping bags for a more inclusive outdoor experience.
Old hotel in need of renovation. Smelly, dirty bathroom and no hot water morning of check out.  Had to go down the street to "sister" property to have a shower.  It was no better.

Very clean, near to Disneyland, affordable, and spacious room. Breakfast was very simple with cereal, pastries, and waffles. Great boost to start the day and no money spent!  Dennys is right next door for a late dinner after the park. This will now be our hotel when we visit Disneyland. Great deal and quality! Pool was clean also.

I was kind of worried when booking this hotel. But once we got there, it was perfectly fine. Nice and safe location, big rooms, and they even had complimentary breakfast that was actually good. The convention center was just a 5 minute walk and Disneyland was 10. It was everything I needed it to be.

Summary Heading: Great value hotel and walking distance to Disneyland. Lots...
Summary: Great value hotel and walking distance to Disneyland. Lots of places to eat around hotel. Will stay here again!!

Summary Heading: I traveled to Anaheim for VidCon and decided to stay here...
Summary: I traveled to Anaheim for VidCon and decided to stay here based on the fact it was the cheapest place to stay. The service and rooms were fine. They weren't great or anything, but it was a place to stay.

Summary Heading: The rooms looked nice and up kept. but the rooms weren't...
Summary: The rooms looked nice and up kept. but the rooms weren't cleaned daily. they charged me for a parking spot and then ran out of room in the lot and made us park at Denny's. that was just terrible. They need to work on those things and make our stays a little more enjoyable.

If you are attending a convention this hotel is a reasonable walking distance, however it is at least twice as far to Disneyland but I think there is a bus that stops often in front of it to take you there. The room I stayed in was very much in need of a remodel.  It needed new carpet and fresh paint.  The hotel staff clearly does not pay much attention to cleanliness.  The walls were dirty and the carpet was smelly in places.  I would only recommend it if you are looking for a cheap option for sleeping, especially if you aren't planning on spending much time in your room.
while booking the lodge i requested @1Pm and they gave the room to so many people  but not me. and power plugs not working . no hot water. some stinky smell in the room.

we  liked  our  stay  here  a  quite  large room  with  microwave refridadare and coffe maker  parking  right  in  front  of  the  room  very  handy  for  breakfast  we  had  the  best  waffels complimentary   the  service  was  good
Travelodge Inn and Suites was very cozy hotel. The hotel was quiet; roomy;  very affordable; close to convention center and bus stop.

Summary Heading: Huge room, great rate, but high hotel taxes/broken couch
Summary: Stayed here for 2 nights in June 2014, with large family for Disney vacation.  Called hotel directly on the way to Anaheim.  Got a rate of $179/night.  Room was huge!  2 bdrm suite with 1 king bed, 1 queen bed, and 2 full-size sofa beds, with room for an air bed or a couple of rollaways, two full baths, table/chairs, fridge and microwave.  Less than 10 mins. from Disney.   You can park at Disney for $17, with a tram to the park.  Or, about a block away, you can park for $16(no big savings here) and take a free shuttle to the park.   Free continental breakfast from 7-10.  Waffle maker, breads, cereal/milk, assorted juices, coffee.  No protein, but decent start to the day. Only 3 complaints- -hotel tax equaled $30 per night, making the room essentially  $210.  Seems pretty steep.

I was absolutely abhorred to see the filth in our room. The shower was covered in calcium and rust, the sheets all had mystery stains, and there were still bits of trash on the floor from the previous customer. Also, the breakfast selection and quality is very underwhelming.

The location is the best part, right next door to the Disneyland parking, and within a mile of Disneyland and Downtown Disney!  The room was okay, the breakfast was nothing but carbs and sugar and the staff was okay too, if it wasn't for the location, I would not have stayed there.  The price was also weird, when we booked for Mon and Tues was were quoted $67 a night, then we asked if we could stay longer, just one more night and was told that our same room would then be $120 a night.?!

Summary Heading: It's a Place to sleep 5 out of 10
Summary: Great location, outstanding price, good service, the rooms are clean, the rooms are outdated and needs face lift (1980 style). for the price and location it's a good place to rest your head after a day at Disney. I would stay again. Only a mile walk with shops and restraints on the way to Disney if your lazy there is a bus,you have to pay $5 per adult and $2 for kids.

Summary Heading: Cheap in a good location, late check-in desk problems.
Summary: I had decided to book a room here for a few nights due to an event at the convention center (10 min walk at the most). The rates are cheap and the rooms are good enough to get ample rest. My room came with all of the standards that you would expect a room to have (beds, tv, fridge, microwave, etc)  What really put me off during this stay was the check-in desk late at night. My flight was delayed we arrived to the hotel around midnight. Upon arrival, we see a group of people waiting around the check in desk area. Getting closer to the check in desk door, there is a sign that read "Be back in 20 minutes". I asked some people already there and they said that they have been waiting for at least an hour.  I was a little upset at the situation. The group that I traveled with were
Great value ..on family vacation. room's need to be upgraded ..some outlets didn't work and the drapes had holes in them(really).Limited parking available.

Great place to stay. We always stay here when we visit the Disneyland parks! Good value. Rooms are pretty muggy and moist, I would recommend people bring pillows of their own, because the ones here are lumpy and uncomfortable.  That would be my only complaint about the hotel. Its a great place to stay!
After seeing the rooms were to be staying in, I literally got in my car and drove around trying to find another hotel to accommodate our large family.
The service was poor. the employees are not friendly at all. The room was comfortable for the price.

Summary Heading: Our first room at this hotel was absolutely terrible. The...
Summary: Our first room at this hotel was absolutely terrible. The entire room smelled like mold and though non smoking the vent for the room was in the designated smoking area of the hotel! We requested a room change and were moved to a more outdated room but at least it didn't smell! Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the bathroom floor had apparently flooded at some point, everything felt dingy.

This Hotel is nice on the outside. When I arrived in my room, the first thing I noticedthe first thing I noticed was the 3 big holes in the wall! The beds were hard as a rock, the bathroom had 2 used wash cloths hanging over the shower curtain. I will never stay there again!
Decent hotel for money. Did have a cockroach in my bathroom the first night but what did I expect for California!

we stayed for a week going to disneyland and etc.  we had to move because there was a water leak coming from the light in the bathroom and the bathroom was flooded when we woke up. the bath room needed repair and the whole light fixture at the sink was falling out.  During showers the water temp. would go ice cold and then very hot.We will not stay again at a Travelodge. We had to move ourselves @ 8 AM in the morning and  didn't even get a cart for our baggage. to help us. All we got is a" sorry."

I have stayed at this hotel on several different occasions, over the years, and  have not had any of the problems that some other reviewers have claimed. I only know of my experience. Regarding my last stay, like previously, the hotel staff was professional, courteous and friendly. I had no bug or insect issue of any kind, in my room. The air conditioner, t v,  lights, worked just fine. The fan in the bathroom did not seem to be working any longer, so maintenance came by and fixed the issue. The microwave was clean, and in proper working order, so was the mini-fridge. Matter of fact, the mini-fridge was brand new and had a small freezer section in it. That was awesome. Fun to make mini ice cubes, and great for having ice water for the parks.  The hotel is an older property, but

Summary Heading: Except for the odor, cigarette burned blankets and noise...
Summary: Except for the odor, cigarette burned blankets and noise from adjoining units, would stay again based on price of stay.

This motel served ur purposes which was a safe place to stay close to Disneyland. It was a 5 minute walk to the free Toy Story parking lot shuttles that took is to the main entrance to Disneyland. The rate was great for a holiday weekend at $74 a night including all taxes and fees. The place is in serious need of updating and remodeling as the interiors are all very old and worn. The carpet wasn't dirty but it had obviously been shampooed at some point and they didn't get all the shampoo out of the carpet leaving it feeling sticky/dirty but without actually being dirty (our white socks stayed white while walking on the carpet). Free parking was included which in this area is a huge bonus. The free WiFi was so slow we stuck to our 4G data plans as it was a lot faster. Overall on

Summary Heading: The front desk staff was friendly. At first when walking...
Summary: The front desk staff was friendly. At first when walking into the room everything appeared as ok, but we quickly learned there were 3 light bulbs out, there was a space in the bathroom sink area where the wall is not painted from where a previous toilet was and there was a small patch of pink carpet to cover the hole from the toilet which was not even secured down. The ac unit did not work and neither did the phone. We had to use our personal phones to call down to the front desk. I do give them props for the hastyness of their mechanic coming in to fix the AC unit which was great, but nothing else got repaired.
The room was clean, and it was super close to the Disney parking lot where you can catch the shuttle
Good value for the area. Vastly inadequate parking. Overflow in Dennys, car has to move by 8am.
The room was clean and comfortable.  The bathroom was showing wear and tear but nothing too bad.  Location was a 20 minute walk to Disneyland.

Bad news - the hotel is in need of refurbishment.  GREAT news -- it was VERY clean and cheap.  Large rooms with 2 queen beds and extra space for a roll away or crib, small fridge & microwave, free breakfast (carbs only) and bus stop out front that takes you right to the entrance of Disneyland.  While this hotel is not for the picky, I just couldn't beat the price and convenience.  The fridge is VERY small, so pack smart (like in baggies and not containers).  The pool and spa were clean and greatly appreciated after a day of walking around.  The cleaning staff did a great job of respecting my wishes and the room was always clean.  The beds were a little hard, but they were clean.  Just down the street was a Super Target and lots of places to eat.

My wife and I just stayed two nights at this Inn.  We found it to be in a great location near Disneyland, A good price, the room was very clean with everything working.  The bed was very comfy and the TV is a modern flat screen that worked and had good sound.  The staff was very helpful too.  The breakfast was good with cereal, fruit, pancakes/waffles and fruit juice choices.  Just right to start the day.  No complaints.  It is also near the I-5 freeway.  Yes we would stay here again and yes we will tell our friends about our experience.

The hotel room was old and walls were dirty. There were lots of holes in the walls and the front door didn't close properly. It looked nice from the outside but the room was dirty. The only positive thing about the hotel is that it was very close to Disneyland

1st rooms assigned were old, moldy looking and the beds were hard as a rock. We asked for better rooms and were given rooms with better beds. The people next door had a huge fight in their room at 3 am, we called the office and they contacted them..finally settled down, but was very disturbing. Safety of clients needs to be a priority. It would have been nice to have some fresh fruit at the breakfast.

Summary Heading: no mini fridge- like my reservation saidcockroaches in...
Summary: no mini fridge- like my reservation said cockroaches in room blow dryer didn't work breakfast closed before posted time

Family vacation.  We had 3 rooms for 5 days 4 nights.  Rooms where old, moldy and 2 of our rooms had LOTS of cockroaches in rooms..  We informed the receptionist and she didn't believe us and asked us to take pictures.  So we did and showed her.  They moved us and only reimbursed 1 day for each room which I feel is not right.  I feel due to the stress we where under due to finding roaches in the rooms and having children in the rooms was disgusting and uncleanliness..  We had been offered to reimburse us and we can move to another hotel but where would we find a hotel to give us a deal for 5 days 4 night for 3 rooms in that same day.   So all they can do is reimburse us 1 day.    I WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.  ITS DISGUSTING AND UNDANITARY   I WILL ALSO REPORT

dirty table, towel, sink. Smell bad. No microwave and refrigerator. My slipper turner totally black after 4 days stays. No fruit and yogurt for breakfast. No hot water either. THE AIR CONDITIONER  SO NOISY AT NIGHT.  The bed is ok, consider clean.

We spent 3 days here to visit Disneyland and we certainly got what we paid for. Poor service and grotty smelly rooms. Pay the extra and stay somewhere else. There are numerous other hotels close by that offer better value for money.

Stayed for three days for Wondercon. Within walking distance of convention center. Carl's Jr. and Dennys close by.Parking was bad.Park when you get there and don't move until you leave.Surprisingly quiet for a family motel.For half the price of the "Official" convention hotel it was a good value.

We have stayed here several times when we've visited Disneyland, but we were very disappointed by our room.  It seemed to be rushed cleaned, soaps and towel seemed just tossed.  We were extremely disappoint to find cockroaches in the room.  They were all over the end-table next to the bed.  I even had one crawl over my hand as I reached for my cell phone to check the time.  Not enough ample parking.  So needless to say its going to be hard to want to return to this hotel.
Had to switch rooms as soon as I got to the property.  Paint was peeling all around the restroom including the paint on the bath tub.

The room at this Travelodge was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This location is within 5-10 miles of Disneyland, baseball stadium and hockey stadium. If you don't have a car or don't want to drive it offers shuttles to other places, e.g. Knotts Berry Farm. This inn is within 3 miles of many different restaurants ranging from fast food to very nice (and expensive) restaurants. Several of them are within walking distance.

We were double charged an one charge was for someone else's room. The railing fell off in my husbands hand while walking down the stairs with our 11 mo old child. There were gnats and roaches and the a.c. barely worked. There was paint missing and burns on the carpet from an iron. The sink was rusted and the shower barely spit out water. It was horrible.

Summary Heading: Disney and Good Waffles - that was the highlight of the stay
Summary: This was a very hard review to do as I am not one who likes to talk negatively about a place I have stayed.  The first room we were to stay in, the locking system on the door was being worked on as we arrived at the room.  Once maintenance left - we tried the door to find the handle and plate were still loose and not properly functioning.  We reported this and were moved to another room.  The AC unit in that room was not really working properly, but we did not learn of this until quite late (or early am) when it kept shutting off during the night while we were sleeping.  We had booked for one night with a great online rate, then decided to add a second night.  We were told we could not get the same online rate unless we booked it like that again - I think it was done through

Location and price were unbeatable, but upon entering the room you soon realized why the price was so little. The shower curtain rod was rusty, twice my towel had someone elses hair on it, throughout my whole 5 day trip there was long black hair stuck to my show curtain, there were paint splatters on the tile and carpet, there counter had glued glitter stuck to it. Other then those issues the cleaning staff di do a great job of keeping everything else clean. All and all I would rate the room a 2 out of 10, its the little things that hold it back from being a much higher rated room.

The adjoining door lock was cracked, the main door had a big pain chip, the roof had water stains the main door had to be pushed hard to make sure it locked, and there was a cockroach that appeared in the bathroom.

I chose to stay at Travelodge as it was the lowest priced lodge in the area. Luckily my room was close to the entrance and faced the road. So the view was not so bad. Inside, the room was fairly clean and had most of the amenities, although everything from beds, furniture to lampstands were sort of old and had the aged look. The continental breakfast was a poor fair and the dining area was not at all attractive to return. Certain stairs and landing, the laundry area and the elevator are not maintained well. It looks dirty. Although the central court yard is well maintained and pretty. The service is decent. I think for the  price the travelodge is a good place to stay in Anaheim area.

Decent enough place. Close to the convention center. Sheets were fresh and clean. The room looked like it was recently painted. WiFi in the morning was great, but pretty bad at night. At its worst it was still good enough to check email.  It's not a 4 star hotel. Furniture was kinda beat up, and there was an odd unremovable stain on the bathroom counter. They obviously tried to keep it clean and maintained. I think it was a pretty good value for the money, less than half the price of nearby hotels.

Summary Heading: Probably one of the best budget hotels
Summary: Ok so i stayed here for 4 nights for Disneyland and must say that, although the beds weren't what i was use to as i sleep on a sleep number bed, for the price it was the best choice.   It is literally .8 miles from the Disneyland entrance right on S. harbor OR a 10 second drive to the Toy Story parking lot which is my favorite out of the three Disney owns!   The room was pretty clean and didn't smell like most other cheap hotels do. i never had any trouble parking here but then again i didn't go during a busy season (i went from 12-18 to 12-23.  I loved the pools, well the hot tub anyway. clean and hot.  the breakfast was nice. mostly doughnuts and cereal with juices. typical free food.  A Denny's is RIGHT next door which is very nice as well a gas station so you never have to

Unfortunately, we didn't have a good experience.  We found hair strands ( not our color) on the blankets and bathroom towels.  Also, when we came back to the motel after a day at Disneyland, there were no parking spaces left.  My mother is handicapped, so this was definitely a problem for us.  When I inquired about this, the night manager suggested we park in the adjacent Denny's restaurant lot or park in a red zone, ensuring us that our van would not be towed.  Fortunately, another guest noticed our handicapped sign and offered their parking spot.  This was our second stay here, but I will not be staying here again.

Summary Heading: It seemed dirty and the appliances were dirty and need...
Summary: It seemed dirty and the appliances were dirty and need replacing.  The shower rod brackets were rusted and the bedding seemed dirty
Front desk stay was not very helpful in addressing my parking needs. The room had old childlike curtains and linens for an adult room. Walls had chipped paint and old TV.

I had kids knocking on my door at all hours of the night. Kitchen staff was very rude. Toilet clogged almost anytime anyone used it.  The last night we were there was a huge party and come to find out the staff was involved. Shower water would change from extremely cold to burning hot. Not a great choice.

Pro's: cheap rate, close to disney, large room with frig and microwave at no extra cost, free parking, free breakfast (very basic, but free). Con's: musty smelling, old, poor condition ie there was an area on the wall that looked like something fell off and below it a mismatched carpet repair, the carpet was dirty-my daughter's feet turned black after running around on it. A/C unit would not be sufficient if it were hotter. I really wanted to like it, but the smell and condition of the room made me feel uneasy-maybe it was just our room given to those with cheap rate??? For the price I didn't expect a lot, but just can't recommend. With a few repairs and smell remediation it would have been ok.

This Travelodge is conveniently located and reasonably priced. The beddings were clean and fresh and so were the towels. However....the sink counter was sagging and worse the sink emitted a sour sewer smell whenever the water was run. The appointments were dated, the luggage rack looked like it had been salvaged from a garage sale. I could live with that ,,,but the sewer smell, NO. Also a patch of water damage in the ceiling lstained black, made room musty.

Summary Heading: A place to crash after a day in Disneyland!
Summary: We spent three weeks at this hotel and found it to be quiet, clean and comfortable. This hotel provides good clean accommodation at a reasonable rates. The rooms are a good size, the bed linen and towels are fresh and clean and the beds extremely comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful. A free breakfast is provided, fresh waffles, pastries, toast and cereal are available which is great for a gobble and go before heading off to the various attractions.  There is a Denny's right next door providing 24/7 service which is very convenient. The pool area looked to be well maintained but it was too cold when we were there to use these facilities   There is a guest laundry, again this was very clean and well maintained.  There is also a lift and luggage trolleys available for your

Summary Heading: A great budget hotel for Disneyland guests
Summary: I initially booked this hotel due to it's extremely low rate ($57 before tax) and figured at the very least it'd be a place to sleep between days at Disneyland.  What I got was something a bit better than that.  This Travelodge, despite being a budget-oriented motel, is clean, quiet, and offers a comfortable night's sleep.  Furthermore, the room had a small refrigerator, a microwave, and a single-cup coffee maker.  On the ground floor in mid-morning is a hot breakfast that's included for all hotel guests.  On the downside, our shower (rm 333) was quite sensitive and goes from ice cold to scalding hot quite easily.  Figuring out a happy medium was a challenge.  Furthermore, there is no actual closet - just a wall-mounted clothing rack.  Also, while the sleeping/living area is

I was a little weary about booking after reading others reviews, but I was pleased with my stay. We were there seven days, for a tournament and Disneyland, and had no issues. The room was very clean, comfy, and had a fridge and microwave. The hotel is about four long blocks from Disneyland making the walk about 12-15 minutes. The area is very safe even to walk late at night. The ART shuttle stops right out front approximately every 20 minutes on the hour, but felt more like every 30 minutes. The breakfast was just okay. There are hot waffles, muffins, donuts, cereal, juice, and coffee. Would have been better if there was fresh fruit available.  There is also a Denny's next door. There are plenty of other places to eat that are close as well. The next block contains a Carls Jr.
The room rate was reasonable for the area.  The exterior was nice.  The interior of the room was really out dated and need to be upgraded.  Walls and carpet was dirty
It was great for the price! Clean bed clean shower and breakfast. All we needed to rest our head before going to disneyland

Summary Heading: Cheapest hotel by far I could find within walking distance...
Summary: Cheapest hotel by far I could find within walking distance of Disneyland. Rooms were fine - good value for the cost. Staff was nice. However, the continental breakfast was terrible.

We went to Disneyland this week and it was very close to the park. The bus would stop right outside the hotel to take you to the park. There is a Denny's restaurant next door for dining. It's an older hotel so wasn't much to be expected. Breakfast was nice, had hot waffles, coffee, toast and muffins. The only bad thing about the hotel is the parking. There are not enough spaces for the vehicles so the second night we had to park at the Denny's parking lot. That made us a bit nervous but our car was just fine in the morning.

A very easy hotel to find, was able to check in a little early on my arrival, room was quite big and didn't have too much noise distractions. The bathroom lights were not very effective and was not the best TV as the remote buttons had all been rubbed off and the channels were all over the place. Free car parking but not guaranteed a spot. Felt safe and very close to everything in the area. I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive place to sleep, shower and go to Disneyland.  Nothing more...and sometimes, that's okay!
Summary: Well, if you're wanting something fancy, plush duvets and fluffy pillow top mattresses, you won't find it here, but most know that going in.  The reality is - - it's a good deal price wise.  At around $41 a night, a person shouldn't expect luxury.  Most people are here to sleep after being completely exhausted at Disneyland.  That was us.  You spend the day wearing yourself out and anything resembling a bed sounds like heaven. (They're definitely not, but you're so tired, you probably won't care.  If you have a bad back...you might)  The beds are decent, well....they're okay, kind of bouncy, not totally hard, but you know the ones with the bedspread you fold down and get out of the way.  Pillows were fluffy and they give three per bed.  Bathroom is pretty musty. I knew it

I've stayed here a number of times and I am always happy with it. Walking distance to the convention center, Disneyland, food and shopping. It's always clean, easily accessed and I appreciate the complimentary breakfast and wifi.

The people were very friendly, the room was very clean, and it was very close to Disneyland. The price was great, I loved that there was a laundry riom and a list of places that deliver food late. It was a 5 minute walk to the Disneyland Shuttle which was perfect after a long day at the park. Our room was cleaned everyday and beds were very comfortable. The continental breakfast was very good, the only thing I did not like was that they require you to eat it in the dining room. The tv was a small tube tv, but there was cable. Next time we visit Disneyland, we will stay at this Travelodge.
I did not like anything that this hotel had. The room was an utter disaster and I was not happy about anything that was given.

I stayed here with my daughter, her husband and 2 children in a 2 bedroom suite.  It was disgusting and dirty.  The kids' feet were black after walking on the carpet for a short time it was so dirty.  The carpet around all the windows was soaked due to rain entering the room.  The entire unit had a mildewy, musty smell.  The continental breakfast was a joke with only waffles, white toast, 2 junkie cereals, coffee and milk.  Not even peanut butter or jam for toast.  During our 3rd night police arrived with guns drawn.  I would definitely NOT recommend this location.

Okay, if your really planning on budgeting and dont plan to spend to much time in hotel, great! but if you are planning on spending time in hotel, and like a super clean room..go eles where & save up for you trip. Pro's Disneyland close by, cheap, rooms good size, lots of food choices around. Con's room not so clean, old, beds and shower could be better. Like I said if your about budget fine, if your about great expericence move on.

I was coming to Anaheim for a job interview. My interview was at 3 PM, so I called about 1 week ahead to see if I could check in early so I could freshen up and then go to my interview. The lady on the phone was so nice and helpful. I got there about 1:30 that day and the lady that checked me in was so rude to me, never told me my room number  or where it was in the hotel just handed me papers and key. I had asked for a non-smoking room and got a room that could be non or smoking by looking at the paper work. I would say it was mostly smoking, for when I opened the door you could just smell it, so I left the door open for awhile hoping it would take the smell out, no luck. I left the a/c on hoping that would help while I was gone, still no help. It was just for 1 night, so I
We really like the Travelodge the only problem is there is not a lot of parking we came back late from our day out and we had to park next door at Denney's.  beds were good not rock hard.

Summary Heading: Our Thanks to housekeeping staff of room 229.
Summary: This Traveloge is very much like other Traveloges in their rooms, services, and value which are of 2 stars. Our family had 4 rooms  for 5 days last weekend while visiting CA. We are giving the hotel a 5 stars rating for staff honesty when one member of our family forgot her hand bag. We called the front desk to ask housekeeping to check the room for us and when we came back the housekeeping staff had found it and was handling it to us at front desk. It saves us a lot of headache without the loss of the handbag as everyone would know its consequences. Our sincere thanks to housekeeping staff for her honesty.

This hotel was booked for a conference with my company, and once I was able to look at some reviews I was not looking forward to the stay here, but during my stay I was definitely pleased with the hotel. The front desk area was nice, the staff was very helpful and the room was clean. It could have been updated more, the sheets and towels need replacing, but overall it was better than expected.   The one large negative about this hotel was the continental breakfast, if you could even call it that. No fresh food whatsoever, mostly all it was was bread for toast, donuts, a lady there making waffles which were terrible, and stale cereal. I tried it for one day and then went to Denny's for the rest of my stay. I would suggest adding more fresh foods to this, as it was not appetizing
In general, Travelodge is a good choice for those who travel to the parks and shopping, you just get there to sleep and take a good shower. Clean, safe, ok.

Summary Heading: Caveat Emptor! Dingy, Rude, Check your statements, and items left behind kiss goodbye.
Summary: Beware: 1.Check in=Asked for non smoking gave us smoking had to ask to switch. 2.Door didn't lock=security issue 3.Gap around door=noise and draft 4.Paper thin walls=noise! 5.Free parking=NOT guaranteed to be available. The motel reccomends illegally parking at Denny's next door but if you don't move it early next am you can be towed.Funny this is not revealed until after room is booked and prepaid and non refundable. 6.Staff=rude,accusatory, not helpful. From low level up to corporate. Valuable went "missing" from room and credit card charged for another nights stay 4 days after we checked out even though we stayed 1 night only. Treated like we were in the wrong even though motel was and they wouldn't even discuss refunding fraudulent charge until we got credit card company

Stayed at this hotel a little over a week ago. Our room had some issues as far as the door not locking properly and the large crack under the door that let in tons of noise. Room quality was probably around 2 stars but unfortunately, our iPad was stolen from our room, and when we notified the front desk, they said to call and talk to the manager about it the next day (the day after check out). Of course, this would make it pretty much impossible to get the ipad back so we insisted that something be done immediately, but the front desk had absolutely no sense of urgency and said they could do nothing (not even just call the manager to let her know). We called the manager to let her know and she said she'd look into it and call us back. She never did (and its been over a week).
My room was clean and quiet.  The breakfast good for continental.  The lobby staff were kind, helpful and easy to get along with.

Th hotel staff was friendly enough. The rate was very reasonable.  The room was okay, but could use a huge upgrade. It was just old and a bit dingy. The bathroom had some yucky holes in the walls and a standing room only shower. The toilet had a hard time flushing and actually clogged up a few times. The hotel staff came and took care of it in a timely manner.  The hot tub was broken, which was such a bummer. It would have been nice to soak in after long days in Disneyland. The pool had a pretty nasty layer of grim on it.   Just another tip for Disneylanders: the shuttle that comes in front of the hotel comes every 60-90 minutes, not every 20. That was pretty frustrating.
Clean, friendly, odor free, firm beds, small refrigerators and coffee makers in room, close to Disney Land, Denny's right around the corner, we would stay here again!

Upon arrival to the hotel and tried to check in, the person behind the desk rudely stated "check in time is not until 3pm and I have no rooms to give to you. It was only a little after 2pm, so I waited in my car until 3pm. When I went back, she already had my paperwork printed out, had me sign the paper, made just 1 key without asking how many I needed and that was it! It was a good thing we only stayed one night.

This location is great, walking distance from Disneyland parks, this is pretty convenient if you do not have a car, also the room is clean and enough space, bathroom is huge! quite at night, nice pool(I will use it if I come back during summer time), Dennys at the corner, breakfast is so good, you can have cereal, or fresh waffles, juice pretty good. I 100% recommended for families, group of friends, even for single travels.

Summary Heading: I have retuned on more then one visit to this hotel. Ithe...
Summary: I have retuned on more then one visit to this hotel. Ithe price is good, art line is located outside hotel. Would like to see more attention to a remodel of interior.  I will continue to return to this hotel

Summary Heading: Oh the highs and lows of the Travelodge..Pros- Cheap and...
Summary: Oh the highs and lows of the Travelodge.. Pros- Cheap and close to Disneyland           Good continental breakfast           Staff was very friendly  Cons- The beds seemed to be full sized rather than queen            Noise Noise Noise! The staff failed to stop the people above us from                 letting their kids run back and forth, back and forth for TWO HOURS at midnight the night before we left. We called the front desk three times and nothing was done (the desk clerk called them and asked them to quiet down but it didn't work- three times). I wouldn't mind as much if we didn't have to get up so early to drive home the next day.              The bathroom only had one light and it had a fan attached and it was LOUD. Like a helicopter landing in the room loud. I had to

. Never been to anaheim before. I only came here because it was recommended that I stay here. The price I had paid for the room was a bargain and it was close to Disneyland. Upon my arrival I had arrived about 15 minutes before 3pm. I was just so happy to be here. Upon my arrival the front desk staff had no personality, she just looked at me and said yes. I told her with a smile and asked if I could check in. She asked for my last name and stared at the computer for a few minutes. I told her I know check in time is at 3pm but wanting to see if early check in was available. I asked here while she searched for my reservations if the room could have 2 queen beds and no smoking. I was traveling with 3 other rooms and did not expect to be close together because looking at the

Summary Heading: Door left open by cleaning crew
Summary: First off I’d like to say I’d give the hotel a low 3 star rating high 2 star rating out of five stars but they had a major guest security issue when I went to the facility.  When we initially arrived the outside of the facility seemed to look pretty good. We were a tad early so we went out to the pool area to hang until our room was ready. We sat down on the chairs and they had a thick layer of dirt/dust on them and got our clothes all dirty. We had to wipe them down ourselves. Employees of the facility watched us and did nothing. We looked at the pool and spa and the bottom of those had a layer of dirt on it as well. Clearly this wasn’t an important part of maintenance.   We finally got checked in. The clerk didn’t explain anything. Just said here’s a sheet of paper with

Summary Heading: Great price, clean but older inn
Summary: Had a comfortable 10 day stay here. Beds good. Room was clean, lots of hot water, fridge and microwave. Helpful front desk. Biggest complaint was poor internet access. Average breakfast. Would stay here again

Summary Heading: NOT LIKE THE PICTURE AT ALL!!!!!
Summary: The outward appearance of the motel is nice. When we first entered the room it was okay, not as nice as the picture on the internet but okay for the price. When I entered the bathroom I noticed a brown smear on the door jam. Yes, it was poop! When I asked for another room I was told they did not have one. I then asked for some cleaner/bleach. I was given straight bleach in a ice bucket. so after riding in a crowded car with two young boys for 4hrs, I got to scrub down our room. I also had to take a spit ball the size of a golf ball out of the corner of the ceiling!  At least I knew it was clean. I was not given any refund nor asked if I was okay in the four days we spent there. I will not stay here again....GROSS!!!!

Summary Heading: When we returned from Disneyland Friday night and Saturday...
Summary: When we returned from Disneyland Friday night and Saturday night we had no towels in our room. I had to go down to the lobby after 11:00 pm each night. The neighbors next door to us were very loud late into the night.

I am not a huge complainer when it comes to hotel rooms because it's just a place to lay your head, however this was probably in the top 5 bad hotels that I have stayed at...The youth hostel in San Francisco was better than this. When we checked in the woman behind the desk was less than helpful to say the least.. She was on a personal phone call and sighed when we walked in like we were an inconvenience. The funny thing is the next night I went in to ask about a good pizza place with delivery and again she was on a personal phone call and threw a menu across the counter. I was guessing that meant she would recommend that place. The showers spit on you at best and that was if there was hot water. The heater/cooler worked when it wanted to, pillows were terrible like they hadn't

Summary Heading: Excellent value, great stay with a family of five! READ this!
Summary: I will start off by saying that we ended up with such a great deal! I have stayed at this location several times befire and never have had a problem! I am VERY PLEASED with the trip. For Disneyland visitors who wants to sleep/shower, this is your place, however, it was better than that, really - we had a great time.  Positives: -Check in was seemless. Counter staff was polite and friendly. As I checked in, I asked for 2 extra pillows, she radioed in to a maintenance staff and they were already in our room before we unloaded the car.  -Parking was fine. There was not one night that it was full. -Room was spacious. We are a family of 5; two beds in room and I brough a cot for the extra person. Plenty of space to walk around (room includes mini fridge (tall type), microwave, newer

Summary Heading: Worst experience so far with my room.
Summary: I frequent this motel quite a bit and when traveling with family, the room was subpar on many levels

Front desk staff neither friendly or unfriendly. Great to have a Denny's next door for a proper breakfast every morning because the continental breakfast is not so good looking. They offer toast, raisin bran or tony tigers, or some questionable looking waffles. I tried to sit down at a back table the one day (out of five) I went for a bowl of cereal and the lady staff member told me that I couldn't sit there because it was HER table. I thought this was embarrassing and improper because if she is up and about working, I don't know why she needs a specific table reserved for herself only. Beds are worn coil beds, but after a long day at Disneyland you will still crash out on them. Blankets are old and scratchy. We always travel with our own blankets/towels/pillows. If you stay on

Stayed at this hotel once before; Knew it was alright, decided to try it again, was about the same, except they got rid of GSN which is nice to watch while relaxing after a long day; Not a deal breaker, but it'd be nice to have again . No hot water issues this time around, The handle on the water temp was loose, no big deal though . Mirrors were clean, floors, bed, dressers, all tidy and neat . Brand new TV's so that was kind of nice . Overall a pretty good stay, I'll probably be staying here again sometime in the future . Hopefully they'll get back GSN by that time .

Summary Heading: The only thing I would complain about is the continental...
Summary: The only thing I would complain about is the continental breakfast is very small. Otherwise everyone was friendly!

We stayed here for 5 nights in November while having fun at Disneyland. We don't spend anytime at the hotel and just need a bed, hot shower and sometimes a hot tub. This hotel had all that we needed. We used the fridge for fruit and yogurt to supplement the limited breakfast items. Cereal, toast, juice, milk, waffles, donuts. Our room was a very nice size and very adequate, clean sheets, towels, etc. It does need updating but when they update then the price goes up. Had a parking spot every night close to the room. Used the hot tub several times - nice and hot after being in the parks all day. Check in/out was very easy, computer to check in and print out airline boarding passes and maid service great. We tried something new this time. We had free parking for Disney parking lots

There was a VCR in the room. The Cable did not work. The shower curtain was literally falling off the curtain rod- which was rusty and barely attached to the wall. The wall paper was peeling. There were holes in the wall where something was once screwed in. The heat/AC unit was old and very dusty; bad for my allergies and may kill an asthmatic. Breakfast was a joke. Blankets and sheets had stains - I slept on and in my own bedding as this bothered me. Room was topically cleaned but not truly clean. And there was a big, brownish yellow spot on the ceiling.  WiFi worked fine. Staff was nice enough.   WIll not stay again.

The hotel was fine. I probably would not stay there again because I was disappointed in the maid service. My make up powder was misplaced. I don't know if the maid accidentally tossed it or what. The rooms weren't kept that clean either. We stayed for 13 days so we did have lots of luggage but other hotels usually clean around our stuff. The breakfast wasn't the best quality but the attendant was great. Very kind and always made us waffles. She kept the breakfast continually stocked and fulfilled any of our needs!
This time the room was terrible. Mold on roof by the door, mold on bathroom floor, rust on fixtures.

great price, conveniently located across from Disneyland shuttle bus entrance.  I selected this based on price and continental breakfast.  continental breakfast-no fruit, yogurt or hot chocolate.  juice was watery.  room rug was dirty!  I will not return

Summary Heading: Good value, close to Disneyland, restaurant nearby
Summary: It's a 10 min ART ride to Disneyland, there's a Dennys next door, a 24 hour gas station store across the street. The rooms were comfortable, though the carpet was a little sticky, wear slippers, the bath towels were worn but clean. They provided continental breakfast. Overall, it was fine considering the location, price and we only stayed there to sleep since we were at the Parks the entire time. There's a pool, plenty of parking and the bus stop is right outside.

The non smoking room we booked was definitely smoked in, and the property did not have another alternative room.  The bathroom was tiny and the toilet seat was lopsided from a missing peg. The plugs were so loose that my charger would not stay in the socket.  I will never stay here again.

Was better than the reviews , staff were nice, room clean and well appointed , close to Disney and shopping , felt safe and we were sad to leave , the hot tub is good and a great place to chat to other families, pool was to cold for me but my son loved it.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel. Really close tothe Toy Story Parking lot for...
Summary: Decent hotel. Really close tothe Toy Story Parking lot for Disney. Friendly staff. My room was right by the stair well which made for a noisy night.

I won this motel on Hotwire and was weary after reading the reviews, but it was great! The staff was accommodating and friendly! I was traveling alone with two small kids and didn't feel unsafe at all. The rooms could use some updating, but nothing really major was wrong. We are going back at the end of October and I chose this same motel to stay at again.
The hotel was nice, clean and quiet. The only thing I would change is that I didn't have anything in my room for the TV like a guide to the channels other than that everything was great.

This travelodge was the first I've ever stayed at. It was nice. We got a one king room and it was big and clean. Their breakfast is good. Fresh waffles and donuts. Coffee and juices. The art shuttle right out front. Would stay again. Toilet didn't work that well. But they fixed it.
thank you for asking , we had a wonderful time everyone was respectful and helpfull.i would put you down as a great place to stay and would recomend it to my friends. good job thanks

Summary Heading: You get enough for your money.
Summary: We use as a family this Hotel, and we get this impression, good enough, close to many place of interest, many restaurants, clean, and well maintained. Only issue is extractor in bathroom very noisy, but I would back any time.If you look for a clean, cheap and well located hotel, this is for you.

Summary Heading: The room was clean, beds comfortable, staff helpful and...
Summary: The room was clean, beds comfortable, staff helpful and pleasant.  Was withing walking distance to Disneyland.  However, did not like the breakfast.  The selection and quality was poor.  The doughnuts were stale, and cereal choices were frosted flakes or raisin bran, yuk!  They did have waffles but they were doughy and tasted like wet cardboard.

I have gone to a lot of the bargain hotels around this area and this one pleasantly surprised me.  I was expecting it to be a little dingy and the beds supremely uncomfortable, which was not the case.  The room was clean and the beds were pretty good.  They weren't as hard as boards, which is how it has been in other places.  The pillows were pretty good too. The only complaint I have is the parking.  The lot is nowhere near big enough for the amount of people that stay there.  We arrived after Midnight and there were no spots in the lot at all.  The front desk said we could park in the Denny's lot next door as long as we had our ticket on the dash.  The only way to get there is to go all the way down the block and U Turn. After we parked, we lugged our stuff down the block back

We enjoyed our stay at the Travelodge. It was close to the theme parks and places to eat. It was a very noisy place though with lots of traffic. Parking was tough after 6 at night. The breakfast hit the spot in the morning and got us ready for our busy days.

Summary Heading: This hotel could use some updating.
Summary: This was my second stay at this hotel.  While  it is fairly inexpensive to stay here, I will pay a few bucks extra next time and stay at a hotel that is a little newer.  Beds were okay and the carpets were probably the cleanest part of the whole place.  The ceiling had stains and there was a spot near the vanity where something had been removed and when painted over, the paint did not match.  It would have taken very little effort to paint the whole wall.  For a few bucks, they could make some minor upgrades and have a really great hotel.  Check in was smooth, but the young man who assisted me was totally disinterested in his job.  While he was waiting for me to fill out some information and my credit card to go through, he was texting!!  Made me a little nervous that maybe he
Room was not cleaned or serviced. Had to always ask for towels and wash clothes. Breakfast was not good at all.

It wasn't a bad experience, though it wasn't the best . I was generally left alone by the staff which was nice, I don't like dealing with people to begin with; so if you're looking for a bit of solitude this' great . The beds were your typical Hotel Beds, Nothing special, those over washed pill covered sheets that every place has that nobody likes to use . The price was the best around and on such short notice as well, 2 week I believe . If you're simply looking for a place to come back after a long day and only wash/sleep at, then this' the place for you .

Summary Heading: Great Place for a Cheap Rate
Summary: For a reasonable rate close to Disneyland this was great.  Only 4 block walk to Disney.  Room was old but was clean.  The bed was comfortable and the staff where very helpful when I needed some advice about the area.  Breakfast was simple as to be expected.  I would stay here again.

I stayed for 6 nights, overall it was a great stay. Housekeeping staff ws very friendly. Parking was free, I had no problem with finding parking, be warned it is a small parking lot. I didnt use the pool, I couldnt get my room key to open gate, I saw alot of people using it throughout my stay. Wi-Fi was hit and miss in my room, but was good outside. The exterior and interior of the hotel need a serious remodel. I wouls stay again....Please remodel!!!
Hot water in the sink, but none in the shower; no TV guide; no instruction as to breakfast where or when.

Summary Heading: My overall stay was good. The beds were very comfortable...
Summary: My overall stay was good. The beds were very comfortable. Although the continental breakfast wasnt to my liking I would still recomend this Hotel.

This hotel needs to clean their carpets. You cannot walk around without shoes or socks on because your feet will end up BLACK. The water pressure in the suite room was awful; one minute it was freezing, the next it was burning my skin. The best part about the hotel was the price.
the shower was hot then cold then back to hot, never a consistent temperature ...there ws burn marks on the floor

Summary Heading: Room 102. Old ratty room. Bedcovers stained.  Paint pealing...
Summary: Room 102. Old ratty room. Bedcovers stained.  Paint pealing off bathtub.  Carpets to dirty/ sticker to go barefoot. Limited parking as I had to park next door at Denny's.

Good Hotel to stay when going to Disneyland.  We got very good service during breakfast.  Employees were friendly and helpful since I had never used a waffle machine. check in and check out was fast and made everything easier.

There were some things that were excellent: - friendly, helpful front desk staff - computer with printer in lobby, with fast Internet. - breakfast with 3 waffle makers!  All 3 were in use multiple times, with mostly families staying, visiting Disneyland.
