There were some things that were substandard: - middle aged breakfast attendant who blocked off all 3 waffle makers to make 6+ waffles to be carried out by a friend - very slow wireless in the rooms.  At times, even email was not feasible. - kids (?) stomping on floor in room above were easily audible  - first floor tub got backup when rooms above used bathroom.  This was mentioned the first day of a 4 day stay, but was still happening on day 4.  I would avoid booking a first floor room at the south end of the main building.

Summary Heading: It was My first time staying at Travelodge. My husband and...
Summary: It was My first time staying at Travelodge. My husband and I like the location. It was quiet, the room and bathroom were Clean. It was a good deal!!

Fridge in the room, microwave and coffee maker with coffee. Iron and ironing board, electronic safe. A/C was not working well and noisy. Beds were comfortable with 3 pillows on each, old TV with only local over the air content. Small pool and jacuzzi. Breakfast room modest with make your own waffles, donuts, 2 cereals, donuts, coffee, milk and 3 juices. Denny's next door. Free decent speed WiFi a huge plus Overall it was a fair room for a fair price and good for a family
2 faucet leaks. Fold-out couch broke. Dirty rug had tears. Room cleaned late in day. Bad mood staff

I stayed here on August 6-8. My family and I went to Disneyland and stayed here. To my surprise the hotel was nice as well as our room, decent for the price. Hotel is close to Disneyland; walking about 15min, plus the shuttle stop right outside from the hotel. Mayra at the front desk was very helpful when I checked in. The continental breakfast was good and the lady working on Wednesday was very helpful to my family and other people. She kept the breakfast area clean and organized. Overall I had a good stay and experience here. Location is great close to everything.

The location was great, only a short 20 min walk to Disneyland. The service was great and the rooms were very clean and quiet. The hotel was completely full ("no vacancy" sign on) and we did not hear much noise at night. The price for the room was very agreeable and the rooms by far exceeded our expectations.

Summary Heading: I didn't expect much...then they blew me away. Great stay.
Summary: A few of the reviews are misplaced.  There are 2 Travelodges near DL.  This one is far south on Harbor Drive. It is exactly 1 mile, with crosswalks and red lights, it is not a 10 minute walk.  I am catching up on reviews for this year.  We stayed here in January 2013.  I booked this on Hotwire.  We have stayed in 10 different hotels in the Disneyland area in the last 9 months (read my other reviews).  This trip was a quick return trip after being gone from Disneyland for only 2 weeks, my wife had the itch. I would only continue to go so often if we could reduce the cost greatly.  I usually run away from 2 star motels, and I expect that a 3/4 star is the minimum to make a memorable experience, but we booked this for $45/night.  We learned it was this motel after booking.  I read
Room can get a little small for many people yet nice and clean. Only complain would be the internet connection, noisy AC and half-broken bathroom fan.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Well to start, you really do get what you pay for.  My friend chose this hotel because she was being budget conscience.  It wasn't my first choice for hotels near Disney, but I let her chose it.  Upon arrival first impression was that the property was clean.  Seemed like all the hotels in the "Anaheim Resort" area had to have cosmetic upgrades so that they all were consistent with the Disney ideal.  Anyways, the "remodel" was very cosmetic.  The rooms were old and moldy.  The carpet felt spongy.  The door, to my room atleast, looked like it was reattached and there was a gap along the frame and door.  The room itself was spacious.  I had to do some rearranging of the tables and chairs.  Beds were comfortable enough, they did their purpose.  Bathroom, well lets say if you don't

Summary Heading: Great Value, Great Location, Needs Updates
Summary: We stayed here five years ago and both then and now the experience was actually really good. We walked to Disneyland and DCA (10 minute walk) and bought tickets at the hotel (they had them at the pre-increase ticket price!) so that saved us a lot of money. Room, hotel, breakfast room and pool were clean. The dirty part was actually the parking lot and exterior stairs/hallways. Other raters have noted dirty carpets in the rooms and it's coming from outside and foot traffic making the carpet dirty. Our carpet was fine but a bare-foot trip to the car gave me dirty feet. So a good pressure wash occasionally would help this.  The only real issue on our stay is that there is no soundproofing around doors so you can hear people in the hallway. Being next to Disneyland, expect a lot of

The location itself is good. 10-15mins walk from disney/with a bus outside. Dennys next door and gas station across the interesection.  We stayed four nights. During that time they removed both ice machines. Our toilet overflowed during the night several times and the front desk blamed us for it (lies given the other pluming comments here, they know) We also heard other guests complain.  Very basic breakfast. Two cerials. Toast. A few donuts. 7-10 which means choosing breakfast or magic morning if you have it.  Re: The toilet, when waiting for them to send someone I went and used the toilet next to the pool.  Someone had pooped on the floor, I assume the night before as I was the first person through the gate.  *** I'd have rated higher if I didnt need to pee in the bath my

Summary Heading: Great prices when you are on a budget at Disneyland. Easy...
Summary: Great prices when you are on a budget at Disneyland. Easy to get to the shuttle from the Travelodge. Needs some work. If you just want a place to sleep, get a free simple breakfast, and take a shower for your money this is the place.

Our room was clean and comfortable. The beds were in good condition. The AC was operating just ok. We would have liked to have it a little colder. The WiFi never worked for us and we tried over and over again to connect.

Walking barefoot in the room left our feet covered with a black grime.  It was disgusting.  Every time our 1 year old walked on the carpet, we would have to clean his feet with disinfectant wipes.  The breakfast was all carbs and sugar.  No fresh fruit. No yogurt.  No protein whatsoever.  The front desk staff seemed too lack any energy to fulfill customer questions/concerns.

Decent  stay overall. We were lucky to get a 1st floor room but there is a elevator if you don't.      Pros: Great Price, clean room, helpful staff, enough towels for 4 family members, decent breakfast (cereal, doughnuts, bread/toast, milk juices,) only a few blocks from Disneyland, shuttles to/from Disneyland, refrigerator and microwave    Cons: Gaps all around the front door and neighboring room door so it can get noisy, smaller parking lot, overflow parking is behind the Denny's next door

We read the reviews both good and bad.  We had no problems with the room.  Look at the price, it is what it is.  It was clean and plenty of hot water.  Not the Ritz, but not that price either.  A very good value from a seasoned Disneyland traveler.

Summary Heading: BAD BAD BAD front desk employees and management!!
Summary: I accidentally forgot a stuffed animal I got for my son from Disneyland on the bed in my room. I live in another state, so i drove back to the hotel after driving about 30 minutes to go search for the animal,saw that the cleaning ladies took the bedding off and didnt see the animal anywhere. Asked the front desk girl if i could speak to a manager about asking the workers if theyd seen the animal and the girl gave me major attitude, she was really rude. The manager told me it wasnt his place to ask any workers if theyve seen the animal at all but he could call the cops. I couldnt understand why he couldnt ask his workers a simple question and save me the time!! Then he asks me, a stupid question "was this more of a value(money) problem or was it sentimental." I said sentimental
I enjoyed my stay at the Travelodge and recommend it to others. Near Disney Land and the convention center with rides to LA mall and tours great eating around the area and shopping.

I used to stay at Travelodge all the time, years ago. Well this is literally the same hotel as it probably was YEARS ago. The only compliment--the office staff was helpful with check in and check out. Forget about the housekeeping--all they did was make the bed and empty the trash. They did not clean the floor. They took the used towels, but did not replace them with clean ones--we had to call the front desk to get more towels. One towel for 4 people??--crazy!!. We didn't even bother with the breakfast. The place is noisy, the walls thin. The rooms look like they haven't been upgraded in 50years. The toilet constantly stopped up. There was not even enough water pressure for brushing your teeth. We called for a blanket--we were told they didn't have anymore. There were 2 packages

Check in time was 3:00, got there at 2:00 with two young boys that had been riding all day and were tired. Told we couldn't check in until 3:00 even though our rooms were ready. Advertises a shuttle to Disney, no it's a paid bus transport. Rooms smelled awful with mold everywhere. Beds weren't comfortable at all. Only ice machine broken, then removed. Soda machine on our floor broken. The one on the 2nd floor worked, but sodas were hot. Continental breakfast not served until 7:00a.m., but first Disney bus left at 7:00 and early entry into Disney is at 7:00 a.m. So don't plan on eating at hotel. Just not a clean well maintained property.

Decent Hotel.Stayed for several days.First day we checked in Refrigerator did not work and toilet not working,but they fixed right away.Parking there Stinks they make you park next door at another business when it get full didn't like that cant watch your car.Breakfeast was really bad only cereal and donuts.They will not change your sheets until after you leave.Sorry but we will never stay there again.And the Graveyard guy is really rude,he gets great parking while the rest of us have to park at the business next door. Next visit to Disneyland we pick another Hotel.

Summary Heading: The carpets needed cleaning, needs better drainage from...
Summary: The carpets needed cleaning, needs better drainage from showers and toilets and the pool needed to be cleaned.

Being in the middle of the resort district I quite enjoyed my stay. My only problem with it was that I was on the third floor while their only wifi router was on the first so the wireless internet was really really horrible in my room, and almost everywhere unless I sat in the benches outside the front office. Being from Canada, its a bit of a pain cause I didn't want to use my Data on my cellphone to send most messages to get ahold of my friend who I was visiting for the week.  BUt other than the wifi I liked the stay and if I'm back in the area I will most likely stay again.

We just needed a place to rest our heads that was close to The Happiest Place on Earth. We paid less than $50 a night for this very clean hotel. Its not a 4 star place by any stretch of the imagination, but everything worked, the beds were comfortable, and the rooms and bathrooms were clean. There was an issue with noise, since the walls were thin, but we all had a peaceful night of rest. We were pleased with the value of the hotel.

I have stayed here before, which is why I chose it again. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff is very nice. We chose to use the stairs to get to our room because they were closer then the elevator. The banisters were very grimey.

No tub in the bath room.Shower was broken.Big bathroom.The room has an ironing board,safe and TV. If you are not going to spend a lot of time in the room,this will make a great place.Dennys is next door,Target is a 10 min walk.  A 7 min walk to convention center,10-15 Disney world. Small room.Cheep price. Great for a single male.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay. Nothing amazing, it's a nice room...
Summary: Decent place to stay. Nothing amazing, it's a nice room with a bed to sleep in. Of you're on the bottom floor, it's loud she people get home and leave in the am. The Internet sucks, go to the McDonald's down the street of you must have it!

Summary Heading: Surprised at the lack of maintenance and up keep
Summary: On this trip we stayed at the travel lodge in both anaheim and Costa Mesa.  I am surprised at the tremendous difference in the rooms.  The one in costa mesa was so much nicer than this one.  I am not one to complain but the carpet was musty and dirty and the facility just looked really worn out.   Needs much maintenance work.   I have been to little hotels in third world countries that were far better kept than this.   I am surprised.   On the bright side,  the staff were friendly and helpful and the location is great.

Started our one week vacation by visiting Ca adventure......made reservations here via southwests website. Bathroom had mold around the bathtub and under the toilet,the air extractor was so loud that it sounded like a freight train.........the a/c was loud waking me up at night every time the compressor kicked in......tv was old school with the remote control so filthy that I decided to hide so our kid would not touch it. One of our lamps light bulbs was blown... The linens were very stiff....the blankets were the type that movers use...really....they were so stiff and scratchy that we felt we were covering our selves with cardboard!  We got their late.... Got our room on the 3rd floor. Only one elevator for all the hotel.....you either take the stairs...our walk double the

Summary Heading: Find somewhere else for a fun Disney trip!
Summary: We spent multiple days trying to find a place to stay and settled on this place because it was close to Disneyland....that's all it had going for it. Walked in and was immediately greeted by ants everywhere which I could get over. Next morning took showers that fluctuated from warm to scalding hot which is scary to have my kids in. Went to the continental breakfast which consisted of cereal, toast and coffee....disappointing.  After a long day at the park couldn't get into our room because the cards went inactive during the day which wouldn't be a big deal but we had to park at dennys because there was no parking....this happened 3 nights in a row. Please do not stay here with a family, single is ok if u don't care otherwise look at the double tree across the street or something
I would highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling to Disneyland on a budget!  The staff was very friendly and made our stay very pleasant!

The room appeared clean, looks like the place needs a little cosmetic work. The only thing that I did not care for was their continental breakfast, it was not what I have always been used to. First, you cannot take any food out of the little food area. The guard dog woman that they had watching it was rude & scolded me instead of just informing me of their procedure. I happen to be in my 60's & do not need to be scolded. I am a early riser, so usually I am the runner to get some food & juice for my family. As a result, we never used the continental breakfast at all! That is probably the main reason that I will never stay there again, ever! Plus the fact that they didn't offer as much of a variety as most that I have stayed at. When I mentioned it to the front desk, it was

Summary Heading: No hot water, not accommodation for that : ( .....
Summary: The only complaint I have is that one day of our 3 night stay is we had no hot water therefore, I could not take my shower and felt yucky.  The hotel did not accommodate us in any way as far as giving me a night stay refund for the inconvenience in which to me was very important.  But, besides that, it was good.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel with very nice amenities
Summary: Our stay was very pleasant at this Travelodge which was within a mile from Disneyland, CA. The room was clean and had a microwave, fridge, and dining table and chairs. The bathroom was also very clean, with enough toiletries provided.  The staff was pleasant and did all check-in formalities quickly.

If you're looking for a cheap price this may work for you. Everything worked in the room, until the exhaust fan quit on checkout day. When we first entered there was a distinct musty smell that says the soft goods really need replacement. The curtains had a tear in them, the furniture has many nicks and scratches, the grout is discolored but the AC worked and overall the room is inexpensive and functional. Could be better but usually you get what you pay for.

This was our 3 time staying at this travelodge, the rooms are good size, always clean. It is such in added bonus they will add a microwave in the room for no extra charge, the staff are always friendly. I was also impressed to see the new and improved breakfast room.
I stay at travelodge trip to Disneyland to rooms are great, they come with everything any one could ask for at such a great price.

Summary Heading: Great price and excellent location!!  The bed was...
Summary: Great price and excellent location!!  The bed was comfortable, and breakfast was unlimited doughnuts, everyone's dream for breakfast...  If we are in that area again, we would stay here again!!  Two blocks from Disneyland, perfect walking distance!!

We checked out one night early due to roaches being found on my baby's clean diapers and in the bathroom.  The hotel refused to offer us any sort of compensation.  We booked through hotels.com.  They were only able to offer a small coupon as compensation.  Otherwise, we were very happy with the amenities the hotel provided for such an affordable price.

The room had more amenities than what I would have expected for the price I paid.  Free WiFi, coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator.  Walking distance to the Anaheim Convention Center, free breakfast (toast, cereal, donuts, beverages).
A great place to stay if you are not looking breakfast and pool, but without Enough parking places

Summary Heading: This was my third stay with travelodge international-- I...
Summary: This was my third stay with travelodge international-- I will continue to give them my business as they are reasonable, friendly and in a good location.

The bed was comfortable. The furniture was kinda of beat up.  The bathroom was clean,but had a lot of spots that needed repair.  When we got into the room we had to ask for soap and kleenex.   The room was clean.

Summary Heading: Room was clean, employees nice, showers are terrible
Summary: I felt like I got what I paid for.  It was a slightly musty smelling simple room that was very clean.  Parking is free which I like.  Front office staff are very friendly and allowed us to remain parked in the lot for the day after we checked out.  Hotel is a little far from Disneyland.  If you WALK instead of drive to the Disney Toy Story parking lot you can ride their bus to the front gate of Disneyland for free.  This will save you time, money and it's pretty close.  Also, a Denny's rest right next door.   The only complaint we had would be the showers.  Not a lot of water pressure and the water goes from perfect temp to burning hot to ice cold in a moments notice.  We did NOT enjoy that so take a SUPER fast shower before someone in the hotel flushes their toilet or washes

We arrived in Anaheim on Friday, April 19, 2010. Our room was fine at first inspection,then our grandson brought it to our attention that there were blood stains on his sheets.We removed the sheet due to the time of night. We also noticed that there were no hand towels. The next morning I reported the problem to our maid. She gave me towels and started to hand me sheets. I asked if it would be possible to replace all the sheets.The maid said that was fine. We stay at this hotel often. Im sorry I must report this problem.

Summary Heading: Poor hotel. Only to sleep even one night.
Summary: I found the hotel comfortable nothing. The room had no comfort, it was pretty simple. As I was almost in front of a bus stop was still very noisy! Just like the same check-in and check-out were very quick and efficient, but otherwise found the hotel very poor. The location is good as it is close to the Disney parks. There would be staying in this hotel again as there are much better options for similar prices.

Summary Heading: Great stay for what we needed.
Summary: This was a budget tight trip to Disneyland. So we were looking for some place close and cost effective. We were very pleased with the room. Hey it was no Hilton, but for a $50 dollar room, you cant go wrong.  we booked on line with no problems, when we arrived we asked if they had an accessible room available, She checked and they switched with no problem (We Rent Scooters). We were even allowed to check in early. the room was clean and the beds was comfortable.The room had a fridge and a Micro (when we called ahead, they said they do not have micros, We brought one just in case. So It might be a room by room basis?) We never made it to breakfast, with all the other reviews about their breakfast, we just brought our own. There is a Denny's right next door if you want a hot

Summary Heading: Excellent customer service but very slow wi-fi
Summary: The rooms are average and old but clean. The wi-fi is super slow!!! They need to upgrade their internet service. The breakfast is very limited and mediocre. I don't even eat breakfast here. There is only one elevator and if your room is on the other end, you better take the stairs.   Front desk staff are very nice and helpful especially Hanson and America. Myra is also nice. Staff has excellent customer service especially these three.

We are non smokers with children who have smoke allergies so we sought out a non smoking hotel/rooms. However our room smelled like cigarette smoke and there were smokers everywhere. There was even an ash tray right outside our room! Gross. If a place is non smoking they should enforce this. Another problem was the cleanliness of the carpet. It was so stained with spills and dirty that when my son spilled a little water and I wiped it up with a towel, the towel turned dark brown. I have a crawling Childs and found this so disgusting that I made him stay off the floor the entire time. This made our vacation very frustrating. Another big problem was that when we showered at around 9 pm, the water would go from freezing cold, to instantly so hot that I got burned, then right back
The baby in the next room was crying for a solid 3 hours.  All the parents would do was yell at her to shut up.  Would not had been an issue if the walls were not so thin.

Everything was great right up untill we left when we checked our bank account and were charged way more then the rate was supposed to be and when we contacted them to get it fixed we got little to no help and were told they would call us back but never got a call back.

Stayed here during our trip to disneyland April 8-9. Quiet and clean, friendly staff, a little bit more of a walk to disneyland than thought would be...especially after an all day adventure in the resort. Try taking shuttle...
The hotel had some pretty big room, came with Microwave and Fridge, also a pretty nice one. Even my friends liked the hotel.

Summary Heading: Although if was a perfectly fine stay while at the travel...
Summary: Although if was a perfectly fine stay while at the travel lodge. When requesting assistance in my room I had to ask multiple times. Also while I was there, their was a incident with the police and some quests I would of liked some information noting that everything was safe after they left. Also my other guests made it clear that the hotel breakfast although there was not enjoyable, their was no variety, appeal to eat their in the morning.also their was several iron burn marks on our floor and a broken picture on the wall, it made a otherwise lovely room seem unclean and cheap.

This was my second stay and was for 5 nights. The manager and her staff were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful both over the phone and in person. And I very much appreciated not getting the run around about rates and services et al, unlike at some places. I enjoyed this visit just as much as my first and did not have any problems in either case. The bed was nice and comfortable; sheets clean and the pillows were clean, comfortable and plenty of pillows at that (Which I totally love) Plenty of towels which were replaced everyday. The t.v. had a decent selection of channels to choose from. The A.C. worked just fine and so did the plumbing. The lighting in the room was more than adequate and was of proper wattage for each particular kind of lamp etc. The rooms have a nice

Exacstly what I expected. Great motel for the price. Breakfast was terrible and the walls are thin but the rooms are big and fairly cheap. The TV in my room was a out 15 years old but oh well. I'd stay again mostly for the price.

Hotel location was good as was walking distance for us albiet a longer walk than advertised. There was a mistake in the reservation and a smaller room than requested was blocked for us  Reception did correct the issue by giving us a suite with two beds and two sofa beds which was plenty for the five of us.  One very noticeable fault with the room was the sofa beds. There is no way anybody  could comfortably sleep on either. One was damaged beyond usage, an adult would have fallen through. The other was like lying on an old pile of springs. I had to build a matress using the four cushions from the two sofa beds so my daughter could sleep somewhat comfortably. The sofabeds are the reason for three stars, otherwise it would bw higher.

My family stayed at this hotel during our trip to Disneyland.  The hotel room was clean and lots of room for the 4 of us and our suitcases.  The continental breakfast was basic but that was expected.  There is a Denny's right next door so we walked over there to eat breakfast.  Lots of restaurants in the area.  We got a great price on our room for our budget!  We would stay here again!

Decided to book this hotel because we were looking to save some money. Location and cleanliness is big to us and it looked ok with the reviews and pictures. We were wrong. There was mold in the shower, paint peeling on the walls, 2 safes that didn't work, and bugs flying around. Plus woke up with a rash all over. The location isn't great and isn't well lit. The website says 2 blocks, well it was more than 2 blocks. We were told we could cut through Downtown Disney  and come up Katella and it would be same distance of a wall as to walk down harbor. It took 45 minutes to walk back, and with 2 kids late at light, that was horrible. We will not be staying here and will definitely pay more to stay on Disney property or one of the better Good Neighbor Hotels.

Our stay at the Travelodge was a very pleasant  one. Pros: The rooms were clean, beds fairly comfortable, always clean towels every day, room had a small frig and microwave  plus plenty of drawer space, nice and quiet in the later evenings. Cons: toilet handle didn't work properly but all we had to do was lift the handle after flushing so it was no big deal. Not many TV stations for choose from but we didn't come to Disneyland to watch TV so that was okay too. The wireless internet signal was pretty weak. The continental breakfast was fairly sparse but there was cereal, juices, coffee, donuts, and toast - would have been nice to have had some fruit. There is a Denny's right next door which was very good and showing your room key would give you a 10% discount on your meal.

This hotel looks like it was built when Disneyland first opened more than 50 years ago. It hasn't been updated, the floors are stained, wallpaper peeling, torn shower curtain, bedspreads appallingly 70s. The only good part was that it was an easy walk to the convention center.

My recent trip to Anaheim for the Natural Foods Expo West (March 7th-10th ) was an enjoyable event, but I can’t say the same for my stay at the Travelodge.  After getting checked in, I had to later call front office that evening since our fan was not working, nor a feature I could use, to have some “white noise” and to keep air circulating was not an option; therefore, hearing everyone come in from their adventures, became mine as well, eve though I wanted to sleep.  I called the front office to ask how to make the fan run for night, and a maintenance man was sent to my room.  It was impossible to communicate with this person, since his first language was not Engish, and he could not understand anything I was asking him about.   Also, during the first night’s stay, a heavy

Summary Heading: A decent value. Not the best accomodations in the area, but...
Summary: A decent value. Not the best accomodations in the area, but I'm happy with the sleep I got and the price I paid.

Summary Heading: ZERO WlFl--- and top Bed Sheet was badly Stained--2nd bed was clean
Summary: ZERO WlFl----Unable to send info to my Clients--TV had only 6 stations to view-  BAD  Glad I had 2 beds--1st one- the sheets were stained- I took Photo's- seemed liked my room 232--was next door to people renting by the Hour-lots of noise till midnight  lacked Food-OJ & coffee ok but -need banana's & Oat Meal--Good news Denny's nest door

Summary Heading: The rooms were very clean, the bathroom need a little...
Summary: The rooms were very clean, the bathroom need a little updating but for the price and location it was a nice stay for me and my family.

I have recommended your Hotel to everyone i know that is going to Disneyland you're walking distance and free breakfast are among the reasons why i stay at your hotel. Keep up the good work. Bryan Deister

internet was so bad,   we can log on for a few minutes and then its gone, try to complain to the desk but they said its limited, we cant stay any longer in the net. we didnt stay an hour in the net.and also the  key dont work after a day and the front desk said it might be near a cellphone, and I told them that the key card was behind my pocket while my cell was in front of the pants how could that happen.we couldnt open the door . its an experience way to stay there.

Summary Heading: Great Place for a Family get away..
Summary: Have stayed with them multiple times and every time we book here.. Very clean, friendly and spacious rooms.. Very convenient to the Disney Parks... Highly recommend this place and can't beat the prices

The best about this hotel is its location and value.  Our nights were comfortable and quiet.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  Continental breakfast should include more fruit, but it was adequate.  We would stay here again and recommend it highly.

The room was fine.  I think the shower is bit difficult to work, but someone from the desk showed me how to use it.  IHotel is close to the Convention Center, which is important for me.  I appreciate the free parking.  I will say that the Continental Breakfast was the poorest example of one.  It cannot cost that much to at least put out instant oatmeal along with the two sugar-filled examples that were there.

This was our second visit. While we could not get early checkin, the front desk did issue us a early parking pass allowing us to save the Disney parking fees. The walk to Disney is long! It takes about 10-15 min.at a good pace. However, if you care to wait for a bus (we didn't) the bus station is right outside the hotel. BONUS! And its very cheap. The rooms could use updating and I would not trust the old comforters, however the room itself was VERY clean. It was a relaxing large standard room, that provided plenty of room for the family. The walls are not thin and the air works great! As for the breakfast, its nothing special. They provided 2 types of ceral, white and wheat toast, a couple varieties of donuts, and crescents. There is also, coffee, tea, and very weak juice. Yet,

Summary Heading: Good value except for the breakfast
Summary: The location was excellent.  The front desk personel gave great services.  The breakfast was just cereal, toast, and nothing else, not even fruit.  Not even the OJ.  That:s was very disappointing.

Very good price compared to other locations considerinig its proximity to Disneyland. Ease of check in/check out was outstanding! Simple room with ok bathroom/shower but acceptable for the price for a sat evening that close to Disneyland!

Stayed here during xmas break, decent hotel, nothing fancy...rooms big, beds comfty, breakfast was ok, cereal, toast, donuts and drinks. This hotel is a few blocks from DL but close enough to walk, taxi's are 7$ and transit right out your door. Lots of restaurants around too. i would stay here again! if you are visiting on a budget this hotel is for you!! after all you are there to see attractions not to sit in your room all day!

Stayed here when my family and I went to Disneyland.  Had no problems what so ever.  Its conveniently located so that you can walk to Disneyland or if you want to take the bus, there was a bus stop right there.  Lots of restaurants within walking distance as well.  It was good enough of an experience that we are staying there again on our next trip this spring.  For the amount of time actually spent in the hotel during a vacation to Disneyland this is a good affordable place to stay.

Summary Heading: good place to stay if you are on a budget
Summary: we were on our southern california tour and this is where we stayed. overall i would say we had a good stay. the room was cleaned everyday, service was wonderful, our bed was comfortable,you have a good variety for their continental breakfast, only 15 min. walk to disneyland, and if you want the shuttle it's just right in front of the hotel, dennys restaurant is just beside the hotel, food and drinks are accessible within 5 min. walk from the hotel if you need to stock your fridge.we will definitely stay there again the next time around...

My family stayed here over the winter holiday this year, we had 2 rooms both had very comfortable rooms, that were clean and everything worked fine other than the wifi which was dependant on which part of the room you were in but never had a real strong signal. Close enough to walk to Disneyland. We took a taxi home from Disney every night for about $7 which was great because there were six of us and we could all fit in the vans, so it was even cheaper than the bus.

Summary Heading: Great for the Money and Location
Summary: My family and I have stayed at this hotel on 2 occasions now, and have had no problems. The beds are made each day, clean towels are always there when we arrive from our exciting day at Disneyland. The continental breakfast is fresh, basic and lots available. Its as close to Disneyland as you can get for the price, we have walked and taken the shuttle. I have never come across any of the problems these other reviews state. The hotel staff has always been very helpful. Great value for the money. We will stay at Travelodge again for our next Disneyland trip. If you are looking for value,and location, I would recommend this hotel, but if you want a 5 star hotel, you will pay 5 star prices. For my family, we go to see Disneyland, not the inside of a hotel room.

At 1:00 am we were woken to a man yelling "give me back my wallet" and loud banging on the wall. We tried to call the police at 911 but the phone is routed thru the front desk and they would not  put the call thru. In fact they refused to answer the phone. Very suspicious! After a while things settled down, we checked out, complained but to no avail. Very scary place to stay, and dangerous. DO NOT STAY HERE!

My husband and I recently stayed here while on a trip to Disneyland. Thankfully it was only one night because our original hotel we stayed at didn't have a room available for our last night there. So we thought for the value it shouldn't be too bad. The customer service was good. Other than that, the room was very dated and not very clean. I admit, my standards are pretty high, but this was pretty bad. The shower was very moldy, the carpet old and dingy, and the walls reminded me of something of a jail cell.

Summary Heading: Went to see Monster Trucks in Los Angeles
Summary: The fan is the bathroom was so loud it awhoke my husband when I had to go in the middle of the night.  The water pressure was so low it took 15 to 20 minutes to take a shower.  i will not stay at that travelodge again.

We arrived for our Disneyland vacation to the hotel, the night person was extremelly rude and not helpful. We go to our room which by the way is nothing like the pictures they post on their website. It was moldy, smelly very dated and old. The carpet had huge stains and it looked extremelly dirty. The hotel was booked so no other rooms available and after speaking with other guests their rooms were in similar condition. Their so called breakfast was nothing to speak of. I understand you get what you pay for, however I have stayed at other Travelodge hotels and at least they have been clean and neat. Never again will we stay at this property and I will tell all my friends and family to avoid at all costs. There are other hotels in the area in better condition and most importantly

We stayed at the Travelodge while on a bus tour.  The beds were clean and comfortable and we found the hotel staff to be very helpful.  Our room was very clean and we didn't have any complaints.  It was only a 15 minute walk to Disneyland but buses were available on a regular basis right outside the hotel for $3.00 a day/round trip as many times that day you wanted to go.  Breakfast consisted of toast, cereal, croissants and juice.  If a person was wanting more a store was located about 5 minutes walk where you could purchase other items  that you could put in you room fridge.  I would have no problem in recommending this hotel to others and in fact we will be travelling again in August of 2013 with plans on staying at the Travelodge once again.

Summary Heading: NEVER AGAIN! Gross, Stinky, & just plain GROSS
Summary: We will never stay here again. Far from Disneyland and they charged for shuttles service. The room was right next to the elevator. Their we're huge puddles of water in front of the door and window. The room smelled moldy and the decor was outdated. The beds were hard and sheets stained. The kitchen area was really gross! All the faucets were on backwards like other reviews state. And the water pressure was nonexistent. I told the front desk person it was one of the worst places and they did nothing to accommodate our stay. I would rather pay an extra $25 bucks to stay at the Howard Johnson like last time. Never again will we stay here a gain, Ever!

Summary Heading: Good location - exactly what we wanted
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights and even used it as a base to travel into LA.It is 15 mins walking distance to Disneyland, premises were clean. I was slightly disappointed iwth the offering for breakfast, one of the pooreer choices for a Travelodge.

Summary Heading: Did not even stay the night
Summary: First impression was the two druggies that were huddled across from the office. Second impression was the friendly employee that checked us in. There were many people hanging out in the parking lot, the shower barely worked and was stained, the sink controls were reversed and lighting in the vanity area was poor - hard to apply make-up for a Christmas party we were attending.. Felt so uncomfortable that we did not even stay the night.

Summary Heading: expected cleanliness for the value, good location
Summary: The sheets, while definitely clean, were stained, so on first contact that was a little disarming. On our first night, the shower stopped working, so we had to switch rooms, and unfortunately, no assistance was offered for this transition. Other than that, great location, close to Target for last minute needs, walking distance--10 minutes max--to park entrance. Good value for the money! Would return despite hiccups during this trip.

Stayed a week.Sheets were not changed until final day.Water took 10 minutes to get hot.Valve on shower reversed,had to turn to cold to get hot.Parking lot lights going off before daylight.and not coming on until way after dark.Heat lamp not working in bathroom.Last day on a Saturday they were going to paint outside landings on my foor,People had to jump over wet paint to get to rooms Made complaints of this and other items.Did not seem to interested to hear my complaints.

The location is close to the Disney bus system. Breakfast was fine and staff was excellent. The property has quite a few repairs that r needed especially the handrails on the stairs. The value is outstanding!

Great price from Hotwire. It was quiet from the 2nd floor on the building away from the street. Always hot water available, with bathroom supplies and a hair dryer. Free coffee. Refrigerator was spacious and cold. Reasonable location to walk to Disneyland Continental breakfast was good. Dennys is next door

Summary Heading: Worst customer service and room ever!!!!!
Summary: I could write a book on all the terrible things about this hotel but I'll keep it short. 1st night, multiple complaints about noisy guest, no resolve, 1st morning no hot water, second night ants covering our bed. Manegment refused to help us find a new hotel or give us our money back for our unbelievably bad stay. They never even said sorry!!! Please spend the extra cash and go somewhere else!!!

Summary Heading: Too far from Disneyland main gate
Summary: This hotel would be great hotel if you are travelling on a budget. However keep in mind if you have little ones you dont want to have them walk 20 min just to get into Disney. The breakfast was decent but we always ate a little in the park anyways because the general pastries you get in a continental breakfast get old really quick.   the room was nice and clean. The beds were a little too hard for me but thats just my taste.

Daily maid service was very poor. Things were not reorganized, and towels were not picked up and fresh new shampoo and soap were not replaced. In addition, front desk service was poor. Tried calling front desk, rang until the phone disconnected. Tried going to front desk, but no one answered my bell ringing. TV barely worked, only could watch 5 channels.

I love the layout of the property- one way in, one way out.  The rooms are nice.  The staff we encountered were all polite, attentive and helpful.  There's a Denny's conveniently located right next door.  We could've done without the traffic noise on Harbor Blvd.  Next time we will ask for a room away from the street.  Overall, we had an enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time out of your schedule to comment regarding your recent stay at our hotel. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us.  We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and we cannot wait to be of service to you in the future.

Summary: this is a budget motel, so I can overlook small thingsd, but what I can not overlook is safty issues.  Three things come to mind. First my wife is blind and we were on the second floor. One of the hand rails on the stairs was so lose i thought if any pressure was put on it would fall over, not good for a blind person. Two huge problems with the lighting outside. One night we left motel all the lights along the walkway and parking lot were out, the other lighting problem was that the light outside our room did not work, it is very hard to put the room key card in the loch when it is so dark.  other non safty problem was the TV only got 6 or 7 stations. I stayed at this motel about 7 years ago an d then there was none of these issues
Manager Response: I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying.  Our goal is to not only meet the needs of each and every guest we serve, but to exceed your expectations to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible.   Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us.  Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis.  In addition, please know that we changed the light bulbs that were out. We are also in the process of changing cable companies so that our guest can enjoy form multiple new channels.  It is our hope that you will give us another opportunity to serve you.  Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary: Reasonable price for a stay near Disneyland - nice to be able to stay close I hour spending a fortune
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel.  We are confident that our guest enjoy our property and the services we offer.  I hope you found the 5 minute walk to the Disney's parking lot easy going or that you used  the shuttle service provided by the city at such reasonable rates.  The best part of the shuttle is that it leaves you at Disney's main gate.  Well once again thank you for choosing our hotel and we hope to be  of service to you and your family again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great location near Disneyland and Orange with very nice staff.
Summary: Sfaff was very nice, They were willing to answer any questions and to help you when you needed it. The location and price was right for us so we would stay here again.   We didn't use any of the facitilies (pool, fitness room, internet, etc.) so I didn't rate any of these areas or services. .   .
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at our hotel.  We are glad that you found the price reasonable to your budget and most importantly found our well trained staff polite and helpful.  Thank you for choosing our hotel and we would love to be of service to you and your family again in the future.

Summary: If I hadn't of been so tired from traveling all day, I would have asked for a full refund and checked into another hotel. I decided to just stay despite the fact of the following things:  The bathroom fan vent didn't work The bathroom curtain rod had been ripped out of the wall at least 4 or 5 times and the holes were barely even "patched" up. The rod was partially pulled from the wall. The lid on the toilet tank didn't fit correctly and was for a different toilet, preventing the seat from being lifted completely up. The ironing board was dirty and stained. The hangers were completely rusted over. There was what appeared to be blood "splatter" on the wall above the bathroom sink. The table & chairs in the room were so banged up and scratched that they looked to be at least 10-20
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel.  I apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Please know that your feedback is extremely valuable to us.  Feedback such as yours assists us in improving our service and property on a daily basis.  In addition, please know that we are very sorry about all the issues in your room. If we had just been informed of them while you were here  we would have moved you rooms or sent our maintenance personnel to fix the issues right away.  It is our hope that this experience will not prevent you from coming back in the future.  We are ongoing renovation and hope that the next time you visit us, we will satisfy your standard.  Again, I apologize for the inconvenience during your stay and hope to see you during your next visit.

Summary: ROOM DESCRIPTION: 3rd floor corner room. 2 queen beds, table and chairs, large tv. Clean bathroom and linens.  THE GOOD: Nice average quiet, clean, rooms, pool and spa were nice.  THE NOT SO GOOD: Not as close to Disneyland as I prefer. Its walkable but tiring after a long day at the park.  I would return to this hotel, but only if I could not secure a closer hotel to the park, the price is low, and would be driving to get to the parks.

Summary Heading: Still Not Worth the Excellent Price I Paid
Summary: I'd stayed at this Travelodge several times in the past, and enjoyed my stays very much. This time I found the best deal I'd ever had there. I was so excited. It had been approximately four years since my last stay, and I can now say that it has really gone downhill. So much so, that I will no longer be a loyal customer. The clerk that checked me in was absolutely robotic. There were no pleasantries of any kind. Upon entering our room, we were unable to find wi-fi connection, so we called the front desk for assistance. They told us they would fix the problem. It took a total of three calls before we were finally successful in connecting. Our room's iron was also missing from it's place on the wall. We called the front desk to have one brought up. It never came. I went down to

The room was dirty bathroom lights were out and roaches crawling around counter ...woke at 2am to one crawling up my ARM .we were transfered to another room and in morning went to use shower and there was no water ......This hotel is a nightmare

Overall, the hotel was average.  The price was good for what you got.  For us, we were visiting Disneyland so needed just a place to sleep really.  The location was great!!   the only bad thing about the hotel was there were ants in out room.  We did not notice them until out last day.  My daughter was bitten a few times which is what lead us to start looking around more closley.
The stay was excellent.  The rooms were nice and very roomy for my family.  We received everything we asked for  ie iron and iron boarding right up to our room also extra towels.

my family of 4 enjoyed our stay at this hotel. the room we stayed in was big. my girls loved the breakfast in the mornings. the down sides: ac worked when it wanted too the maintenance guy move the knobs around and it worked for a few hours so I did the same thing when it stopped to get it working again. we had very poor WiFi signal in our room in the corner (233), the carpets were dirty and could use shampooing other than that, I felt we got our money plus some worth.

Now first, anyone planning on staying here do not except much. You get what you pay for. But the price is excellent on a tight budget and trying to go to Disneyland!   Yes, it's us am older hotel and is due for a little remodeling. Never had any major complaints.   Staff are very nice and friendly. FREE PARKING! Always a plus! FREE continental breakfast! It's just donuts, cereal, toast, coffee, and juice but a great start for the morning trying to rush off to Disneyland! (I've stayed at more expensive hotels that don't even offer free coffee and charge parking!)   Rooms are older but are fine. Bed is comfy. My one and only complaint is the toilets! They flood very easily!   Shuttle to the parks stop right in front of hotel. You can either buy passes from front desk, Best Western

Nice room, easy parking, friendly staff only 15min walk from Disney and 10 min walk from Garden Walk shops and entertainment. Also trips can be booked from hotel with pickup and drop of, Grand tour of Los Angeles and Universal two of the best. Dennys next door ok, Target store 2omins away for food and clothes, been here twice now. Dave and Irene  England U.K.

We stayed 11 nights and overall had a good stay (one night of loud neighbors--firecrackers?). Our 3rd floor room was clean and comfy, with 2 beds, TV (few channels), micro, small fridge. After all the walking at Disney I slept great! The coffee maker was not too good so next time I would bring my own. We shopped at Food 4 Less for breakfast/lunch items because my family wouldn't eat what they offered at the complimentary continental breakfast, it was too generic/diluted. I used the laundry center to wash clothes. We used the ice maker and the pool too. The pool is small but my kids still had fun. We used the Toy Story parking lot shuttle to get to the park, we walked there in about 12 minutes, and DR cast members always welcomed us. The ART bus is right outside the hotel. Good

Summary Heading: If it wasn't close to Disney, avoid at all cost!
Summary: We stayed here for two unfortunate nights and I cannot but discribe it as the worst place I have ever stayed at. We were in a junior suite with three kids who had to share a sofa bed. Although the room was on the back of the hotel it was extremely noisy! Especially noisie kids running around the corridors. Breakfast was served in a tiny room and the fat people, about 90% of all guests, loaded up their plates to rediculous heights and packing the rest for their lunch at Disney! Upon return the room had not been cleaned or any fresh towels put down. The safe was locked and it was impossible to make the receptionist understand that the instructions only showed how to set a new pass code not how to unveil the previous guest's code!! We left for the Lemon Tree, Anaheim, way better!

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for Disneyland trip
Summary: This is one hotel I will come back compared to the hotel we stayed in previously (Eden Roc Inn), the room was on the 3rd floor but it was a quiet night stay. The beds were comfy, bathrooms were clean, the rooms were much cleaner than the other hotel we stayed in. The downsides were that the ice maker was out of ice and they had ice makers on each floor but they had signs to either go to the 3rd floor or go to the main office to ask for ice. Also the parking was full and you would have to park next door to Denny's with a special parking pass but I was too afraid that my car would be either ticketed or towed, so the manager was nice enough for me too park in the no park zone for the night and with no problems. Breakfast was good enough for my family, my son loved his apple juice

This is one of the best hotels I have stayed at in my entire life! Especially for a 2 star hotel! Our room was very clean, had beautiful furniture in it. Bed was excellent. The bedding looked expensive, definitly better than what I have on my own bed at home! Lamps were impressive! Have to mention the lamps! They had plug-ins in them for extra outlets! Flat Screen TV. Carpet seemed new and very plush and soft on my feet! Bathroom is huge! No bathtub but if you want to soak your aching legs after a long day, there is a hot tub! There are very few channels on the tv but who cares? You spend most of the day at Disney anyways! Its about a 15 minute walk to main gate if you feel adventureous but the ART picks up pretty much right out front so that pretty convienient! The property is

I recently attended a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center and I needed a budget-friendly place to stay that was within walking distance. I booked this hotel for about $60 per night. The hotel looks like it has had some recent renovations. My room was in good condition. I thought the pool area, although small, was pretty nice. Safety was a big concern for me since I had never been to the area before, but I never felt unsafe at this hotel, nor did I feel unsafe walking to the convention center which is about a block and a half away.   The continental breakfast was sad, but the room rate was cheap - so it was no big deal in my eyes. I had a delightful bowl of raisin bran each morning and grabbed a better cup of coffee in the convention center each day. The staff was helpful

We stayed here during our vacation to Disneyland and the San Diego Zoo. When we arrived we were told that the only king they had left (we had reservations) was for the handicap room but that the only difference was the shower. The shower head holder didn't work. So you couldn't have a normal shower. The hotel also lists a Disney Shuttle among amenities. It does NOT have a shuttle it has a city bus stop in the front that costs $4 a day. You can't even buy the day passes from the hotel. You have to walk a block to another hotel to do that. We also went to the pool. The pool doesn't have a functioning security system. Any creeper could walk on in there. So keep an eye on that parents! Also this place isn't walking distance to the park either. At a brisk pace you're looking at about
Manager Response: We apologize that your experience was anything less than satisfying. Our goal is to not only meet the needs of each and every guest we serve, but to exceed your expectations to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. Please note that your issues will be looked into and the hotel will do its best to fix all issues. Once again we apologize for the inconveniences during your stay and hope you will give us another opportunity to assist you.

Summary: We booked four rooms for six nights, but we were all split up on different floors. The fourth night we were there, there was a problem with a prostitute next door to my sisters room. Just as soon as that problem was taken care of, there was YET another prostitute problem in another room. After speaking to one of the staff she informed us that prostitution was a common problem at this location. The wi-fi was horrible, the pool was not very clean, and very small, and the breakfast was sad. Oh yeah and there was only four channels available on our stone aged television!

After driving all night long with my 3 daughters and my wife we pulled into this place it looked nice from the outside, BUT!!! when we checked into our first room which was on the 3rd floor, it smelled funny. I went to use the toilet and was flushed, it started to over-flow very rapidly, which the floor filled up and started into the room at a pretty good rate of speed we were litterly rushing out of the room. Went to front desk they called maint. to try and fix the problem. They gave us a second room.  We moved  all the luggage, ice chests, e.t.c.  all the way across to other side of the hotel on the 3rd floor, Finally my 6 years old daughter went to take a shower and the tub was backed up, the poor girl was knee deep in water which didn't drain at all,dirt was coming out of

good price for a average room  clean comfortable bed in a safe main stret location we booked two rooms for our family to sleep in and that is all we required... a room to sleep in ...if you are  staying around Anaheim you will not be spending your day in a motel room ...so save some dollars stay in a locatio n like this ....as you will need the money saved for Disneyland.. etc

I went not really expecting much from this hotel, and that's what I got. So remember you get what you pay for! I read several websites before booking this hotel, and they differed greatly. It isn't two blocks from Disneyland. It is a 20 minute walk, but there is an Anaheim Resort Transit stop in front of the hotel. Passes can be obtained online before going on your vacation to Disneyland. $8(senior) for a 5 day pass was a great bargain. Hotel was not clean by my standards, but I am rather picky. Carpet obviously had just a quick once over. Bedspread had stains. Bath-tub leaked dirt on to the floor when it emptied.Door had a large space on the bottom and side of it. Breakfast is a "starter",cereal,toast, doughnuts if you get there before 8:30, coffee, tea. Must be in a

Priceline is our number one way to go when we head down to Anaheim for a quick visit to my other home...aka what you all to believe is the castle in the big DL (Disneyland)....well when our rooms are full of the beast's college buddies...we priceline a quick hotel and on our way we go! (hi ho hi ho).....  This time, we landed at the Travelodge Anaheim, a first "2 star" bid for us.  We got the room for 45.00.  We always go 3 star, to 3.5 star...so I knew we would be doing some big compromises in order to visit the mouse house at this price per night.  We checked in...the nicest people work the desks here, can I just say this first off?  The room: Blah...blah blah....horrid. Old, dingy walls, popcorn ceilings, and the POC (piece of crap not princess online comith)....room we were

Great for the price. The rooms were in need of an update but they were clean. Comfortable beds. The breakfast was sparce but it is sufficient. Not exactly walking distance to Disneyland if you have small kids.

If you want five star accomodations than pay five star prices. If you want a nice clean place to store your stuff and crash at night than this is your place. We have come several times now booking several rooms as we are a large group. None of us has ever seen bed bugs or had bad rashes. Maybe the people who make this complaints are not the cleanest of people themselves?  We love it and are already planning our next visit.

The room was dark and dingy.  I felt like I had step back into time by 40 yrs.  The bathroom was dirty and the grout on the tile was filthy.  The bottom sheet on the bed would not stay on and it kept rolling off the corner of the mattress.  The front door was not sealed tight and the light from the outside seeped through the cracks of the door.  I was not comfortable walking on the carpet or the tile in my bare feet.  This hotel needs a complete redo and updated with new paint, tile, carpeting, bathroom shower and sink.  The staff were nice and ready to help you.

Summary Heading: Average Place, you get what you pay for
Summary: This motel is an average place to stay but it's also very affordable & you get breakfast. Overall it's just a place to sleep. It's within walking distance of everything you want to access in Anaheim.

I am not a picky person. I know how to compromise for a good price. We have Disneyland annual passes so we have stayed at various hotels in this city for the last 20 years.  This hotel room had many problems.  The veneer on all of the furniture-worn off-scuff marks The curtain had a 12" rip.  Handheld shower head-down. Husband had to put a zip-tie to keep up the showerhead.  Coffee packs with no coffeemaker. Ice machine-not working. Wifi coming in and out every 10-15 min 3 large water stains on the celling

Summary Heading: It was ok highlight was Comfortable beds but  No Frills Motel
Summary: Very Large rooms,  Fairly close to Dland. Free parking Comfortable beds No problem with bed bugs   Fridge in room was very nice. New TV in room   The bad : When you closed the door to  the room it shook the whole floor.  You could hear when anyone walked up stairs or walked above you (Really loud).  Pool was un-heated and freezing.  Holes in sheet on bed.  Carpet dirty in room.  Heater/AC broken in room.  This travel lodge does not provide all toiletries so bring your own Lotion.  .we had to walk to front desk to request soap for room.   Breakfast was  either Corn Flakes or raisin bran, milk coffee tea toast and Jelly and some days doughnuts but some days there were no doughnuts.   Not enough places to sit in breakfast room.  Toys left in room from previous guest so I dont know

Summary Heading: Room was dirty, too long a walk to Disneyland
Summary: Didn't like this room at all. It was dirty, there was hair all over the shower from the previous guest. Not a good experience.

Summary Heading: Quite terrible but it suited us...
Summary: If you are picky, used to good quality, clean and quite rooms, nice breakfast - this is nothing for you. But despite the poor cleaning, yealling neighbours late at night, horrible breakfast, housekeeping that left our door unlocked (luckily noting went missing) etc we liked it. Why? The price was right for us beeing on a month long vacation with small kids. We got a big room with two comfortable queen size beds, free WiFi and parking, walking distance from Disneyland for only 50 USD a night. There are plenty of alternative breakfast options up and down the road and there is a fridge and a microwave oven in the room, so we went to Target and bought food there and kept in the room.  Since we travelled in december we did not try the pool.

Summary Heading: Good for a ONE night stay - BUT, we're ITCHY!!!!
Summary: Just like all of the other reviews, the rooms are outdated and it's pretty much a standard hotel. You do get what you pay for. We just checked out yesterday and stayed for 5 nights. There was an elevator and luggage carts which was nice plus. However, the front desk woman wasn't very friendly and when we asked for a room on the 1st floor she said they didn't have any available. I would have believed her but she didn't check and there were only 4 other cars in the entire parking lot.  The bathroom and vanity area was dirty or a little worn out and the toilet got clogged for us. We weren't the only ones that happened to because there were dirty, used plungers outside of the rooms. The shower head was disgusting and there wasn't any water pressure. Oh, and the fan that they have in

Summary Heading: Solid middle of the road hotel. Not high not low
Summary: Rooms are adequate. Could use some lighting updates. painted cinder block wall at rear of room/bathroom. Showers work but a bit rough. Bed sheets were clean and good quality, bath towels were pretty thin but clean. Carpets were a bit worn. Walls were very good at blocking noise. All in all it was fine. We traveled to area for amusement parks and spent our time there not in the room. If you are going to be at the parks most of the time this place is a good fit for the price. If you or the kids want to come back to the room and swim/nap maybe not. The simple cont. style breakfast was nice and adequate. Toast, cereal, juice. The woman running the breakfast was amazing. That room was spotless and the food constantly refilled. We priceline bid and got the place for $56 a night. Hey

My husband and I have stayed at several different lower budget hotels during our frequent Disneyland trips. We were very pleased with his hotel, it was clean and has a convient location. It is in a nice area, and I felt secure, as there is only one entrance and exit into the property which gave the hotel a private feeling. Our room was pleasant and roomy, and had a fridge and microwave. The pool and hot tub area are visible from both Harbor Blvd, and passing traffic in the hotel parking lot. Usually I don't feel as comfortable in a pool that is visible from the parking lot, but this one didn't seem to bother me as there are places you can hide from the view of passers by. We especially liked the proximity to both the park and to the Toy Story parking lot. We walked to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Could have been a whole lot better.
Summary: The front desk staff seems not to care for the guest much.  The room was dilapidated.  The breakfast was okay.  The pool is nice, broken chairs though.  Television barely got any channels, a couple local ones and TBS or something.  Sketchy internet, warned me that it was an invalid IP.

Hotel was close to everything.  Desk service was good.  Room: so/so at best, but safe enough. The price was right and location was perfect.  You save 20 percent by booking through their website if you stay for at least two nights.  That was nice!

We stayed here for 3 nights. We didn't see any bedbugs had no bites just a clean big room to sleep and relax in. Its right next door to Dennys close to all sorts of restaurants and super close to Disneyland. Check in check out was a breeze. The jacuzzi is awesome after a day at Disney.
Clean room, friendly staff, pool and hot tub area small, but not crowded. Actually better than expected. Would stay again. No problems with the free internet access.

Summary Heading: BED BUGS AND BLOOD STAINS IN THE SHEETS
Summary: My family and I checked in on July 19, 2011 at Travelodge International Inn (2060 s. Harbor blvd. Anaheim, Ca 32808 room 219) and by the second day of our stay rashes and itchiness began to appear on our arms, legs, and backs. We went back late at night and checked the room to realize there were bed bugs in our bed and blood stains in the sheets. I took a bug to the front desk to prove the presence of them in the room. I was told by the fronts desk clerk, Hanson,(July 22,2011) that we would receive a refund of our stay. To this date we haven’t received nor a refund or any attention what so ever from their behalf. Through out our two-week trip we were uncomfortable in our visit to California due to the itchiness and discomfort the bites cause, all this despite the medicated

the location is very good and close to Disneyland. We were able to walk there easily within 15 minutes. ALso close to park, shopping, freeway. Easy access. Breakfastss were disappointing. no fruit or yogurt, just starchy foods, donuts, bread, cereal. nice pool and hot tub. room was clean and comfortable and quiet. hotel is in the process of updating and new rooms are really nice!

Summary Heading: Pefect for a few days in Disney
Summary: My friend and i Stayed here a while back and the staff were amazing the room was very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We were not in the room very long because we did disney from open to close for 3 days in a row but it was a perfect place for fun. The hotel price was very very reasonable the breakfast was great and the shuttles to disney were even better!  I highly recomend this place!

Summary Heading: Second great experience we've had at this hotel!
Summary: We have stayed at this Travelodge twice.  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is very helpful.  The rooms feature a coffee pot, microwave, and refrigerator as well as a hair dryer which is handy.  The price is very reasonable and includes a tasty continental breakfast.  The hotel is conveniently located to Disneyland (about 2 blocks away) and the shuttle to the park picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel.  You can purchase shuttle tickets from the hotel desk.  There is also a Denny's right next door to the hotel and currently offers hotel guests a 10% discount.  The hotel features a small outdoor pool and hot tub, but we have never utilized them during our visits.  Huntington Beach is also a short drive away.  We have never had trouble with parking,

Summary Heading: Nice clean place to sleep after a long day at Disney!
Summary: I was aprehensive after reading reviews and even considered calling travel company to switch hotels.  I'm glad I didn't.  Was very pleased with our room (301), it was nice and spacious and had fridge and microwave.  Did a bedbug check as I do at every hotel I stay in and I'm happy to say there was none.  It is within walking distance to the parks but we cheated a couple of times and took the free shuttle at the toy story lot which is less than a block away and drops you right at the entrance to Disney.  The breakfast was typical continental but it was enough to get my kids going in the morning and even satisfied my picky daughter.   The only complaint I have there has nothing to do with the hotel just the rude guests who think it's ok to reach over your food to get what they

Summary Heading: Nice Big Rooms, very Comfortable beds
Summary: I have stayed in worse hotels. This one was actually nice and clean.  They cleaned the room everyday.  The Breakfast was perfect for those who do not eat much.  The only problem I would complain about is we had to activate our room key every day.  Other then that, it was quiet and nice.

Stayed there for 3 nights. Location was very convient. Hotel itself needs to be updated. Rooms are old. Safe didn't work, but we kept being promised it will be fixed but it never was.  Didn't use pool but many were using it. Continental breakfast was included but we never ate there. Cheap place to just crash.

Summary Heading: It was okay. You get what you pay for.
Summary: I originally booked this location because my boyfriend and I wanted to go to Disneyland for one day, then the next day we had a festival two hours away.. we didn't mind the distance we just wanted to be close to disneyland. All we needed was a place to stay that wasn't awful. Cons - 1. We didn't have a shower curtain our first night. Day 2 we told the front desk and they sent someone over to put it in. 2. The bed was hard as a rock.. although some people might actually LIKE that, the sheets were not soft or comfortable at all. They were like sandpaper. We had 4 pillows and only two were comfortable. 3. The continental breakfast was in a tiny tiny room and they didn't have any fresh fruit. 4. The ceiling sounded like it was going to cave in. We could hear the little kids running

The place was great! It was my familes fist vacation together and I wanted the most fancy hotel I could find of course! After a lot of convincing my husband booked this hotel instead, I went from looking at $130 a night to $41 a night  Best choice I ever made. We stayed for 4 nights and every day the rooms were clean very basic but it was fine because we were hardly there. The breakfast was perfect and the staff was very kind ,clean and proffesional. I truly enjoyed my stay and I spent the money we saved shopping! I will be back :)oh and my children were 9,5 and 3 so the bus that took us to disney picked us up and took us home it was perfect! thank you

Pricelined this one, and was pleased to discover it was a walkable, though longish, walk from Disneyland. Certainly nothing special, but totally adequate. Service was friendly, room decent,. The big dowsides were a "continental breakfast" which was mostly a limited selection of doughnuts in a very crowded room and too few parking spaces for the guests. But as a pit stop for Disney and Knotts, I'd stay there again.

The carpets were sticky, the bathroom door did not lock.. nor did it even CLOSE completely, the bathroom sink did not drain (and does not have an overflow either), the remote for the TV had batteries taped into it with cardboard, the light wouldn't stay plugged into the wall, the knobs were broken off the AC controls, the bed was lumpy and you would sink into a hole in the mattress.

This place is fine for everyone unless your picky. Only minor nuances would be that the toilet seat is for midgets and the continental breakfast has watered down oj, other than that it's fine. A few tips would be to put up the "do not disturb" sign when you go out during the day so none of your valuables get stolen if your not smart enough to take  them with you. Also throw your trash away by yourself, if you need towels get them at the front desk, who uses a towel one time?   Wear cheap wal-mart flip-flops on the carpet so your feet don't turn black, when you get ready to leave just toss em. I see people getting double charged or charged for things accidentally, reserve the room on a debit/credit card then pay cash. If they charge you for anything it's something you damaged.

When we booked this hotel I honestly have to say that the reviews of this place were a bit frightening- I thought we just booked a ghetto hotel.    I have to wonder if people write things on here just to scare others.  Relizing that you are paying a fortune for a room- then you go in already realizing that you aren't staying at the Ritz!  Knowing this then you are prepared for things not to be perfect- but for us it was perfect.  We went in reading the reviews of the employees and so we armed ourselves with kindness and we got nothing but kindness back from them.  They were kind enough to set us up with connecting rooms for our family with young children and teenagers.  The beds were comfortable, which we loved!.  Yes, the parking is limited- but it really wasn't a big deal- if

Customer Service:  Horrible Location:  OK Room Function:  Horrible  We got this room through Priceline.com.  They gave the Travel Lodge a 2 1/2 star.  I guess Glass in the windows, and a working door gets one this rating.  The room was fairly clean. (Needs to carpet clean around the edges. A common issue in hotel rooms.)  The Bathroom door had what looked like chips of paint on the door.  Then under scrutiny it was tissue paper particles. (I do not want to know why or how this happened.)  The bed linens were neat and clean.  The bathroom was clean.  Lighting is very discolored and poor.  Thee second time the toilet was flushed it backed up. I went to the desk and the representative handed me a cheap plunger and said good luck.  I asked when the toilet could be fixed and he said

Summary Heading: worst hotel we ever stayed at
Summary: First of all  i would not reccommend this hotel if your are traveling with family-especially with toddlers. The room smelled bad, the carpet was very very dirty-you could not walk barefoot without the bottom of your feet getting black. It was very noisy-u can hear everything from the outside. Parking was limited-if there was no parking available you had to park at a Dennys close by. " just hope that it wasnt full either. " The hotel wasnt as close to Disneyland  as they proclaim it is. The continental breakfast  consist of donuts , and pastries and flat orange juice. There also wasn't enough room for everyone in the breakfast area. What got us upset the most was that we left two very valuble items in the room and somehow they were not there anymore. My wife left her wedding ring

Short and sweet...place was nice, we only used it to sleep so it was satisfactory for that, the wireless internet did not work, which from what I read has been an ongoing problem, get it fixed. Walk to the parks is about 20 minutes but not a bad walk unless you have little ones than it might be to far. Breakfast wasn't great but it was average, danish, donuts, cereal, toast. it got us started in the morning so I would give it a thumbs up. Overall nice place but work on the internet, people book seeing the wifi and can't get on it once there,,not good customer service.

Summary Heading: Horrible, dirty, and they charged us extra!
Summary: I'm very upset with this motel. We stayed 6 days with 2 kids. After 2 minutes of walking on the floor barefoot, their feet were black! Every day there were long black hairs folded in and hanging from our towels. The room smelled horrible, and their "breakfast" is non existent. Furthermore, we get home from our horrible stay, only to find out that they charged our card $102.35! We booked through hot wire, and everything was pre paid. Spoke with Michelle who said that they mistakenly charged our card but they returned it same day. Skip to 5 days later, my bank says they haven't even tried to return the money!!!!  Don't stay at this motel!

Summary Heading: Ugh, the money saved wasn't worth it.
Summary: They boast that they're "2 blocks" from Disneyland, but the reality is that you'll want to take the $4(!) shuttle to and from the park if you aren't already used to long treks. The room itself was decent, but the bathroom could've been cleaner, with more lighting. The bed was not really firm so much as it was stiff; the pillows were flat; and the sheet wouldn't stay on the mattress, which resulted in horrifying mornings where my face was on the bare mattress. My friend's cell phone disappeared one night when we went out to dinner, last seen in our room. When she returned home from our trip, she'd found calls to Mexico in her phone records online. Hmmmmmmm...

While registering for a conference at the Anaheim Convention Center, I was a little annoyed that the official hotels were all in the $150-200 range.  I had to stay 5 nights and a thousand bucks was a little steep.  So I spent a fair amount of time looking up other hotels within walking distance.  I usually don't look for the cheapest option, but rather something that's reasonable in cost and has good reviews for cleanliness and service.
