None of the economy hotels and motels seemed to be consistently reviewed well, so it was a bit of a risk to choose Travelodge.  The good news is that I found it perfectly suitable for an inexpensive stay.  I've stayed in much worse!  This was a step up from Motel 6 and similar to a Best Western, Super 8, Days Inn - that sort of quality level.

We stayed at this Travelodge for two nights from April 21 - April 22 at room 115 and I was bitten by BED BUGS all over my face, arm and back!!!! The room is really dirty. It's not close to Disney as they claimed. It's about 20+ minutes if you walk fast. The so-called complimentary wireless internet isn't working at all!! Be aware of this before you make any reservation !!!! Not recommanded!!!

Summary Heading: There is SOMETHING wrong here.....it's the plumbing...
Summary: Most reviews posted already expand upon the pros and cons of this hotel.  The hotel is close to Disneyland and within walking distance.  There are many restaurants nearby.  There is a public shuttle that will take you to Disneyland as well. Parking is very much lacking.  The rooms are clean and basic.  The beds are hard. Breakfast is very basic - cereal, toast, donuts, coffee / juice. Doors are hard to close.  Overall it was a good budget stay and a great value EXCEPT for the plumbing.  We experienced water coming up from our bath tub late at night - smelly water with black floating things that came up from the drain.  Went on for about 2 minutes then finally receded.  Had to clean out the tub myself to use it.  As mentioned in other poor reviews - the toilets have flush

check in: young lady clerk who had the personality of a badger with hemerroids room : small bathroom,rock hard beds,heater / ac panel fell off when touched pool/hot tub : ok cont.breakfast : ok shopping carts in parking lot : to my suprise there were none location to Disney : a verrrrry long walk price : 42.00+tax...............GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR

Awful customer service!!! Checked in with a room booked for 2 people, and rude front desk attendant told me I had to take a room with one bed and told me I had to pay $30 extra for two beds!!! He also rolled his eyes when I asked for a non-smoking room. To make matters worse, he said he's the manager! I will NEVER stay here ever  again, and I advise anyone to steer clear for their own good! Dirty and disgusting, it's no wonder this place is EMPTY!

I stayed at this hotel from Jan 23rd-Jan 27th.  In that time one of my rooms had the sink back up so that the bathroom flooded.  I was awakened at 11:30am by dripping water.  I switched rooms that night and was kept awake by traffic.  I switched rooms the next day and was bitten by BED BUGS.  The manager has not returned my call and the hotel has been unreceptive to my pleas to address the situation.  BEWARE!!

Summary Heading: walking distance to disney land gate
Summary: near: disneyland gates, convenient stores, gas station, bus stops every 30mins (free ride to disney's gate) with a little pool, breakfast is just breads, muffins and cereals and juice, but its buffet =) kids will enjoy. good for your budgeted stay, rooms are clean, beds are big...really good for family. can walk going to disneys gates if you need some exercise. you can buy disnet tickets at the hotel and arrange some other trips to other nearby places...

We got this room for $40/night on Priceline.  I expected it to be a dump based on the star rating, but I didn't think it'd be as bad as it was.  Now, I understand that you get what you pay for, but this place was almost laughable.  The parking situation is a joke; cars are parked behind other cars, in fire zones, and anywhere else they can fit in.  The walls and ceilings are paper thin, so you are blessed with hearing every movement that your neighbors make.  The toilet had basically no flush, so (that's right) going #2 meant also calling the front desk to have it unclogged.  And finally, the best --and worst-- part of the stay was the thousands of long, black strands of hair sleeping with you in your bed every night.   (Are the maids losing their hair or what??)  The ONLY plus

Great location for traveling between LA and San Diego. Very helpful staff I had to have something faxed and need things printed off the internet and they were very willing to help me. there isn'e much to the free breakfast, but enough to get you going. I didn't have this problem but if you come back very late there may be no parking but there is a lot to be used next door. Would stay again!

Summary Heading: eh...you get what you pay for, i guess
Summary: Stayed here twice. It wasnt awful by any means but its not impressive either. Overall, the room was clean, but very reminiscent of an old 1970's dorm room than anything else. Its an old style motel hotel that has not been renovated to look modern. Personally, I would not bring a family with kids to stay here, but if a bunch of 20 year olds were looking for a cheap place to stay in Anaheim, this would do the trick (but there are far better options to look for than this place). The only thing to make this place better would either be a complete overhaul to the rooms, or just bulldozing the place and starting all over again as I imagine there's not much you can do to a place that was built in the 60s/70's utilizing the cheap and basic building methods that were utilized back then.
The hotel is not that bad. For some reason they did not have wash cloths. The lady at the front desk was very helpful. Her name was Shannon. Very helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for you review. We always appreciate any guest comments especially when they are good. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: When I booked this hotel room.  I wasn't expecting much.  I purposely booked the cheapest hotel room I could find around Disneyland because we were only staying for 1 night, and we could handle whatever it was for 1 night.  We went to Disneyland that day and then drove to the hotel around 1am to check in.  When we got there, there was absolutely no parking spaces.  Cars were parked behind other cars.  The hotel clerk that was hanging out outside smoking told us that we could park behind other cars and they would call our hotel room in the morning for us to move our car or we could park at Denny's next door but that we had to move our car by 7am.  Well, Denny's was out of the question for us, we couldn't even see the car from where we were, so that was out.  We just drove around

Do not stay at this hotel! Dirty, rude, not secure. Serious warning to women traveling alone!!!! Do not trust them with your credit card and check all statements as they will try to sneak charges through after you have checked out.  Police had to be called for hotel abuse to guests.

Our door to our room would hardly shut, we had to slam it in order for it to close completely and especially for us to lock it. I'm sure our neighbors loved us for that.  We were told that there was a year round pool and hot tub on the web site, one of our reasons for staying at this particular hotel. During our stay it was being maintained. I know maintenance is important, it was just unfortunate it happened during the time it did. It was just a huge disappointment.   Also on the web site it said that the hotel was walking distance (two blocks) from the Disneyland park and that it was close to some great restaurants that would accommodate us well.  We had someone in our party that was handicapped and could really only walk two blocks. Yet the complete distance to Disneyland or

Summary Heading: Nice basic hotel (You get what you pay for)
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim International Inn from December 27th 2008 through January 2nd 2009.  We contacted the hotel early to let them know that we would be checking in around 11pm on the day of check in.  Due to weather issues coming from Portland we were actually going to come in more like 4-5 am so I contacted the hotel to let them know that (I am glad that I did) When you come in at night the lobby is locked and they have a "night window"  It made me nervouse that they wouldn't let us in the lobby, however, we checked in just fine.  The front desk clerk said it was a good thing that we called in and told them we were going to be late because after 3am the cancel your reservations.  The room was very basic but that was what we were expecting.  The room was actually pretty
Manager Response: Most smaller hotels do use a night window for after hours check in. This is to insure that any information is kept confidential during the night audit. We do not mean to make you feel uncomfortable. Also, we no longer charge for safe keys. We try to keep the pool maintained year round to avoid any closures and sincerely apologize for you not being able to swim. We look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: Safe, comfortable, quiet, plenty of room
Summary: We stayed here 4 days, 3 nights on our Disneyland trip. We got a 2 bedroom with connecting rooms, 1 bathroom "Kids Suite" through Getawaytoday.com. There were 2 queen beds with a tv in the main room along with microwave and mini fridge. The adjoining room had a french door with bunk beds and another tv. This place was safe, in a good location. The front desk was very helpful. The room was quiet (we were on the second floor) and there was plenty of space for the 6 of us. The continental breakfast was great with a large selection of rolls, muffins, waffles, etc. This is a comfortable, safe place to stay for a family, not a luxury hotel.  We bought ART (bus) tickets, which are much cheaper to buy beforehand at $8/per person for a 3 day unlimited pass, rather than $3 per trip
Manager Response: We always like to hear when our guests enjoy their stay. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and we look forward to seeing you in the future.

Summary Heading: Inexpensive & Located Very Close to Mickey Mouse
Summary: Location and price are the key words to focus on when staying at this hotel. Only a few blocks from the Main Gate and near a few restaurants and right on a bus line. Overall this hotel is not bad, especially for the very low cost per night. The furniture in the room was a bit worn, but the mattress was pleasantly comfortable. The bathroom shower head was placed extremely low and the bathroom was not well lit. There is a cont. breakfast with cereal, donuts (sugar ones are really good) juice, and toast all located in a nice pool house where one can sit outside near the small jelly bean size pool. I would recommend this hotel to one who is more focused on spending their vacation dollars on the local attractions as this is a fine place to crash after a long tiring day. If one is

Summary Heading: Like staying in a dorm room...
Summary: I was not impressed at all with this hotel. It's in a great area, close to shops, restaurants, and Disneyland - but that's about all it has going for it.  The room is pretty standard (2 queen bedroom)...except that I felt like I was in my dorm room days again. The room was complete with microfridge, television that was losing its color, plain white walls (one wall being a painted white concrete wall), a small table, and tacky furniture and lamps.  There is free parking and you can keep your car there during the day while you go out. There is also free continental breakfast, but I chose not to even try it. From what I saw, there was a cheap assortment of 2 different kinds of cereal, juice, english muffins, toast, and unappetizing donuts.   The hotel was okay for a one night's

With all the bad reviews recently, I was afraid!  But at the price we paid in peak season, we got better than I tought, breakfast included.  In short, for the price, we got for our money.  The beds were comfortable (better than average), but not all beds were alike (we had 2 Queen beds, one was very good, the other was average).  The place was clean except that the carpet is few years old and it shows.  Doesn't smell, but it needs to be changed!   The room was nicely cleaned by the maid every day, the bathroom floor was done everyday (I could see the difference).  We asked for top floor room, they are usually nicer (less people go there), and we had a nice view on the street with the action!  (there is 1 elevator for the building)  Breakfast is Continental which means cereals,

We booked a great rate thru Priceline, so I wasn't expecting the best, but this place was far from it!  The hotel staff was rude, and they put us in a smoking room.  When I asked to switch rooms, they said no and blamed it on Priceline.  The room was clean enough, but just stinky.  The bathroom was very large, but the shower was a little scary in a Psycho kind of way.  No soap dish, some moldy tiles, etc.  There were also dirty rags outside our room for over a day. The other issue was the parking.  There is not nearly enough.  People were double parked all over the place, blocking other cars in.   So while I knew I wasn't staying at the Disneyland Hotel, I did expect a little better.  We've stayed at much nicer places for the same rate that are much closer to Disneyland.  I

I've never written a review previously but given our recent stay at the Anaheim International, I felt it was important to share our experience with future potential customers.  I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.   To begin, our service was horrible.  One employee at the check in counter with over eight people lined up.  This is also the line you need to stand in to get towels for the pool -- they don't have a towel rack at the pool so you need to wait about 30 minutes to grab towels while this one employee checks you in!  The hotel guarantees FREE parking.  Don't count on it unless you make you return from Disneyland early.  They do not have enough parking spots.  They will have vehicles park behind your vehicle should you be lucky enough (or cut your fun short!) which

The stay was fine at first until we came back from Disneyland and We had someone elses Phices in our toliet. We flushed it and it over flowed. We called up front and they said they couldn't do anything because everyone had gone home. He ended up moving us to another room at 1:30a.m. with a three year old disabled son and didn't even ask to see if we needed help. I asked for the manager name and phone number and they told me they couldn't give it to me. The rooms are very old and dirty. Carpets that turn your feet black. Ice machines that don't work. And Parking. They have more rooms than parking spaces. They park people in the disabled parking who are not even disabled. The way the park cars in there are a fire hazard. Good luck to anyone who stays in this hotel.

Summary Heading: They need to fix their internet, TVs, and update their website
Summary: There were a few problems.  The most glaring was that we didn't get the 3-bed suite that we reserved online on the hotel's website (the 2 Double 1 Queen Beds Suite), and their excuse was that the 3-bed suite was outdated and was supposed to be pulled from their website.  Instead we got a 2-bed suite, but to make up for it the staff offered us rollaway beds.  Second, the internet was down during our entire stay, and they had no idea when it would be back up.  If you wanted to use the internet, you had to go to the front desk and attach an Ethernet cable to your laptop, or hope your laptop picks up a wifi signal from another place.  Third, the quality of the TV channels were horrible.  Overall, the rooms and staff were nice, but these issues need to be fixed.

Location: 15 minute walk to Disney. Climate in LA is warm year round and the walk was ok. The walk is directly along Harbour Boulevard - we enjoyed the walk as we would walk our breakfast off before going to Disney. Returning we would be too busy talking about the fantastic day we had or stop off at a restaurant along the way. In any event, a cab will cost about $4 each way - a bargin. There are also buses - I think about every 15 minutes to the park.  Rooms: VERY LARGE, CLEAN AND MODERN. I dont have a bad word to say about the rooms.   Pool: Not much. However, I have yet to come across a decent pool in Anaheim. They are almost always located in the car park and tend to be small.  Breakfast: Good choice for a Continental Breakfast.   Nearby Restauarant: Dennys next door and open

My boyfriend and I were looking for an inexpensive place to stay in the Disneyland area.  We found that the Travelodge hotel was a perfect match for what we were looking for.  DISTANCE: It is a bit of a walk to the maingate for Disneyland and California Adventure.  Probably at minimum 15 minutes.  However, we are in our 20s and we did the walk with no problem.  There is also a shuttle right outside the hotel, up the street a bit, which you can pay to take you to the main gate.  CLEANLINESS: After reading reviews, I was a bit concerned since people either had great experiences or not.  I found our roomto be very clean. The rooms suffice with everything that you need, I found no stench, no grime or dirt, etc. It's a basic place, but for what you're paying, it's definitely

We booked this through Priceline for a 4-nt. stay and I will never book anything in Anaheim for less than $80/night, to assure we do not get this property again!  Upon check-in, we were met with two teenage girls at the front desk who were very unfriendly.  They informed us that we would have to pay a $50 deposit which would be refunded at check-out.  For a family on a budget this was not acceptable and nowhere on the Priceline website NOR the Travelodge website does it mention anything about ANY type of deposit.  But they were unwavering and charged us anyway...very frustrating when we only paid a $20 deposit for a Marriott in San Diego, which was refunded.  When we got to our room one of our sons went to the bathroom and came right back out to tell us that there was poop on
No complaints at all, front desk very helpful anything you want they get no questions asked, rooms cleaned everyday. Overall excellent place to stay.

Stayed here icw Disneyland half marathon. Room was comfortable, large bathroom, mini-fridge was nice. Comp breakfast was coffee/bagels/juice with poolside tables. Hot tub was hot! Staff was helpful. Good place for a value traveler.

This is one of many motels and hotels in Harbor Boulevard close to Disneyland. Rooms are clean and the hotel general presentation is good. Staff is very helpful. We arrange airport transportation in a few minutes and they also sell Disney tickets. It offers continental breakfast every morning. Just in front of the hotel is a stop of the ART system that takes you to Disneyland (side note, not as good as advertised). Only downside is the open-corridor configuration that makes the environment a little bit noisy. Not many additional services but good enough for just sleeping after a long day in the parks.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, good size, too far from Disney
Summary: Stayed for 3 nights in 9/05.  Room was large enough, parking was easy (spots right outside your room), newspaper delivered everyday.  Check in was easy, pool/hot tub were nice to have.  Now, the main issue I had was the distance from Disney.  It was about 25 minutes to get to the ticket booth.  This is TOO FAR to walk  after walking around the park all day!!   The Anaheim Shuttle that was offered was no better!   The pick up times were so sparadic.  A lot of time was wasted waiting for the  Shuttle (it was supposed to arrive every 20 minutes).  If you stay here, pay the $10 to park at Disney.  It's worth it!  Other complaint: continental breakfast was sad.  Food was not fresh, oj was half frozen and sour, coffee was watery.  Don't expect to get by on just this.  Wake up a little

We just spent three nights here during slow season mid-week at the total rate of $154 booked through a travel agency.   Check in was fine and the grounds are reasonably clean.   We were given our request of a non smoking king size room at the back of the property but told an upper floor would not be available.   Rooms open out onto parking area.   There is plenty of parking.   The room is large with a large bathroom but could really benefit from maintenance.   The carpet was stained in several areas and needed to be shampooed/replaced, the toilet was slow and the A/C cycled on and off continuiously making it hard to sleep.   Despite being at the back of the property we were still awakened by noise from Harbor Blvd.   We were not bothered by any noise from adjacent rooms.

Started off badly as we were driving from Denver. We had called the day before to see if we could check in early, was told yes. When we arrived we were told we would have to wait. Upon check in noticed they were doing construction on the building.  Trying to rest during the day was out of the question and with a small child we had really needed some rest. The walls are really thin so between the people upstairs at night and the banging during the day not real restful. The worst was at the pool, was talking to the pool repairman. The pool was very cold, he told us the filters had not been changed in quite sometime. A little later as our daughters were swimming I noticed black coming out of the filters, as they had turned the pumps back on I guess. Thank goodness I had noticed so

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for..........
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights and found the staff to be lovely but the rooms were very old. The plumbing was a bit of a problem, had poo coming out of the plughole in the bath one night, admittedly they sent a plumer straight around ( at midnight) its an ok place to stay if all you want is somewhere to sleep, dont go there if you want luxury.

Summary Heading: Was an Ok place to stay.
Summary: Stayed here for one night, because we couldn't get into our condo right away for our week long stay. Travelodge was an ok place to stay, but i would probably stay somewhere else next time.  The front office staff was helpful, and effecient. The room was not as clean as i would have liked. There was no vacuming done between the bed and nightstand for quite awhile. Old finger nails and bits of stuff accumulated there. There was a mystery footprint looking spot on the carpet at the end of one of the beds. The toilet seal looked loose? Nice little fridge in the room. Bathroom had vanity in the toilet area, with older children, it is a luxury to have them fussing over themselves outside of the toilet area, then others can utilize that space. The pillows were flat as pancakes. I just

Good location close to disney, a leisurely 20 min walk to park.  Good room facilities and free breakfast was good standard - may get repetitive if you were staying for a long period though. Pool small but nice, laundry facilities were good - especially as we had just finished a 21 day camping trip! Room was huge and we were able to park hire car right outside. Good places to eat close by - and we had a nice dinner in Tony Romas' ribs about 3 blocks up the road. Also there is a good store just across the road and you can buy park tickets at reception..

We stayed at the Anaheim Travelodge from December 3rd through December 6. The hotel room was decent. We got there before check in actually almost 2 hours before check in and they let us get in our room early.  Check in was a snap! There were two full size beds and a small 2 chair table there.  A decent size dresser and a tv.  The bathroom was small.. I wish the bathtub was a bit bigger.  After a long day at disney i enjoyed soaking in the tub.  the room had a fridge and microwave.  Which was very nice to reheat leftovers from dinner.  It also had a blow dryer and an alarm clock.  It was not a 5 star but definately not a dive.  we will definately be staying there again.  the rooms were clean and the continental breakfast was a nice added touch.   the best part was that the

My husband and I stayed at the Travelodge Sept 23rd through Sept 28th.  I booked 4 nights via Priceline vacations and a single night directly with the Inn, as we arrived very early Saturday a.m. We checked in and went to our room to take a nap from our red-eye flight.  The room was clean, everything worked, no problem getting a parking spot.  We did have a room that was right on Harbor Blvd., but had no problem sleeping.  One night we did turn on the A/C, and it did drown out the traffic, but the traffic wasn't all that bad.  We were on the top floor, and only heard the door open and close next to us.  The Inn is approx. 1 mile to Disney, so we chose to take the rental car, as parking was included with our park hopper tickets.  I would stay here again.

I stayed at the Travelodge in late August of 2005.  I booked my travel through the Travelodge website.   We had a room with 2 double beds, which was spacious and clean.  There are outdoor corridors to the hotel.  The parking lot is small, but we never had any difficulty finding a parking space (the hotel does state that they will find parking for you if the lot is full).  The continental breakfast is limited, but there is a Denny's right next to the hotel. **Big plus was the free wireless internet in every room!**  My only issue with the hotel is that they close the lobby down at 10pm.  We checked in at 1am, and had to do so via a "bank teller" type window.  It would have been nice to actually ask some questions about the area upon check in.    The hotel is less than 5 minutes

As a Disneyland annual passport holder, I stay at "Good Neighbor Hotels" often. This hotel is about 2 blocks from the park, is cheap, and has clean rooms.   Pros: 1. Very inexpensive compared with other Disney area hotels (avg $70 a night) 2. Clean rooms, simple decor, mini-fridge in the room 3. Due to distance from the park, is less noisy than other hotels on Harbor Blvd.  Cons: 1. 15-20 minute walk to the park. The shuttle comes every 30 minutes, but is not free. Shuttle pass bought from front desk ($5 I think per person).  2. No frills, no "Disney Magic" should be expected 3. Pool small, but decent jacuzzi  I would recommend this hotel for people on a budget and don't mind using a shuttle or walking a bit to get to the park. The hotel was clean and was not overcrowded or

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for no frills
Summary: Family of four (2 children aged 3 and 6) stayed for 6 nights. Our room was clean and comfortable, and was equipped with a fridge and microwave. Wireless internet access was available - a definite advantage since I needed to access emails and upload my trip photos to Yahoo!. Front Desk staff was extremely helpful and efficient : The first night we arrived, the floor-standing lamp was not working. I spoke to the front desk the next morning, and it was fixed by the time we return from our trip to LegoLand.  The second morning, the seat cover of the toilet bowl broke loose, I reported this to the front desk and this was fixed by the time we returned from our trip to SeaWorld. The third day, the toilet bowl was choked, we called front desk and housekeeping came over within 10 mins to

Summary Heading: Nice, clean hotel - good value for money
Summary: I stayed in this hotel from 15-22 Apr 2005 on a conference trip. The hotel is less than 10 min walk to the anaheim convention centre. Location is very convenient, with a Dennys restaurant and a small grocery store right next to it. My room was spacious, very clean, comfortable and well-equipped (with refrigerator, coffee maker, hair dryer). Free wireless internet access in the room is a bonus! The breakfast was nice as well (bananas, coffee, milk, bagel, bread, etc). All in all, I think this hotel offers excellent value for money.

Hotel is abt 2 blocks away from the park entrance. Easy to walk to the park or you could drive and park at the disney car park for USD 9 a day.  Rooms were big and spacious. We were very surprised to find that the rooms very really huge and it was clean too. Really value for money . After a full day at Disneyland , one would be greatful to come back to a spacious clean and comfortable place for a good nites rest.  B'fast consist of pastries and muffins . OK for the price you pay for the room.  Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting to visit disneyland on a budget !!

Summary Heading: Not a good place to stay
Summary: When we went it said free laundry services, well when we got there it was 1 dollar for washer and 1.50 for dryer.  The room was hot even with AC.  the bathroom above is leaking into our room, and the bathtub is falling through (cracking in cealing).  Only stairs available, unless you want to go to the opposite side and get the elevator..  Continental breakfast is just bagels and bear claws.  The spa is nice.  The room service is HORRIBLE, they knock on your room at 9 am when you ask the previous night for extended checkout.  Will NEVER stay here again.  Best thing about the hotel is the dennys next door they give a 10% discount.

Summary Heading: Excellent Location. Just what you want.
Summary: Family of 4 stayed in mid August 2004. Budget hotel, but all you need.  Breakfast included, pool and spa, excellent front desk, brilliant location. Four of us in one room at a Fantastic Price.  Easy access off Highway 5.  10 minute drive to Knotts Berry Farm (dont go on a saturday when locals have the day off).  1 minute drive to Disney - both parks entrance together. Walked another day - less than 10 minutes and save car park charge. Early arrivals seem to get diverted to car parks in Disney hotel complex - takes 10 minutes to drive there and another 10 to get shuttle back. The Travelodge is much closer than the Disney hotel car parks. WALK !!! Universal Studio 40 mins drive. Go on a sunday - no traffic.  Best stay for no frills.

We stayed here for four nights  22 to 26 July 2004.  Initially disappointd because we'd actually booked travelodge on the park via internet and arrived there to find out we were at the international inn.  Why the wrong pictures were used we do not know.  Then they did not honour the $5 dollar off per night voucher we'd printed off the website saying their $65 dollar rate was already discounted.  Our room was old but large and clean, and actually had a fridge and microwave.  Our minisuite at Flamingo Las Vegas did not have these.  The continental breakfast was also impressive.  The bad thing is that the showerhead in the bathroom was mouldy.   Obviously everyone goes to Denny's next door so there are queues there, and you still need to drive to the Disney parks. OK but will not

Rooms were clean and comfortable and the inclusive breakfast was good.  Also good laundry facilities and ice machine on each floor. Perhaps only downside for us was the location was perhaps a little too quiet at night! it would have been great to have had a bar or cocktail lounge within reasonable walking distance.

This was a great budget hotel. Rooms were very clean and serviced very well. Beds were comfy. In a great location and easy to get to Disneyland. Great Price for the service. The front Desk is extremely helpful and can fix any problem! I suggest you book your tours with them when you get there as they are cheaper and more reliable through them. Some tour companies just don't show up.  Good free breakfast and close to Dennys and Carls Junior. Very safe feeling at this hotel.  Definately stay there again!

Summary Heading: Great, Clean, nice little place to stay
Summary: Stayed here in May '03, very clean, King bed room was large. bathroom was clean and very large, room had microwave, fridge, hairdryer, alarm, remote. Denny's next door, close to Disneyland and many restaraunts. You can either walk or take shuttle to disneyland. Fresh fruit stand next door. Very friendly daytime staff. continental breakfast is good for a quick coffee, OJ, and danish. Am very skeptical when reserving rooms, But was very happy, and will stay here again. Prices were excellent!

Large Queen Rooms, Very Close to Disney, rates of $65.00 night, continental breakfast, juice, OJ, coffee, muffins, honey buns. The owners are very nice. The pool is great, with a hot tub. Very safe feeling. I just returned, and also stayed there 2 years ago. There are new beds, clean room, NO FRILLS, safe, and I was really impress by the room size. Next door to Dennys. The bath consist of a shower, zink inside bath, could use some update, but decent and clean. For the price, the friendly staff, location its the place to stay. I checked the internet for prices, then called the hotel and asked if there were any managers specials, and found a lower price by calling.
